description:
Here's one for you, East-Bay-ers!

Although I'm not very familiar with the East Bay, I know that's where many awesome people live -- people who can't always make it into the city for karaoke. So join me at Mel-O-Dees, my favorite karaoke place in the EB! It is laid back and usually we have the karaoke mic to ourselves! Also, it is very close to the El Cerrito BART station, which is an added bonus!

If you love singing, getting your drink on, or just enjoy watching others sing, please join me in El Cerrito! I look forward to seeing old friends and making new ones!

http://www.melodeelounge.com/el_cerrito_events.html
http://www.yelp.com/biz/mel-o-dee-el-cerrito


<Hosted with SFBA Karaoke group>

description:
This is a regular meeting of the San Carlos - Belmont Toastmasters club, a group of motivated individuals and professionals seeking to improve our public speaking, communication, and leadership skills.
Guests are welcome to stop by, observe the meeting, and learn more about Toastmasters.
We meet the 2nd and 4th Thursdays of every month from 7:30 p.m. to 9:00 p.m at the Barrett Community Center, Classroom 3, in Belmont, California. Please arrive a few minutes early to find us and to settle in.
Prospective members are always welcome to attend. There is no obligation to join.

Club website: http://sancarlosbelmont.toastmastersclubs.org/
Directions:
http://sancarlosbelmont.toastmastersclubs.org/directions.html

description:
April Elliot Kent

Living in Circles: Eclipse Cycles and the Birth Chart

Eclipses are often used in mundane astrology, but their cycles also offer rich insights into the natal chart. As eclipses move through the houses of the natal chart and aspect natal planets, they describe where you’re currently confronting developmental crisis. Which natal patterns currently demand your attention and willingness to change? When have you confronted similar challenges in the past — and how might you handle them more effectively in the present? The lecture includes interpretations of eclipses in natal houses and in aspect to natal planets.

April Elliott Kent has been a professional astrologer since 1990. She is the author of Star Guide to Weddings (Llewellyn, 2008), The Essential Guide to Practical Astrology (Alpha/Penguin, 2011), and the upcomingAstrological Transits (Fair Winds/Quarto, 2015). April’s writing has also appeared in The Mountain Astrologer and Dell Horoscope Magazines and in Llewellyn’s Moon Sign, Sun Sign, and Sabbats annuals. She is Membership Director for the San Diego Astrological society, member of ISAR, and served on the faculty of UAC 2012.

Find April Elliott Kent at: BigSkyAstrology.com
name: April Elliot Kent Living in Circles: Eclipse Cycles and the Birth Chart

description:
"I will show you 7 proven key elements to attract amazing women”.

So you can finally date and be in relationships with who you truly want to be with.

Stop wasting your precious time not getting what you want!

“Are you frustrated not being able to attract the women that you’re most attracted to?”

Or sick of being single, frustrated with dating and tired of being alone in life.

Then you’ll love this Workshop!

This workshop is right for you if…

· You feel like you’re struggling with HOW to meet the women your most attracted to.

· Too shy or lack self-confidence with women.

· Overcome by fear and Anxiety when approaching or asking women out.

· Don’t know what to say or talk about with Women.

· Struggle with going from hello to first date.

· Struggle with being your authentic self with women.

· Tired of being put in the “Friend zone”.

· Struggling with meeting women because of Low Self-Esteem , no confidence and Self Doubt.

· Afraid of getting rejected.

· Hiding your sexual desire for fear of rejection (quickies path to the “Friend Zone”).

· Feeling hopeless, defeated, given up on dating altogether.

· Sick of watching other guys meet women while you end up dateless and lonely on Saturday nights.

“Stop rolling the dice with your dating life!”


This workshop is about showing single man of integrity a proven roadmap that allows them to take control over their dating life once and for all by giving them the skill set, tools and qualities that women find most attractive and desirable in men. Something you must have if you want to attract, date and be in relationships with quality women.

In this valuable workshop, you will discover:

* The biggest mistakes that men make that keep them single.

* The #1 secret to attracting an amazing woman.

* The 7 essential key elements for attracting amazing, quality women.

Don’t waste one more opportunity to attract the women that your're attracted to.


Space is limited - Secure your spot now and make 2015 the year that you start HAVING what you want!



I'm looking forward to sharing this powerful information with you.

See you soon,

Tim


***FYI... What this workshop is NOT: teaching men low status pickup skills that are unethical and out of integrity.***

NO ONE ALLOWED IN PAST 7:30 PM.

Please bring with you:

1. Pen & Paper – There will be a writing exercise.

2. A water bottle if needed. There is a sink to fill water bottles but no cups are provided.

About The Facilitator

Tim Gallagher: Tim's passion in life is to help single Men to be more successful at meeting and dating women. He has spent the majority of his life in one way or another learning the art of Social Mastery and Connection. His extensive background, experience and expertise as an Neuroscience NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming) Practitioner allows him to provide his clients with much more than dating and relationship coaching, tips or techniques. What he offers is what he refers to as "Inner Game" personal transformation, allowing his clients to "feel" their confidence, masculine, personal and sexual power through integrated internal states. This unique process is both permanent and effortless, and allows his clients to naturally exude highly attractive qualities by just being their authentic selves.

Tim works primarily with those whom he resonates most with - men who possess strong values, unquestionable integrity, and a healthy attitude towards women. Through his dating and relationship courses and VIP 1-On-1 High-Impact Breakthrough Sessions, Tim offers something for any man who wants “Inner Game” personal transformation and to be successful with meeting and dating the women they are most attracted to.

For more information on The Magnetic Man Program, please visit www.magneticmanprogram.com or for Neuroscience Re-patterning, Limiting Beliefs or NLP, please visit my website at www.nlpsfca.com Unlock Your Full Potential and Start Living The Life You Love!
how_to_find_us: Please be respectful of the class and be on time, we will begin promptly at 7:30 pm. No one will be allowed in after 7:30 pm.
name: Men Only: Powerful Tools For Attracting The Women That You're Most Attracted To

description:
BenchMarks are a fun way to get to know people, even if you've been friends with them for years. Imagine going to a party, but instead of the usual "How's it going" "What do you do for work," type of questions, you got to ask anything that you were interested in. BenchMarks aim to get below the surface and have people really get to know each other.

A BenchMark is a structured social evening that is comprised of 4 different games based around communication. Through these games, people can give and get as much attention as they want, find out about more about the other people there, and let people get to know them, too-- if they so choose.
name: BenchMark in Brisbane

description:
Come learn about one of the most innovative educational experiences around. Designed for helping professionals to gain the insight, power and skill to guide people into a life built around connection, intimacy, and desire. All based on the practice of Orgasmic Meditation (OM).


We all want to feel more strongly connected to our bodies, our partners, our sexuality, and ourselves. OM makes it possible for anyone, man or woman, single or coupled, to harness the power of our sexuality, and embrace what already exists. We don't have to change anything about ourselves to access it; we just have to explore what's inside of us, while being in connection with another person.

Mixer, Q&A, and light snacks/refreshments provided. For more info, contact Chris (415)[masked]

New science techniques in the last 20 years able to measure consciousness, proof of "gut feelings" and explanations that make sense.

Partnerships for peaceful nations working together, at the grass roots level despite forceful intervention from leaders declining to be involved.

What could the O J Simpson trial, the Superbowl and a major catastrophy have in common ? Only one thing, Us ! we were all very aware of these and other events and they were measurable for amount of attention on a global scale.

NDE ? Stargate ? Remote Viewing ?

more,

This is not a religious event, no sales or marketing is involved, there is nothing subliminal, it is about empowering human nature and saving our world.

description:
Hey Guys,


Women are biologically programmed to seek out the healthiest, highest status male. This is not even their choice: it is a biologic imperative, as with all animals, that allows them to find the fittest mate. In the modern dating world, the two crucial markers of “high status” for a man are his companions and his presence. Every high status man has healthy male bonds, male companions who trust him, who have his back, and who connect with him deeply. Every high status man also has presence.


Presence is about the deep coherence of your core-beliefs and your intentions, of and your words and your actions. The man who is ashamed of his own sexuality lacks presence. The man who is stuck in the whirl of his own anxious thoughts lacks presence. The man who fully occupies his entire body and is unapologetically grounded in who he is has presence. The man who can survey the possibilities around him while relaxing in a place of absolutely calm confidence has presence. Nature is the great teacher of presence. We will explore presence in depth through practices such as Shinrin-yoku, or Forest Bathing. We will learn to sense INTO our cores, while holding awareness of the environment around us through meditation and mindfulness. By exploring bird language and our emotional ties to the ocean, we will understand how the connection to Nature promotes happiness and a sense of wonder. All of this deeply enhances presence, which will lay the groundwork for confidence and mastery in every area of your life.


Throughout history, men have gathered together around the campfire to set aside their daily rigors and commune with other men. It is a place where a man can put down his weapon, and simply enjoy the company of his friends, brothers, fathers and sons. Every man is equal around the campfire, and every man has the right to speak and be heard by his fellow tribesmen. We will partake in this time-honored tradition, and we will share our stories, our passions, and our vulnerability with each other—our spiritual kinsmen.


This retreat is about male-bonding and presence. Through these practices we will learn how to be present, grounded and more connected to ourselves while connecting with others, instead of losing ourselves in an attempt to connect.

What you will get:

• Presence

• Connection with nature

• Reduction of stress and anxiety

• Spiritual inspiration

• Connection with other men

This weekend course is part of the Unleashing Your Inner Badass Program. A program designed to help men step into their power as leaders both in life and with women.

The Badass program is for you if you are willing to:

• be coachable

• challenge yourself

• let go of being right

• be authentic

• be genuine

• be honest

• be vulnerable

We will only be accepting 10-12 men only as this is an intimate experience.

If you are interested in the course, please contact, Elizabeth Maria Cruz at [masked] or (415) 448-7218.

Sincerely,
The Badass Team,
Gregg, David, Mike and Elizabeth
name: MEN'S WRKSHP: Unleash Your Inner Badass: Women and Sexual Confidence In The Wild

description:
Now that some of us have had a chance to meet and get to know each other, let's get our creative juices flowing and start working on our art! Come connect, collaborate, and create in a safe space. Supplies are provided but feel free to bring your own. If you do use the supplies there, we just ask for a donation you feel comfortable with. There are several rooms to work in, so you're free to move around. There is Wi-Fi for those who want to bring their laptops. I'll bring some snacks. Use this time to engage in your art, explore new mediums, connect with other artists, share your ideas and progress, or simply work. It'll be very informal and you're free to stay as long as you like.

We'll start with some introductions, I'll give a brief tour of the studio, and then we just jump in! Come prepared to work on your individual art. My plan is to make these get-together's bi-weekly so we can set a regular practice in place.

**I believe we are midwives to each other's unfolding, and I want this to be a space where our creative work becomes manifested into the world. Each of us has something to contribute. But it requires showing up. This takes COURAGE and I'm here to support you on this journey.**

As always, if you have any questions or suggestions, do let me know! Can't wait to create with you all.

Creatively, Ann

[masked]
name: Creative Practice Sessions

description:
Tony Bennett & Lady GaGa

Jazz/ Pop legend Tony Bennett is teaming up with the queen of eccentric pop Lady Gaga, for a series of live performances including the Concord Pavilion on Thursday 28th May 2015.
The "Cheek to Cheek" Tour will see the pair perform solo and duets from the critical acclaimed album "Cheek to Cheek". The news arrives on the heels of a sold out New Years show and Albert Hall supporting the Wellchild charity!

This won't be the first time the duo have performed together, they often team up for swing duets and jazz material.

In a press release, Bennett says, “What I really love about being a jazz singer is that jazz artists are very creative, very honest, from phrase to phrase.” Gaga expl...ains, “We wanted to make something that sounded perfect because of the quality of the emotion…the honesty.”

Tony Bennett & Lady Gaga at Concord Pavilion

Tickets on sale now at www.ticketmaster.com.
name: TONY BENNETT & LADY GAGA AT THE CONCORD PAVILLION!

description:
Have you always wanted to write? Learn to write from your true self and discover your authentic voice. This workshop is a safe, nonjudgmental environment for discovering the stories in your life. Using free, associative writing (or your own writings) generate a starting point. Then develop it in any direction you choose: memoir writing, fictional autobiography, poetry, children’s books, short stories, novels, non-fiction, even internet blogging.

Publication and marketing options will also be covered.
We meet on the second and fourth Thursday of each month.
The fee is $35 per session with a sliding scale. $25 for the first 3 sessions. Drop-ins are welcome.
how_to_find_us: Coming from Bart go down California Blvd. Turn right at the Civic Center onto Trinity Avenue. Trinity Center is .1 of a mile up trinity Avenue. The parking lot is next to the Presbyterian parking lot and next to St Paul's Church.
name: Let's meet, explore the joy of writing, and discover your hidden creativity.

group.name: Walnut Creek Creative Writing Meetup: Your Authentic Voice

at Crown Memorial State Beach for beachfront yoga.

There are 10 spots and it’s $2 to save your seat (and help pay those meetup fees). The plan is to order lots of dishes, share everything and eat family-style. Try to bring cash so it will be easy to split the bill.

description:
Salutations Puppet Pushers,

We are going to continue our Captain Clawhand project each Thursday as well as additional days which we will discuss at this next meetup.

Notice that we are making it 7 pm once again so it is easier for those who have expressed a preference for an earlier schedule. Don't worry if you are late though, we want everyone who wants to participate to be a part of this.

J & I did an initial impromptu location scout at Dolores Park & we would like to share the unedited photographs of the location with you all in the hopes that it will get everyone as excited as we are about this project.

Keep in mind that it was getting dark; we plan on doing a proper scout with real cameras (these photos are unedited, as is, from phone cameras. We just want to give everyone an idea of how awesome this project is going to be).

I will post them in the pages area since that is the place to post photos to give you an idea of what a great location Nicole actually picked out for this piece. It ended up surpassing our expectations greatly!

We hope that you all will be as excited as we are & will join us on our next location scout with better equipment during daylight hours.

Thanks to everyone who participated in the Coraline screening. It was truly magickal & we hope that you will continue with us in our quest to create a space that is productive, inspirational & fun!!!

Remember to check out these first photos to give everyone an idea of the awesome location we are working with!!!

Also, for those who have had trouble opening the script we will have an updated version of the script this week in the Discussion area & Brian will create a google docs section that we can utilize for these issues.

Can't wait to see everyone!!!
name: CAPTAIN CLAWHAND---

description:
For May 28th we chose Matt Kindt's MIND MGMT Vol 1.

Reporting on a commercial flight where everyone aboard lost their memories, a young journalist stumbles onto a much bigger story, the top-secret Mind Management program. Her ensuing journey involves weaponized psychics, hypnotic advertising, talking dolphins, and seemingly immortal pursuers, as she attempts to find the flight’s missing passenger, the man who was MIND MGMT’s greatest success—and its most devastating failure. But in a world where people can rewrite reality itself, can she trust anything she sees? Collects MIND MGMT #1-#6.

Preview at http://www.darkhorse.com/Books/Previews/19-023?page=0

description:
Hi Everyone,

Welcome to our FinTech Open Mic Night series in San Francisco. Please join us for our monthly mixture of presentations, skype-ins, fireside chats and shout-outs plus plenty of networking.

This monthly session is designed to provide an opportunity to catch up with your peers, to see what's going on in the San Francisco and International FinTech scenes and to tell us all about yourself and your own work.

We'll be videoing the session as usual for those of you who are unable to attend. You may click here to watch the videos from our previous seminars and here to see the photos.

Agenda

Please be aware that the agenda is updated on a regular basis

7:00pm - Doors open

Refreshments and networking opportunities

7:30pm - Session starts

-> Welcome address

Alex Hill, NewFinance San Francisco Chapter Organiser

-> Presentations, Interviews, Demos, Shout-outs, Skype-ins...

Carolina Pascowitch, Business Development & Strategic Partnerships Manager, EBANX Global, removing the barriers for International Merchants to sell online in Brazil


Karl Sjogren, Blogger on The Fairshare Model, an idea for a performance-based capital structure for companies that raise venture capital via a public offering.


Steve Dekorte, lead at bitmarkets, Anonymous Decentralized Markets, two party ESCROW, free, open & uncensored

8:30pm - Closing

Shout-outs, communications, feedback and thanks

Further networking opportunities

9:00pm - Session ends

For those of you who would like to continue networking we'll retire to a local bar.

Cheers

Eddie

-------------------------------------------------------------

Thank you to our Partners:

The VAULT is a startup ecosystem in San Francisco. The VAULT is a society of innovative startups, where membership offers your venture the necessary support and infrastructure to thrive. Let us help your company jump start the journey to success.
name: NewFinance May Open Mic Night

description:
The San Francisco Amateur Astronomers hosts monthly star parties where they will set up telescopes and teach people how to observe the stars. We will join them this month to learn a little bit more about this marvelous universe we all live in.

This month's star party takes place outside the Exploratorium. They have adult only evening events there which we can join if we feel like it.

The Plan:

07:00 PM: Meet at Gott's Roadside for food and to meet everyone
08:00 PM: Head to pier 17 for the star party
10:00 PM: Go for drinks nearby

What to bring:

A warm jacket in case it gets cold

After the star party:

We can either go into the Exploratorium for their Thursday night adult nights which costs $15, or we can go to Hidden Vine which is one of my favorite wine bars in the Fidi.
name: [Embarcadero] Pier 17 Star viewing party [Free]

description:
Welcome to part 2 of our Thursday night 5e game. We are officially moving to the epic tale of Wizard of the Coast's Tyranny of Dragons. This is a two part adventure that will take us into some high level adventures by the end of book two. First off this is a well-supported campaign extravaganza by WotC. Here is their faq / online compendium to the module. You can watch the video to get you in the epic mood of dragon-slaying… or merely fighting and fleeing.

For new players, here's an overview of the game to help get familiar with the world, races, and classes. For everyone, the new 5e rules are out and we will be using them for this adventure.


Here are the guidelines to creating a new character:

• Start at level 4

• Follow the instructions on the book to create your character starting from page 10.

• You may either follow the rules to roll 4d6 and take the best 3 for your stats or take the array of: 15, 14, 13, 12, 10,8.


What to bring:

• Your printed character sheets, we want to keep this analog.

• A set of 7 die dice! You can get these online or somewhere like Gamescape.

• A pencil w/ an eraser and some extra paper.

Feel free to contact me, if you need any help making characters or have questions in regards to the meetup.

If we have less then three players, we will have to cancel the game. One to Two players just won't be a fun game for all involved and will require too much adjustments from the campaign material for the DM.
how_to_find_us: in the back, look for dice
name: Tyranny of Dragons

description:
Join us to 6:45pm for snacks, beverages and meet and greet before class!

Topic 3 of 8: (Don't worry, you can jump in anytime!)

Loyalty and Team Etiquette is different instinctively for a man than for a women. It is likely that the women and men in your life have noticed this!

Men seem to work within a code of honor that is not necessarily instinctual for women. As women who work with men on teams (at work and at home), we can learn about these differences to make work and play more efficient and peaceful.

Men: This is a great class to better understand your own instinctual team work. It is likely you will see yourself in this teaching and provide insight to the women in the class! By seeing the ways in which men and women view the inner workings of a team, you will be able to lead and support teams more effectively.
Men & Women: If you work with men, live with men, or interact with men, you will better understand how to effectively communicate, understand, and support each other while working on a team.

********************************************

WHO: All are welcome. This is a co-ed class with no previous PAX knowledge necessary.

WHAT: Free Co-Ed Class. Please RSVP as space is limited to 45 participants

Google Link to Directions to Central Marin Community Center

We suggest that you have paper & pen available to take notes.

********************************************

Janet is a coach, consultant, and trainer working with the human aspects of management, such as communications, team building and conflict management. What really makes her happy is her work as a Community Educator, teaching men and women to communicate with ease at work and in life by understanding our similarities and differences.

********************************************
Understand Men San Francisco Volunteer Team - We are a group of volunteers whose lives have benefited so much from Understand Men classes & PAX Programs so we host free events around San Francisco Bay Area to share this great, often life changing, information with others.
-----------------------------
PAX Programs was founded by Alison Armstrong and is the creator of the The Queen's Code Workshop(formerly Celebrating Men, Satisfying Women. For more information about Alison Armstrong's work, go to www.understandmen.com for more articles, audio recordings and weekend workshops.
name: FREE Co-ed Class: Learn How Men, Loyalty and Team Work Cause Mischief

description:
Hi climbers! We should practice indoors to hone our skills, meet good people, and have some fun on Thursday evenings. Let's meet to the right of the reception desk by the merchandise and pair off.

Bring the following:

• Harness


• Shoes


• Chalkbag (if you want)


• PG belay certification (can be obtained when checking in as well)


Let's get a good group of people to get our climb on!

Try to drop or change your RSVP, even if it's last minute, so that we're not waiting around for you. If you arrive late, either send a message to the meetup or go to the desk and ask for Ignacio (Iggy) or Denis.

description:
Join us for a fun group Swing dance lesson (mixed levels) Thursday night! We will get you comfortable & confident Swing dancing & take your dancing to the next level. Have a great time socializing while meeting new friends & enjoy lots of fun & laughter. Members in the group are always nice & friendly. We always have a lot of fun whenever we all get together with a couple of other meetup groups also invited. So join in on the fun! We look forward to seeing you there!

We will start with a quick meet & greet & intros at the "Shared" creative work space. Please arrive no later than 6:50 pm for brief announcements. Then, we will start the Swing dance lesson.

After the lesson, at 8:15 pm, we will we head over to Thai Basil a few blocks away. It's a fun, trendy restaurant that serves Thai food & drinks. Dress attire is: casual or anything goes! Basil Thai menu: http://www.basilthai.com/dinner_menu.pdf

description:
Join us for a "dinner and sunset show" in Tilden Park. Fingers crossed for a clear night.


Hike: a 4-mile loop with 1,000ft elevation gain. There is a nice picnic area at the top where we can have dinner/snacks/wine while enjoying 360 views of the Bay. We may get fog or we may get views, I never know what the Bay Area weather gods have in store for us. Here's hoping for a clear night.


Dress for cold weather. We should be back at the cars by 9:30pm, depends how long we take at dinner. If you hiked with me before, you know we tend to go slower than most meetups so we can enjoy the scenery and the conversation. Fast-pace hikers are welcome to join and run ahead - all I ask is that you please wait at all trail intersections esp. during night hikes!


Bring: water, dinner for yourself and snacks/sweets/wine to share if you want, warm layers, scarf, hat, gloves (it's usually windy and chilly at the dinner spot and we're not heading back early just because you didn't come prepared for the cold), and a headlamp/ flashlight/ flashlight app. We'll walk by Little Farm - bring some celery if you want to make friends with the residents.


Restrooms: There is a restroom at the trailhead.

Dogs: Sorry, no dogs allowed on this route :(


Kids: You can always bring kids on my hikes. I trust that you read the event description and can tell whether this would be a fun experience for them.

Attendance Note: If you sign up to attend, you will be counted on to show up. So please keep your RSVP up to date to reflect your intentions to join us. All members who do not show up will be recorded as a 'no show' in the system. Members with 3 or more No Shows will be removed from the group.

Waitlist: If you're on the waitlist, you will not be automatically moved into the "going" list if a spot opens up; you have to manually add yourself. So keep an eye out for the notifications/ emails from Meetup that a spot has opened up. Everyone will get a chance at the open spot, regardless of your position on the waitlist.


Questions? My number is posted above under the event location. Please call/text/pm or post a comment here should you have any questions about our hike.

DIRECTIONS AND PARKING

Click on the event location and a map to the meeting spot should open up. Whichever way you get into Tilden, follow signs for "Little Farm" and you'll find us. We will meet just before the gate for the Little Farm Parking Lot, where Central Park Dr meets Canon Dr. Please park alongside Central Park Drive, OUTSIDE the Little Farm parking lot. That lot closes at sunset and I don't want to risk anyone getting locked in.

<a href="http://goo.gl/maps/bxmvG"></a>

Please look up or ask me for directions AHEAD OF TIME. It sucks getting lost in Tilden with no cell reception (been there, done that). We will only wait a few minutes past the posted start time.
name: Dinner and sunset hike in Tilden Park
Thursday Practice

description:
Doc Wong Moto Ergonomics & Optimal Riding Position Workshop-May 28 Th night!


I'm really excited about this workshop because of the wonderful feedback!

Not only do you get the knowledge necessary to ride with more confidence and less pain, but I'll also personally coach you on your bike. This is an evening workshop and while we don't go out for a ride on this one, if you bring your bike, you'll get coached on it.

When: Thursday, May 28, 2015! 6:30pm-8:30pm

Place: Full Motion Chiropractic

Carlmont Shopping Center (Next to Baskin Robbins)

1021 Alameda De Las Pulgas

Belmont, CA 94002

(650)[masked]

How to register: just e-mail me at: [masked]

Cost: $0.00

This workshop is designed to help you make the necessary adjustments to your riding positons and to your bike to optimize your personal efficiency and comfort of riding your motorcycle in all conditions.

To achieve this, I'll be covering different riding styles or positions

on different bikes in differing conditions along with what needs to be changed to ergonomically fit your bike to you. Also, I'll cover the most common neck, back and wrist problems I see and what you can do to ride comfortably.

Riding Positions will include optimal positions for street, sport,

torquing, racing and dirt or dual sport riding. Which positions

produce optimum performance and which get riders into trouble along with which causes the most pain and what to do about it.

I'll demonstrate on a couple of very different bikes, a sport bike and an upright dual sport bike. That way I can demonstrate the range of riding positions and the range of ergonomic adjustments you can do to your bike. Find out how certain riding styles and poor bike setup can be hazardous and how to solve them. The end result is you being more comfortable on your bike with less fatigue and having more fun!

The ergonomics part of this workshop will cover how to adjust your bike to your body and style of riding. The ergonomics of different bike types and body types will be addressed and participants will have a working knowledge of what do do with their bikes adjustments.Optimize your bike for your riding style. Adjusting levers, foot controls, handlebar bar placements

I'll also cover exercises and stretches for you neck, back and wrists.

After the talk and demonstrations, etc., we'll go outside where you'll get on your bike and I'll coach you on body position and make suggestions on the ergonomics of your motorcycle.

Ride street, ride track, ride dirt, trials.....ride.....well!

Doc Wong

Chiropractor for Children and Adults

1021 Alameda De Las Pulgas (In Carlmont Shopping Center next to Baskin Robbins)

Belmont, CA 94002

[masked]

<a>www.docwong.com</a>

Free exams and consultations offered if you're having pain while riding or having neck, back or other sports injuries issues

Check out the stuff on the Doc Wong (Free) Riding Clinics on my web site! http://www.docwong.com

Note: Photos for "Doc Wong Crashes" are now on my web site.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

To get the latest announcements on my Riding Clinics subscribe to the Doc-Ride mailing list!

Email me at [masked] to request to be added to the Doc-Ride Mailing list!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Special acknowledgement and thanks to:

Keith Code of California Superbike Schools for his help and guidance and support. The Doc Wong Street Riding Clinics are almost all based on his works. Get his books and tapes on the subject, read them and apply them....your riding will be much better for it! www.californiasuperbikeschool.com

In memory of Gary Jaehne for his contributions to our motorcycling community!

Helimot Leathers: The leathers I use and consider the best! www.helimot.com
name: Doc Wong Motorcycle Ergonomics and Optimal Riding Position Workshop!

description:
Spring has sprung. Today it was 70 degrees in San Francisco which means...It is simply too hot for your turtleneck collection bub.

Want to get in shape for summertime?

Come have some fun, make some new friends and take advantage of our FREE personal training sessions.

What's the catch?


Our weekly training sessions are in fact free, but small donations are appreciated because...

25% of your donation goes to the Young Men's Ultimate Weekend, a local non-profit dedicated to turning young men into good men.

25% of your donation goes to W.O.M.A.N., a local non-profit dedicated to stopping domestic violence and providing resources for abused women.

Our personal training sessions are open to both men and women of all shapes sizes and sexual orientations. Feel free to invite a friend or two.

Why get fit? Fitness is directly tied to your self-esteem, confidence and feeling good about yourself.

Instead of running on a treadmill like a lab rat, Felix Conde is going to get you outdoors and burning calories while doing some pretty weird stuff (keep reading).

Felix Conde (above)

We offer modified exercises to accommodate all strength and fitness levels and I think I mentioned...IT IS FREE so there is no reason for you not to join us.

It is time to get fit. How fit? Richard Simmons fit...

Richard Simmons (everywhere)

Workouts may include but are not excluded to team log carries, rock throwing, tug-o-war and other highly primitive but fun team activities.


Get out of the gym, make some friends and get some FREE training. Don't be late or as always, you will have to "clean it up" with push-ups, sprints or air squats.

And be an AAAS man:

Always on time

Accountable to his word

Man of Action

Solutions Oriented

Again, donations are appreciated but it's up to you!

Either Mark Sanchez or Felix will be heading up the these Man Skills meetups and we plan to do them every week.

Ping me with questions,

Bryce

description:
Polished, consistent design and interaction in native mobile applications are like oxygen to humans. Both consumers and developers of native apps have very high levels of expectations in terms of how an application should look and behave. One common pattern to achieve consistent design and interaction consists of reusing a set of UI components throughout the application. The main benefits of this pattern are consistency and rapid development. One downside, however is that it makes it harder to visually validate the impact of code changes on transactions. For example, a small change to fix the interaction response or visually adjust a component on one page can impact multiple transactions within the application. And, when major OS updates arrive from Apple/Google, unexpected visual and interaction-related changes can occur.


To balance this out, developers need an automated way to catch visual regressions as OS versions change or code is committed. Multi-faceted visual testing also reduces manual QA time by eliminating the need for comparing one build against another and increases testing coverage by ensuring those less-frequently used parts of the application are verified. In this Meetup you will hear how we integrated visual testing into our build pipeline and learn more about the combination of tools we are using. We will also discuss the pros and cons of each tool and how to leverage their strengths.

Agenda

6:30 - 7:00 Networking

7:00 - 7:10 Welcome and Introductions

7:10 - 7:40 Speaker

7:40 - 8:00 Q & A

8:00 - 8:30 More Networking
how_to_find_us: 160 Spear Street 17 Floor, San Francisco, CA (Open Kitchen area)
name: Automated Visual Regression Testing and Analysis in Native Apps

description:
**Folks, I apologize but I will not be able to attend this meetup due to a work situation, however, Marv has graciously agreed to fill in again for me. I will see you all the the next meetup, for sure! Cindy**

PLEASE NOTE: Borderlands does not have wifi during the hours of our meeting.

Also, the Cafe has been noisy lately so please bring your headphones/ear buds if you need to shut out sound distraction!

Hey Everybody,

First, the reminders:

We are set up in the back of the cafe at the large table. Look for the Meetup sign.

Please check in with me when you arrive. Because we are in a public space with people who will not be there for the meetup, I won't know necessarily know you're there for Shut Up & Write.

This is a one hour session of focused, productive writing. No one will look at what you've written when the meetup is over.

Here's how it works.

6:40 pm - brief introductions ("My name is Cindy and I'm writing a ____").

I'll set the timer and we'll write for an hour.

7:40 pm - the timer goes off, the writing session is over.

People can continue to work, chat, or take off as they like. Borderlands closes at 8:00 pm.

PLEASE NOTE: There are a few electrical outlets which isn't usually a problem for those who need to charge but you might want to make sure you have enough battery power to be on the safe side. AND: Parking can be challenging, so use public transit if possible or leave plenty of time to find a spot; there's more parking south of Valencia if you don't mind walking a few blocks.

I look forward to seeing you all on Thursday for another productive session.

Thanks,

Cindy
Your Organizer
name: Shut Up and Write! Mission SF (Borderlands Cafe/870 Valencia St)

description:

~~~

This is a weekly 2 hour class that takes place at Sandbox Suites Union Square.

~~~

Finance is a powerful global force and valuation lies at its core. Valuation makes or breaks a company. It is critical to understand valuation as an investor, entrepreneur, consultant and employee.

More than likely your next big opportunity will come form a startup or a small business and Finance lies at the core of every business success. This is the best finance class you can ever take; it will teach you how to value a business. It will give you the fundamental understanding required for successful maneuvering in the business World. Having an understanding of Finance will determine how well your business performs.

There are many circumstances in which this class is useful:

A. You are looking to raise funding for your company

B. You are looking to invest in a startup

C. You are looking to work for a startup and your success is tied to the startup’s success

D. You are about to get paid in equity

E. You are interested in selling your business

F. You are interested in learning how the World of finance works

G. You are interested in learning how to make money

H. You are interested in strengthening your skills so that you are better able to maneuver within the business world

This class is focused on startup valuation with entrepreneurial and non-public valuation needs in mind. We cover concepts such as pre-money, post money valuation and valuation equations used for private companies. We will be looking at Startup Valuation from the financial perspective. You can expect to walk away with a few equations and ideas on how to make financial projections.

This class is ideal for entrepreneurs, investors and anyone interested in working for or with a private company. Attendees to this seminar will walk away with a better understanding of the valuation process. Attendees will walk through a financial example of valuation.

Testimonials:

“This is one of the best finance classes I have ever taken.”

- Andrew

“I took the “Startup Finance Valuation” class; excellent job. This class is a must for all entrepreneurs. MBA classes do not teach how to value a startup, this class does.”

- Danny

- Bonnie

“I have been in banking for over 20 years and this class taught me valuable concepts not covered by all the classes I have taken throughout my career.”

- Yakv

description:
Are you a designer that's been given a doodle and asked to "just make it look nice"? Or have you asked a designer to help do something and wonder why he/she was so testy about the request? Learn about how to communicate within the world of design or help those you work with understand what design is really all about! Audrey Crane, design partner at DesignMap, will visit with our community once again to share her design survival wisdom! This is an essential event for designers and those who work with designers!

The agenda for the night is:

6:30 - check-in, pizza, wine, & networking
7:15 - speaker presentation
8:00 - program end and closing announcements


Short Bio on Audrey:

Audrey has worked in high tech for 15 years. As an executive producer at Netscape, she produced high-profile products such as Net Search, Netscape’s advertising program, MyNetscape, and Registration. For 6 years she was a design and project manager at Dubberly Design Office, where she worked with Sun Microsystems, Palm Inc., Stanford University, Revolution Health, Opsware Inc., and Jotspot. she also served as the vice president of Interaction Design at The Magellan Network, building a design practice that turned out several web-based and desktop applications. Audrey has presented work at conferences including DUX; About, With and For; BayCHI; and for the AIGA. She is now a partner and design "Kung Fu Master" at DesignMap!
name: Wine, Dine, & Design Thinking with Audrey Crane from DesignMap!

description:
Hello Climbers!

It's our regular indoor climbing event! If you've ever wanted to try rock climbing, this is an ideal chance to try it in a safe environment with experienced climbers. Whether you can barely climb a ladder or you're flashing 5.13's there's something for everyone and we're very supportive of climbers at all levels - no one starts out climbing 5.11s. Members are welcome to bring 2 guests. This is a very popular event and is limited to 30 climbers, so let's please have zero no-shows.

If you are new to climbing, please arrive at 6:15 and be geared up and fully ready to go by 6:30 as I'll give all new climbers about a 45 minute intro on tying in correctly, belaying, safety, etc. After my intro class you'll take the Mission Cliffs safety test (takes 5 minutes, 100% of people I've trained first have passed). After you've passed your test, we'll have plenty of time to climb as a group. I'll be available to give you finer points on technique at this point as well.

If you're not a member of Mission Cliffs, it's $20 for a day pass (or $100 for a 1 month pass) plus $5 for shoe/harness rentals. Thursday night the gym is open until 11 so we'll have plenty of time to climb. Likely around 10 we'll split, for those that want to join me I'm gonna grab dinner and a beer nearby.

Mission Cliffs make staffing decisions based on how many climbers we bring, and they often have an additional person working to help accommodate our group. For that reason it's essential that you keep your rsvp status up to date. Mission Cliffs has been unbelievable cool to us, let's respect that relationship by giving them an accurate rsvp count. It's fine if you sign up the day of the event, but no-shows are not cool at this event (and in general) and will be recorded as such.

Hit me up with any questions, otherwise I'll see you Thursday night! Do not send me funds, you'll pay for your own day pass Thursday night in person.

Meeting Location: Just upstairs from the weight lifting area.

Release of Liability:

By joining us for this event you hereby RELEASE and DISCHARGE it's owners, principals, affiliates, presenters, organizer, hosts and participants from any and all liability, claims, demands or causes of action that you now have, or may have in the future, for injuries, damages, death and/or economic loss of any kind or nature, arising in whole or in part out of the activities, advice or information contained herein
name: Indoor Rock Climbing - Beginners Welcome

description:
https://vimeo.com/79484859

~~~

This is a weekly 2 hour class that takes place at Sandbox Suites Union Square.

~~~

Finance is a powerful global force and valuation lies at its core. Valuation makes or breaks a company. It is critical to understand valuation as an investor, entrepreneur, consultant and employee.

More than likely your next big opportunity will come form a startup or a small business and Finance lies at the core of every business success. This is the best finance class you can ever take; it will teach you how to value a business. It will give you the fundamental understanding required for successful maneuvering in the business World. Having an understanding of Finance will determine how well your business performs.

There are many circumstances in which this class is useful:

A. You are looking to raise funding for your company

B. You are looking to invest in a startup

C. You are looking to work for a startup and your success is tied to the startup’s success

D. You are about to get paid in equity

E. You are interested in selling your business

F. You are interested in learning how the World of finance works

G. You are interested in learning how to make money

H. You are interested in strengthening your skills so that you are better able to maneuver within the business world

This class is focused on startup valuation with entrepreneurial and non-public valuation needs in mind. We cover concepts such as pre-money, post money valuation and valuation equations used for private companies. We will be looking at Startup Valuation from the financial perspective. You can expect to walk away with a few equations and ideas on how to make financial projections.

This class is ideal for entrepreneurs, investors and anyone interested in working for or with a private company. Attendees to this seminar will walk away with a better understanding of the valuation process. Attendees will walk through a financial example of valuation.

Testimonials:

“This is one of the best finance classes I have ever taken.”

- Andrew

“I took the “Startup Finance Valuation” class; excellent job. This class is a must for all entrepreneurs. MBA classes do not teach how to value a startup, this class does.”

- Danny

“After taking this class I have a clear perspective on valuation. I recommend this class to all entrepreneurs. Thank you for a very informative class.”

- Bonnie

“I have been in banking for over 20 years and this class taught me valuable concepts not covered by all the classes I have taken throughout my career.”

- Yakv

<a href="http://www.appcelerator.com/"></a>

description:
Join us for our inaugural Pitch2Sharks event , a fabulous opportunity for women startup founders to pitch their businesses to a panel of top vcs and angels.

May pitch events are dominated by men but at our event on May 28 at the Wix Lounge, SF, we will have only women founders/co-founders pitch.

You will also have the opportunity to network with our guests who will include influential Bay Area investors, entreprenuers and technologists.

AGENDA

6:30 - Networking

7:15 - Brief introduction from the Organizers and panelists.

7:30 - 8:30 60 Second Pitches 8:30 - 9:30 Pitch wrap-up and continue networking

INVESTOR PANEL

Monali Jain, Member/Angel Investor at Harvard Angels, Keiretsu Forum

Shruthi Gandhi, Advisor to VC firms, investor at True Ventures and Samsung's Early Stage Fund

Rest of panel TBA

APPLICATION
If you are a woman founder/co-founder and would like to apply to present before the investor panel and audience, please fill out this application. Companies selected to pitch will also have a demo table and receivie a 30-minute mentoring session from an investor or a seasoned entrepreneurs who has received funding or won pitch competitions.

If you are not selected and/or interested to attend the event, please purchase a ticket https://pitch2sharks.eventbrite.com
name: Pitch2Sharks - Women startup founders pitch to investors

description:
I'll be hosting 4 people for a collaborative cooking event and Tsukemono tasting at my tiny apartment.


We'll be making corn fritters. We will try two variations: One from the cookbook "Japanese Farm Food", and another from the cookbook "Izakaya: The Japanese Pub Cookbook", - both of which I own. I've never tried making this dish, so hopefully it will turn out OK!


I've also collected a small assortment of packaged Tsukemono from Nijia Market for us to taste.

Cost per person: $5.

Refunds

Refunds will only be offered if the event is cancelled, or if you cancel your reservation 2 days in advance. Otherwise, there are no refunds. My apologies for the strict refund policy. Please be sure that you can attend before signing up.

What to bring

• Apron (optional)

Parking and public transportation

Parking in my neighborhood is very limited. I would highly recommend that you take public transportation (Muni / Lift / Uber / Bart). I'm about 10 minutes walking distance from Civic Center Bart or Van Ness and Market. Buzz #12 when you arrive. I'll run down the stairs to let you in.


Be aware that my apartment is on the 4th floor and is not handicap accessible. (Sorry, it's an old building.).


Here's a walking map from Bart and Muni.


Safety

Please be careful when working in the kitchen. Also be aware that my hot tap water gets extremely hot.
name: Small cooking sessions - Corn Fritters / Tsukemono Showdown

description:
Panellists

• Majda Barazzuti, Senior Counsel, Valla & Associates, Inc.

• Leilani Latimer, Director of Global Marketing, Zephyr Health

• Elisa Rossi, Product Marketing, Square


Moderators

• Elisabetta Ghisini, Professor of Management Communication, Hult International Business School

• Paola Tonelli, retired, former Executive Director, Vodafone

"Is there a different, distinct leadership style for female professionals across cultures?

Should their mantra be “Lean in”, as Sheryl Sandberg puts it (“Facciamoci avanti” in the Italian version of the book), or “Thrive”, as Arianna Huffington suggests?

As the link between culture, gender, and leadership style is hotly debated by companies around the world struggling with the very definition of leadership, our panelists will share their perspectives on navigating the choppy waters of reaching professional success in Italy and the US.

Join us for a conversation with women leaders in their field: across industries and across generations, we’ll hear their personal stories and their recipes for success."

For more info and to register (FREE), visit here
name: "Women and Leadership: Stories from Italy & Silicon Valley" at IIC

group.name: The San Francisco Italian Language Meetup Group

description:
UPDATE: Date has changed to Thursday, May 28th. Sincere apologies for the inconvenience.

Have a lightning talk you'd like to share? Reach out to [masked] and schedule a time to present at our May meetup!


--

The plan:

6:30pm - Food (not pizza!) & drinks, RethinkDB demos

*Demos: Ask RethinkDB engineers questions about your projects or learn how to get started on RethinkDB. Shoot us an email if you have any questions beforehand ([masked])*

7:00pm - Talks

Talk 1 (7:00pm) -- Josh Kuhn

Bringing the lessons of Node down to the database

Talk 2 (7:30pm) -- Michael Glukhovsky

RethinkDB: advancing the realtime web

8:00pm - Lightning talks

1. Paul from Rainforest QA

2. Justin from Fanout

3. You?? (email [masked] if you'd like to give a lightning talk at this meetup)

8:30pm - High fives and good byes!

--

About Michael Glukhovsky:

Michael is the founder of RethinkDB, an open-source database for building realtime web applications. He's spoken at meetups and conferences and is passionate about user experience and building infrastructure software.

Prior to RethinkDB, a Y Combinator funded company, Michael attended Stony Brook University and specialized in human-computer interaction. You can find him on Twitter: @mglukhovsky

About Josh Kuhn:

Josh Kuhn is the Ecosystem Engineer at RethinkDB. He's a polyglot programmer who loves learning new languages, techniques and libraries. Previous to RethinkDB he worked in large database systems and web applications. In his current position, he works on connecting the outside world to RethinkDB and using the database in ways it possibly wasn't meant to be used.

<a href="http://tiwtter.com/thejsj"></a>

About RethinkDB:

RethinkDB is the first open-source scalable database for the realtime web. It exposes an exciting new access model -- instead of polling for changes, the developer can tell the database to continuously push updated query results to applications in realtime. RethinkDB allows developer to build scalable realtime apps in a fraction of the time with fewer engineering resources.
name: RethinkDB at Mattermark

description:
This Tachyon Meetup</a> features a chance to interact with other <a href="http://tachyon-project.org/">Tachyon users and the developers, as well as two presentations:

a) Shaoshan Liu from Baidu will share lessons they learned from Tachyon deployments in production.

b) Haoyuan Li from Tachyon Nexus will share exciting news related to Tachyon.

Food will be available starting at 6:00 PM, presentations will begin at 6:30PM. Special thanks to IBM for hosting this.

Fast big data analytics with Spark on Tachyon in Baidu

Abstract:

In this talk we will focus on how Tachyon can help improve big data analytics (ad-hoc query) efficiency within Baidu. In detail, we will explain:

Currently within Baidu, we have a production Tachyon cluster with 100 nodes and over 2 PB of storage space, this cluster mainly serves as the cache layer for our Big Data Analytics engine. In this talk, first we introduce the Big Data Analytic infrastructure within Baidu. Then, we explain why we started using Tachyon a few months ago, as well as the problems encountered when we started using Tachyon. Next, we delve into the details of how Tachyon help accelerate our Big Data Analytics pipeline at its current state. At the end, we discuss what new features we want to see and the plan to scale further.

Bio:

Shaoshan Liu is currently a Senior Architect at Baidu U.S.A. working on Big Data Infrastructure. Before Baidu, he worked at Linkedin and Microsoft. Shaoshan has a Ph.D. from UC Irvine.


Tachyon Recent Development

Abstract:

Tachyon 0.6.4 was recently released, with significant improvements to the overall system. This talk will touch on the features recently developed on Tachyon, including the alpha release of Tiered Storage in 0.6.4.

Bio:

Haoyuan Li is founder and CEO of Tachyon Nexus. He is also a Computer Science Ph.D. candidate in AMPLab at UC Berkeley, where he co-created Tachyon, an open source memory-centric distributed storage system. He is also a founding committer of Apache Spark.

Agenda

6:00 – 6:30 Food & Networking
6:30 – 7:30 Talks
7:30 – 7:45 Q&A
7:45 – 8:00 Wind down

Tweet about this! https://twitter.com/TachyonProject/status/598234199305228288

Tachyon Survey: http://goo.gl/forms/dTwa9pRhqB
name: Fast big data analytics with Spark on Tachyon in Baidu

description:
If you missed our pre event call with Sage Lavine,

Here is the replay link:
http://iTeleseminar.com/69489849
Sage shared great content on how to build your Heart Based Movement..

________________________________________

Dear Bright Community,

On May 28th, we invite Sage Lavine, CEO of Conscious Women Entrepreneurs, host of the International Women on Purpose summits, an amazing friend and movement leader to share her brilliance on The Bright Side of Life stage.

After witnessing her amazing business growth and success for the past 3 years, we have asked Sage to share with our Bright Side Community how she’s grown her international company to more than 40,000 women entrepreneurs from 255 countries and built a 7-Figure Global Women’s Movement while raising over $100K for Humanitarian Aid and the Women of the Amazon Rain forest…


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7_jcNXJHxXY

In addition, we'll be learning from Sahar Nafal, Founder of The Bright Side of Life and Community Builder Expert, Secrets to Creating & Filling Your Own Souled Out Live Events that Generate Six Streams of Income.


Sahar will also be sharing the next chapter for the Bright Side of Life Events and how you can be involved.

This event is for you whether you're looking to grow you live in person community or your online movement by the thousands.

When you join us, with Sage, you’ll learn how to:

• Grow your client list... by 1000's by growing your OWN heart based movements

• Inspire thousands of people to change their lives

• Turn your finished summit into a product you can sell again & again

With Sahar, you’ll learn how to:


• Position yourself as a community leader and expert

• Create Souled Out Live Events time and time again

• Implement offline and online marketing strategist to help you fill your events with ease.

Meet Sage Lavine:


Sage Lavine is the CEO of Conscious Women Entrepreneurs and host of the International Women on Purpose summits reaching 40,000 conscious entrepreneurs around the globe. Sage has shared the stage with Jack Canfield, Janet Atwood, Marcia Wieder and many more… Sage teaches women entrepreneurs to fill their practice and create sustainable financial and conscious wealth through creating a business they love. Sage believes in purposeful entrepreneurship as a way to create world change toward social and ecological solutions and that every heart centered business owner who gives back through humanitarian efforts is a step in the right direction for the planet. Sage also inspires her students to love themselves and each other SO much, that we can’t help but ALL succeed… together.

Seats will be limited for this event. Make sure to register early to insure your spot.

Early bird starts at $30

Light appetizers will be served.

See you at The Bright Side of Life

Sahar Nafal
name: How to Grow Your Heart Based Movement and Your Community!

For those just starting out on a walking program. If you have health issues, age issues or just want a really slow start... this group is for you.

Many of you would like to increase your activity but do not feel like you can keep up with the many walks and hikes scheduled. This group is for you... We are going to Stroll. Bring your cane or walker and be sure to bring a positive attitude. Thu Jan 08 6:00 PM.

Meet in front of Wells Fargo Bank 151 Piedmont Avenue at 40th Street, Oakland Take a nice slow walk round as much of the neighborhood as the mood strikes us.

We will start slow, short distances and very gradually increase as the group decides. We may always be slow and short - that works, too...

description:
Folks,

We have an action packed, exciting and interesting event planned for May 28th. Please pencil it in on your calendars. We will have three very companies presenting - Sequorum, OwnersCircle and Reesio.


Rich Dad Concepts for Real Estate Crowdfunding – Presentation by Evan Sumer

Join us for a fun, interactive presentation exploring how to use Robert Kiyosaki’s Rich Dad concepts in the age of real estate crowdfunding platforms.

Whether you are an experienced investor seeking the best real estate markets, or a beginner who needs investment capital, experienced partners, and expert guidance for your first real estate investment, you will enjoy this no nonsense presentation that focuses on fundamental investing concepts.

Attendees will get the opportunity to share their goals with our expert speaker and learn which strategies are most applicable to their particular situation in a small group setting. We will explore these scenarios in a lively group discussion that incorporates the insights and experiences of all attendees and draw investing lessons relevant to everyone.

If you have ever heard the advice “invest in income producing assets” and wondered how to get started, you will not want to miss this event. You will walk away with tools and strategies that you can put to work immediately regardless of your goals and your particular situation.

About the Speakers:

Our featured speaker, Evan Sumer, is the founder and CEO of one of the earliest real estate crowdfunding platforms in the nation and a successful real estate investor. His firm recently launched the Sequorum Nest Egg™ ― a hassle free wealth building tool that allows anyone with good credit to acquire professionally managed investment properties with zero investment and build wealth over time using Rich Dad® inspired investing principles.

Crowdfunding for Private Businesses (does not have to be real estate related)

Our second company presenting is enabling crowdfunding for just about any private business. They are the founders of OwnersCircle, a Y-Combinator incubated company and now operating out of Berkeley. Being selected by Y-Combinator is a very big deal. You will learn how any private business can now raise funds without having to go to “angel” or “venture” capitalists.

Broderick McClinton, CEO

· BlackRock, Inc. (Institutional Sales)

· Economic Development, New Orleans

· B.S. in Finance, Political Science from Tulane University

· MBA from Harvard Business School

Usman Cheema, Director of Investor Relations

• Deloitte (Strategy/Operations Consultant)

• B.A. in Economics, Arabic & Middle Eastern Studies from the UT at Austin

Mark Thomas, Founder and CEO of Reesio

Reesio is a technology platform for real estate professionals that helps them streamline all of their leads and deals easily online. The product includes full Transaction Management, CRM, Single Property Page Websites, Listing Syndication, and Offers Management. Everything is all in one place, with no separate accounts required. Mark will provide us with an overview of Reesio and its benefits.

Reesio is currently raising its next round of funding to help it continue to accelerate its rapid growth, and is looking for tech-savvy real estate investors who want to invest and be part of the next wave of real estate technology. For more info and to see an investor prospectus, send an email to Reesio Co-Founder & CEO, Mark Thomas, at [masked].

6:00 PM to 7:00 PM: Networking and Introductions


7:00 to 7:45: Evan Sumer from Sequorum

7:45 to 8:30: Broderick and Usman from OwnersCircle

8:30 to 9:00: Mark from Reesio

9:00 to 9:30: Q&A and more networking


I truly hope that you can make it to this wonderful networking and educational event.

Note: if you are looking for private money at reasonable prices for your next rehab, then please contact me.

Happy Investing!

Bobby Sharma

Founder, BayFlip.com

PS: I want to thank our sponsors: Max Khorasani at Stonecrest Financials [masked]), Matt Woerner at ProSource ([masked] (925)[masked]) and Massa Golchin at KW [masked]). Please contact them for your private money, building supplies and real estate needs respectively
how_to_find_us: We will be in the back room, ask host/hostess - (Please RSVP)
name: Blockbuster event: 3 exciting companies-Sequorum, OwnersCircle, Reesio

description:
Berkeley Road Runner Sports Adventure Run is a FREE, 60-minute scavenger-like fun run filled with hundreds of friends, giveaways, raffle prizes, music and free beer! Enough said?

Your Adventure starts when you arrive early to collect your supplies (check-in) and try cool new products from Adventure Run sponsors for FREE! You’ll feel mounting excitement as the map of checkpoints is unveiled before hundreds of runners and walkers, just like you!

You’ll plot your adventure then hit the road with the goal of collecting as many raffle tickets from as many checkpoints as possible in 60 minutes. Your Adventure is at your pace so run, walk, sprint, hop…whatever works for you.

Checkpoints range from a few steps to up to 3-miles from your Road Runner Sports store with crazy obstacles and opportunities to earn more raffle tickets along the way!

You’ll run back to your Road Runner Sports store feeling on top of the world for the work you just accomplished and the fun that lies ahead! You’ll high-five new friends, grab a beer or other tasty beverage, and have your chance to win over $3,000 in FREE raffle prizes…FOR FREE!

Plus, each month you can support a great organization in your community by making a donation. Good karma for your awesome night of FREE fun! Get all the details on your city registration page.

Bring your friends, kids, parents, even friendly dogs- Adventure Run is FREE Fun for people of all ages and levels.

http://www.adventurerun.com/berkeley/
how_to_find_us: Opposite the New Whole Foods off the Gillman Exit
name: Adventure Run!!!

Let's meet at Farley's for a chill cafe night where there is plenty of outdoor space to enjoy the fresh air.

Get there whenever you get off work, 6:00 isn't a hard start time. Come by whenever you can! Folks are usually there till about 8:00/8:30, and the cafe is open until 9:00pm.

Farley's is a few blocks from 19th St BART, has food, coffee drinks and wine and beer.

Just a low-key hang out time, have a drink, a chat and maybe make some new friends. ;o)

If anyone has a suggestion or request for a location for a future cafe night, let me know!

NO SHOW POLICY: We do not currently have a policy to kick people out for no shows, but at a location like this we are doing our best to save room for everyone. Please be considerate and keep your RSVP up to date.

Hope to see you there!

Then you’ll run back to your Road Runner Sports store feeling on top of the world for the work you just accomplished and the fun that lies ahead. You’ll high-five new friends, grab a beer and have your chance to win over $3,000 in free raffle prizes.

Schedule:

6:00pm: Arrive early to sign in inside the store

6:30-7:30 pm: Run or Walk to Fun Checkpoints at Your Own Pace

7:30-8 pm: Win Free Raffle Prizes & Enjoy Pyramid Beer Garden
how_to_find_us: Meet at the store
name: Adventure Run Scavenger Hunt & Beer Garden

description:
- play with a futsal ball </a>http://goo.gl/DsEsW

- 5v5 maximum per game

-come on time!

- small 4 ft x 6 ft goals without goal keeping

- hone your technical and tactical skills

- have fun in a small sided game with plenty of touches

* If we have more than 10 players attend, we'll sub players throughout the match (every ~5 mins)

* If we have 12 players, a 3rd team will be formed and each team will play multiple games: 8 mins or 2 goals per game and switch teams; no team can play more than 2 games back to back.

* No guest RSVPs (meaning if you want to bring someone along to play, that person has to sign-up at Meetup.com, join East Bay Pickup Soccer as a member and RSVP for this meetup)

* Although we encourage a competitive game, no aggressive play is allowed including slide tackling. If you'll be warned and the 2nd time (red card), you'll not be allowed back.

* To be fair, we ask everyone to cancel their RSVP no later than 12 hours before the meetup so that someone on the waiting list can have a spot.

* If you're a no-show (RSVP "yes I'm attending" but don't show up), you won't be allowed to attend the following week. Sorry but because of high demand we need to ensure the integrity of the rsvp list

* If you're on the wait list, we cannot guarantee playing time, sorry!

* If you can, throw a few bucks ($5-$10) in to pay for the purchased equipment (futsal ball, goals, goal bags, pinnies). We still have a little way to go. The latest updated spreadsheet define the expenses and remaining amount needed: <a href="http://goo.gl/eopU4e">http://goo.gl/eopU4e

* Highly recommend turf field shoes as the turf is very short.
name: Fustal - Thursday Night - 5v5 (outdoor turf field)

description: Join the Alameda DragonFlyers Novice Racing Crew and meet up with hundreds of other paddlers at a dragon boat race in Foster City on June 14. Three to seven practices will prepare you and 19 other members for this Novice race. Your crew will be coached, steered and cheered on by members of the Alameda Dragon Flyers, based at the Bridgeside Shopping Center in Alameda. Practices are free. A $30 race fee covers race registration, race day food and beverage and a team t-shirt. Dragon boat racing is an active sport suitable for a wide range of body types, age and fitness levels. You'll love getting a good workout and sharing a beer or coffee with your new paddling friends at the end of practice. Sign up now and meet up soon.
how_to_find_us: The gate to our dock is behind the Nob Hill grocery store. Walk past the store towards the water and make a left. Ask for Linda or Nancy when you arrive.
name: Dragon Boat Racing for Novice Paddlers

Monali has 16 years of experience in developing and launching highly scalable, highly profitable internet software products and services. She held leadership positions at Paypal, eBay, Interwoven, Good Technology and GE.

Monali also loves to travel and has visited 17 countries so far. Her hobbies include hang gliding and Indian classical dance. She successfully climbed to top of Kilimanjaro, highest mountain in Africa.

She has completed a Bachelor in Engineering from University of Mumbai, India and has an MBA from Santa Clara University.

She has also completed an executive education program at Harvard Business School.

description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT. PLEASE USE THIS LINK TO REGISTER. RSVP TO EVENT ON MEETUP DOES NOT GUARANTEE ENTRANCE TO THE EVENT. THANK YOU!

The Seed Stage Angel Elevator Pitch is a great opportunity for entrepreneurs to network with Seed Stage Angels and other CXOs, present their company and ideas and learn first-hand how to raise early-stage capital in today's market.

Seed Stage Angel investors generally invest $100,000-$200,000 per person in early stage technology companies as compared to traditional Angels who may invest $25,000 to $50,000 in a deal.

If you are an entrepreneur in a startup that is currently seeking capital and would like to present your best two-minute (time limit is strictly enforced) elevator pitch to a panel of Angels, you must follow the instructions below. Pitching slots go quickly, so sign up early!

To Present a Pitch

You must register in advance; presenters are assigned on a first-come basis and slot availability is confirmed

automatically during registration; the maximum number of presenters is 10, plus 4 ‘no guarantee’ Standby slots.

Once you register additional guidelines will be sent. You must RSVP receipt. Your pitch is two minutes, timing is strictly enforced, no handouts, cards, demos or samples allowed during or immediately after your presentation.

Your pitch is followed by 4 minutes of Q&A by the panel; and 4 minutes of non-rebuttal feedback from each panelist. Only one person from the company may present the (2) minute pitch to the investors and answer questions from the panel.

Entrepreneurs not yet ready to pitch or unable to reserve a pitch slot are encouraged register and attend. By listening to the pitches, the Q&A, and the critiques you learn the key points required to develop an effective pitch that investors value. You also have the opportunity to network with investors person to person at the event.

If you are an investor, come and listen to the entrepreneurs’ pitches—you never know where you’ll find your next deal. Learn how other investors rate the pitches; which Angels pass and for what reasons; and which entrepreneurs other Angels want to talk to ASAP.

If you are interested in serving on a Pitch or Workshop panel please contact Valerie Badgett, Program Manager.

Moderator: David Emerson, Harvard Business School Alumni Angeles

Panelists:
Assim Gupta, Keiretsu Forum
Alison Wellsfry
Ronald Weissman, Band of Angels
Darnell Kemp, Dreamfunded
Steve Wurzburg, Pillsbury Law
name: Seed-Stage Investor Elevator Pitch

Hello Seeed Hardware Makers, hope the past couple of weeks has been fun for you as makers from all over the world gathered here in the bay area for Maker Faire.

But the Seeed US team does not stop:) In this past week, while we engaged with many makers on conversations about the joy and pain of manufacturing, the topic of 'how to deal with Chinese manufacturers' keeps popping up. As you know, this is one of the reason why we are opening up a shop here. Most importantly, we felt the need and responsibility to share more knowledge about manufacturing, about the hot and sweaty markets in Huaqiangbei, and about China. Therefore, we are putting together another event for you with O'Reilly Media on Shenzhen's hardware ecosystem as we have the honor to invite Mr Terry Cheng to share his insights with us.

Because of our cohost, for more details, please click on the link below and RSVP through Eventbrite. Hope to see you all there:)
