description:
Please register here:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/silicon-valley-tgif-business-and-social-networking-tickets-17025895913

@ideatoipo

PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

Enter the Hyatt Regency via the main entrance on the front side of the hotel. Look to your right. Go to the bar area in the hotel lobby. Look for people with name tags. Look for the Meetup sign.

This event is free to attend.

Attendees must purchase their own liquid refreshments and food.

There's no content or speaker at this event -- just business and social networking.


Build your business and social network - face to face!

Come out and enjoy a great evening of good food, liquid refreshments, and connecting. Come prepared with your best smile, a firm handshake, and a great personality.

You may meet your next business collaborator, client, employer, employee, friend, or tennis partner!

Getting away from a screen for a few hours will do you some good! : -)

Meet Silicon Valley movers and shakers - Internet entrepreneurs, developers, engineers, mobile app coders, attorneys, bloggers, academics, financiers, and investors!

It's okay if you have to come late and/or leave early. Feel free to drop in whenever you can. You can stay for 30 minutes or for two hours.

PARKING:

Park in the parking structure. Parking is free.

COST: FREE to attend.

All attendees will purchase their own liquid refreshments and food.

Please support our host venue by purchasing at least one or two beverages.

(Non-alcoholic beverages are okay.)

DRESS CODE: BUSINESS ATTIRE

Take the pledge:

http://www.thelifeyoucansave.com/

This event is organized in collaboration with other groups.


About the host (CJ Terral):



CJ is an inbound marketing and brand developer who focuses his efforts on start-ups. Since earning his degree in international business from Pepperdine University, he has continued working alongside aspiring and established leaders across California. Those who he has worked with have gained traction ranging from successful launches to receiving venture funding.


Having been born and raised in Silicon Valley, CJ takes pride in what this area has to offer by staying involved with several organizations which advance both his and others' careers. He has also worked in the sales industry for over 10 years, ranging from door-to-door, cold calling, lead generation, retail, and network marketing sales. Outside of Silicon Valley, CJ has worked extended periods in Argentina as a market analyst and in China as a program organizer.

CJ's experience greatly benefits start-ups looking to refine their image in the marketplace. This applies to start-ups which need assistance to refine the look, wording, and/or layout of their key business documents. These type of documents include their business plan, slide deck, executive overview, marketing strategy, operations agreement, and other essential documentation.


To learn more about CJ's experience and background, you may review his 'about' page at www.cjterral.com or subscribe to his Facebook page at www.facebook.com/cj.terral.

Organizational Sponsors:


www.aslcpa.com

We put promise to work

At General Assembly, we are creating a global community of individuals empowered to pursue work they love, by offering full-time immersive programs, long-form courses, and classes and workshops on the most relevant skills of the 21st century.

https://generalassemb.ly/

https://www-304.ibm.com/partnerworld/wps/servlet/ContentHandler/isv_inv_tsp_iic_silicon_valley_overview
name: Silicon Valley TGIF Business and Social Networking

description:
RoastSF is back with another heart stopping, fall-to-the-floor laughing, no-jokes barred comedy roast. Join us as we come together to mock each other and this months controversial guest of honor. You’ve seen the comedy roasts on TV, and online, now it’s time to see one live! Drinking encouraged, sensitivity…. is not.

This month it's:

Comedy Roast of a Stripper.

Our guest of honor, Ember Reese, comes sliding in off the poles of the Historic Condor Club - SF's Original Gentlemen's Club. Now, they say behind every stripper there is a person... Hahaa that was the first joke. Strippers, some people love them, some people hate them, some people pay them money to get naked. Well we've hired one to come on down and let us roast them! Oh and don't worry Ember is hella cool, down to be roasted, is going to have friends there, and yea just because she's a stripper doesn't mean she can't tell a mean joke. This show will be as much about razzing strippers in general as it is about mocking those who, for some reason, hate them. So grab your dollar bills and hand sanitizer cause this one's getting dirty.
Tickets:
Theroast.eventbrite.com

This Months Dirty Dais:
Pete O'Keefe
Cheryl White
Dro Knows
Yuriy Mikhalevskiy
Jesús U. BettaWork
Mikey Gordon
Iris Benson
Tramane Webb

Show - 18+

#StripperRoast
name: Roast of A Stripper

description:
*IMPORTANT NOTE: We can no longer park inside the Sanctuary parking lot @201 8th, but you should not have any problem finding a parking spot right there on the street. We will meet on the sidewalk directly across the street from 201-8th street. We meet at 7:45pm, but we usually don't start walking until 8pm. Please call me at[masked] if you are late.

Time for another service project on the streets of San Francisco. We will be going around the City at night, passing out food and clothing to the homeless. This is a completely self-contained project, which means everything must be provided & carried by ourselves. If you need a wagon (like for soup or whatever), please let me (Cheryl) know in the comments at least 24 hours in advance, and I can bring mine.

Here is the plan:

If you want to test your latest cooking creation, you will have a grand audience here. Go crazy and make something you wish to share with the world.

Your items should already be prepared and ready to go. Soup is a wonderful thing to bring this time of year, but please consider how you will carry it, and if you need someone else to provide cups or spoons, let us know in the comments. If you need to heat something up, please let us know in the comments at least 24 hours in advance so we can ask one of our regulars Lorenzo to bring his camper, and you can arrive at 7:30pm to use the camper stove.

Other Food Suggestions: Pre-made goodies from the supermarket; ready-made sandwiches are also well-received; fruits; bottled drinks like water. These items are easily transportable, but you can bring whatever you'd like.

If you have socks, toiletries, clothing, blankets, backpacks, sleeping bag, or anything else you have to donate, you can bring those. Clean white socks are the most desired clothing item and toothbrush/paste is most desired toiletry.

Please indicate in your RSVP what you plan to bring. If you are just able to donate your help with carrying things, that is equally good. Please come along, bring a wagon or cart if you have one, socialize, and help!
name: San Francisco - Feeding the Homeless on the Streets

description:
DeeDee will be hosting this new Meetup and invites all fellow Abraham students to come out and watch 2 videos:

1. :20min Trailer- The first 20min of "The Secret"

2. 1:04min "The Great Work- The Science Behind The Secret"

As most of you already know, "The Secret" is a Hollywood type thriller used to convey the idea of The Law of Attraction. Lots of action, but very little practical information on how to apply LOA to one's daily routine.

"The Great Work" is a 6 part documentary that de-occultizes the psychology of "magick" and explains LOA in a way anyone can easily follow and begin to use. This first part is a documentary about the science behind the movie "The Secret", and how the Universal Law of Attraction responds to everything we think, say or do. come find out what "The Great Work" means, and how it applies to you!

DeeDee will facilitate discussion about the videos afterwards. Popcorn and tea is provided; please feel free to bring snacks to share.

Suggested donation is $7-$20, no one turned away for lack of funds:)
name: LOA 4th Friday Movie Night- The Science Behind "The Secret"

group.name: SF Law of Attraction / Teachings of Abraham Study Group

description:
Come meet at the historic Berkeley Pier and learn how to catch a variety of sharks, stingrays, halibut, striped bass, sturgeon, and more while enjoying good company.

Last meetup, Mark Held caught a world record 38'' Brown Smoothound Shark (one of 16 total fish we caught that night).

Feel free to bring drinks (beer is great!) and snacks. A barbecue will also be provided for your grilling pleasure (I'll bring some marinated tri-tip and buns). Bait will be provided but you will need to bring a chair, fishing poles (2 allowed, 10+ lb. test line, 25 lb. optimal, 6-12 ft pole, 8-10 ft optimal), extra warm clothing such as hat/goggles/blankets (the wind can be tough although it is supposed to be warm on this particular night for Berkeley), and whatever else suits your fishing needs. Message me for more details!
name: Berkeley Pier - Shark & Stingray Night

description:
Hello, fellow plant devourers,

Who's up for pizza? My answer is often, "Oh! Me! I am!" I like Pizza Moda for having vegan menu items. Not just vegetables or even just vegan cheese, but a vegan Caesar salad, pasta dishes, vegan sausage--and even cake (not recommended as a pizza topping). All the vegetarian pizzas can be made vegan with the substitution of vegan cheese; there's even a Smiling Cow pizza for faux-meat lovers! OMG, I'm so hungry!

I was planning to bring you back to Pizza Moda for brunch (under the same ownership, Fellini had a marvelous brunch), which I was told long ago would be back by now, but no. We'll need to be more patient. Meantime, we can devour some pizza. It's all good.


Respond only if and when you are sure you can make it. If your plans change, update your response at least 24 hours in advance so that someone on the wait list can come, and so I can give the restaurant an accurate head count. Failing to do this twice may result in your removal from the group. Thank you for being considerate of your fellow members and to our vegan-friendly restaurant hosts.

When you arrive, check in with me so I can mark you "present" and give you a name tag. Thanks a bunch.

See you at dinner,
John
how_to_find_us: We'll be in the back along the west (opposite the hills) wall.
name: Dinner at Pizza Moda

description:
Join us and enjoy Julia Roberts and Richard Gere on the big screen, in the huge, beautifully renovated Art Deco gem of a theater here in our own backyard. The Paramount!!! It's only $5. Box Office opens at 6pm

Doors open at 7pm - meet us inside. It's open seating, so there's no guarantee we can sit in a designated spot. I'll get there right at 7:00, and head to the lower level, 10th row from the stage, stage-left of the center aisle. I'll make a small corny sign.

Curtain rises at 8pm.

Bugs Bunny Cartoons, old-timey previews and advertisements. Organ serenade and Deco Prize Wheel raffel. This event is hilarious, inexpensive, and an Oakland Original.

GET THERE:

2 blocks North of 19th St Oakland BART station, on Broadway, between 20th & 21st St.

There are 25 people RSVP'd on my Lake Merritt, Oakland, & Beyond meetup group as of 5/25. Generally, expect about 1/3 to 1/2 to show up.. So should be a nice-sized small/medium group...
http://www.meetup.com/LakeMerritt/events/222176683/

This event may be hosted by another individual than myself (J Martin), but the meetup location will stay the same.
how_to_find_us: Head to the lower level, 10th row from the stage, stage-left of the center aisle. I'll make a small corny sign.

description:
We play and teach games all night long until midnight. Drop in any time from 7:00 to 11:00 or so and you're sure to find something to play! Bring your games from home or use any of the games from our extensive used game library. We often have many tables going on at once for lots of variety. The earlier part of the evening is ideal for families with kids.

We play all sorts of board games and card games on Friday nights, but also:

Got a favorite game you'd like to find others to play? Bring it along! Let us know in advance if possible so we can help with recruiting players.

Our chess and Go guru Steve Bloom is often on hand to teach and play both, and will always confirm here if he's coming. (Plus we have a separate Meetup for each every Sunday; for details see chess here and Go here.)

Very recently we've added Magic the Gathering every Friday (reserved table in the back) and on Thursdays too, hosted by Jimmy Freeman and both starting at 7:00 PM. See our separate MTG Meetup page for details on these plus special MTG events.

(We have had to drop our 2nd/4th Friday Pathfinder Beginner's Box offering for the time being due to the rapidly advancing pregnancy of the GM's wife -- congrats to both! For now, check out our separate Pathfinder Society Meetup, held every Wednesday, here.)

In addition to these Friday Meetups and the ones linked above, there are yet more game-specific events for adults and youth over the course of each week, including Scrabble, youth Pathfinder, youth chess and youth Go classes/play, so check out our full schedule here. There's more to come, so be sure to stay in touch!

We request a donation of $3 to help offset the cost of keeping the store open so late every Friday.

Hope to see you soon!

-- Chris Specker and Will Kreber (owner/managers)

description:
Join the guys of Discovery Community as we enter the gorgeous art deco cinema cathedral that is the Paramount in Oakland. We will attend the screening of movie classic PRETTY WOMAN (1990) - Ruthless corporate takeover attorney Edward Lewis (Richard Gere) gets more than he bargained for when he hires Vivian Ward (Julia Roberts), a lovely lady of the evening, as his escort. A one-night-stand turns into week after week of makeovers as Vivian is transformed into the woman that Edward thinks he wants. Director Garry Marshall took what might have been a sordid hackneyed parody of Pygmalion and turned it into a sweet, innocent, and warm-hearted tale of love and redemption. Julia Robert's performance as an utterly adorable hooker-with-a-heart launched her into Hollywood's A-List and the chemistry between her and Richard Gere made this film easily the most memorable romantic comedy of the 1990s. Cost: All Tickets: $5.00 (ticket prices include $2.00 facility fee)

Time: Discovery Members will meet between 6:30 and 7pm in front of theater on Broadway

Theater Box Office opens @ 6:00pm | Doors open @ 7:00 Curtain rises @ 8:00pm

description:
Let's meet up at my favorite Vietnamese Restaurant in Oakland, then walk around the corner to see The Gritty City Rep's production of Shakespeare's Much Ado About Nothing.

Gritty City Repertory Youth Theatre is a mission based theatre company that "inspires young adults to risk and explore, developing leadership, confidence, and compassion for their human family through the production of powerful theatre." For more information, see http://www.grittycityrep.org/

They also make great theatre -- their last production, Fugee, was one of the 5 best plays (out of close to a hundred) that I saw last year. So I have great hopes for this production.

So lets meet for dinner at 6:30 pm at Ma Me House, my favorite Vietnamese Restaurant in Oakland, eat some delicious Vietnamese food, then walk around the corner to Flight Deck and see some hopefully great theatre.


If you are a little rusty on your Shakespeare, you might want to prepare by watching a movie of Much Ado. I like both the Kenneth Branagh and Emma Thompson classic version (1993), and the Joss Whedon modernized version (2012), both available at your favorite movie streaming outlet. The play we will watch apparently is set in a 70's disco, with appropriate clothing and music.


Ma Me House is located 1/2 a block from 15th and Broadway, at[masked]th St, Oakland, CA. It is a couple blocks walk from 12th street BART station, and I am happy to walk people back to the BART station after the play. There is also plenty of street parking around, although some of the streets may be a bit sketchy. There are also nearby parking garages, see http://www.theflightdeck.org/directions.html


I have managed to secure tickets at a group rate of 1/3 off plus meetup service fee, $22 each, so you need to buy them through meetup. No refunds unless the play is cancelled (never known to happen).
name: See Oakland's Gritty City Rep's production of Shakespeares Much Ado ...

description:
Emotional Maturity as the Blueprint for Enlightenment


We ended last workshop with the idea that we can trust what is arising is not too much, that we can cope with whatever is here in the present moment.

Knowing what we are feeling helps us to trust our experience.

• Do you know if you are experiencing your emotion or another's?

• What is an emotion?

• What is your internal experience of emotion?

• Can you tell the difference between emotion, feeling, thought, and sensation?

Emotional Intelligence is feeling (and recognizing) what you feel and choosing the right response for the situation!

We'll be engaging in some fun explorations and exercises to help you refine your emotional skills that are essential for communicating and relating to others from the soul.

• See and hear what is here now, instead of what you think should be, was, or will be.

• Feel what you do feel, instead of what you think you ought to be feeling.

• Say what you feel and think, instead of what you imagine is expected of you.

• Ask for what you want instead of hoping it will be offered.

• Take risks on your own behalf, instead of settling for the status qup.

• Say No and Yes, directly and clearly.

Bring your sense of curiosity and adventure, as you boldly go into emotions where you have not gone before!

We're looking forward to seeing you there. Please arrive early so we can begin on time.

In the meantime, you can check out these articles:

http://marthabeck.com/2008/09/how-are-you-feeling-really/

https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/sex-sociability/201201/feeling-your-feelings
name: Emotional Maturity as the Blueprint for Enlightenment

description:
Doc Wong Basic Suspension Workshop Part 1—May 29 Fri Night!

Hi,

You're invited the next Basic Suspension Part One Workshop!

I'm hyper-excited, this workshop will demystify and really enhance your knowledge of suspension setup. It is geared for those of you who are neophytes in suspension to those of you who want to know more about how set up your bike properly!

One month there was even a guy that flew from Colorado to attend the workshop and flew back the next morning!

What: Basic Suspension Part One

When: Friday, May 29, 2015, 6:30 pm to 8:30 pm

Where: Doc Wong's Full Motion Chiropractic Office

Carlmont Village Shopping Center

1021 Alameda De Las Pulgas

Belmont, CA 94002

Cost: $0.00

How to sign up: just e-mail me at: [masked]


About the topic, "Basic Suspension Setup": Worksheets have been made up with pertinent data that will be very simple and understandable. I will even have basic terminology defined so that you will know the terms and how they apply to making your bike feel good, bad, bumpy, springy, etc. The workshop will give you a very good understanding of how a suspension works and what you need to do to your bike to improve it's handling characteristics.

Workshop format:

1. Basic terms with demonstrations on a sport bike. I'll go over each term one by one and demonstrate them so that you will see them in action.

2. Adjustments and how they effect the handling of your motorcycle and how you can do them on your bike.

3. Poor handling characteristics due to "mis-adjustments" and how they can be remedied.

The workshop will be kept simple enough to ensure that when you leave, you'll have a very good understanding of how a suspension works and an idea of how to adjust your own bike. You'll have handouts and worksheets to make notes on too!

Due to the content of the materials presented, parental guidance is suggested as your enhanced understanding of how your suspension works and its subsequent demystification may bring about wide grins!

We do have to limit the number of riders to 40, due to the fact that we want everyone to see how the adjustments are made on the motorcycle.

Want to use your bike as the demo bike for the evening? E-mail me with the specifics of your bike: Make, model, year and if it has adjustable front and back preload.

How to register:

Just e-mail me at: [masked]

_________________________________________________________________

Full Motion Chiropractic

1021 Alameda de las Pulgas (In Carlmont Shopping Center next to Baskin Robbins)

Belmont, CA 94002

(650)[masked]

Doc ([masked])

===============================================================

Ride street, ride track, ride dirt, trials.....ride.....well!

Doc Wong

Chiropractor for Children and Adults

1021 Alameda de las Pulgas

Belmont, CA 94002 (650)[masked]

www.docwong.com

Free exams and consultations offered if you're having pain while riding or having neck, back or other sports injuries issues

Check out the stuff on the Doc Wong (Free) Riding Clinics on my web site! http://www.docwong.com

Note: Photos for "Doc Wong Crashes" and the "Doc Wong Message Board" are now on my web site.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

To get the latest announcements on my Riding Clinics subscribe to the Doc-Ride Mail-list!

Email me at [masked] to subscribe to the email list.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Special acknowledgement and thanks to:

Keith Code of California Superbike Schools for his help and guidence and support. The Doc Wong Street Riding Clinics are almost all based on his works. Get his books and tapes on the subject, read them and apply them....your riding will be much better for it! www.superbikeschool.com

Helimot Leathers: The leathers I use and consider the best! http://www.helimot.com

These Suspension Clinics are dedicated to my good friend Gary Jaehne, one of the most helpful riders I know. Though he is no longer with us, he leaves us with a legacy of knowledge and good works!

description:
Rupiya (Money) on the Go - A Social Entrepreneur’s Journey in Successfully Launching a Mobile Payment System in Nepal

Climbing boots? Check. Ice axe? Check. Wallet? Don’t bother. Thanks to eSewa, you can be at Mt. Everest base camp with nothing but your mobile and still pay your bills on time (or buy an airplane ticket out of there). Launched in 2010, eSewa now serves 3 million Nepalese in sending money, receiving remittance, buying products, and much more. An astounding 90% of mobile transactions pass through eSewa’s payment gateway system in Nepal today!

Come learn about the humble beginnings of eSewa from Biswas Dhakal, a serial entrepreneur and one of Nepal’s most celebrated businessmen. He will speak about the intricacies of running a highly technical product company in one of the world’s most challenging terrain (Nepal’s business infrastructure, not the Himalayas).


Speaker : Biswas Dhakal

Biswas Dhakal, social entrepreneur, started his journey striving to reach America. After being denied a student visa multiple times, he refocused his energy and founded F1Soft when he was a just first year Software Engineering student in Kathmandu. A decade and several companies later, he is travelling as the United States Government’s special guest for innovative entrepreneurship.

Mr. Dhakal is the chairman of F1Soft group of companies, including: F1Soft, eSewa, CashOnAd, DharmaTech, and ShiranTech. These companies have been recognized with many awards, including: Red Herring Asia 2012; IT Innovation and Excellent Award in 2012, at IIT Delhi; FNCCI National Excellent Award, August 2013 received from Honorable President of Nepal Dr. Ram Baran Yadav; World Bank Supported Pivot Nepal Best Business and Financial Service Category award, “eSewa Nepal’s First Online Payment Gateway”.

Detailed Schedule
Date: Friday, May 29, 2015
Venue: Urban Curry, 523 Broadway, San Francisco, CA
Doors Open: 6:30 PM


Dinner Served: 7:15 PM ($15 Cash Preferred )
Group Participation: 7:30 - 8:00 PM
Presentation & Speaker Session: 8:00 – 8:45 PM
Network and Mingle: 8:45 – 9:30 PM

-----
About Kurakani (informal networking event): “Kurakani” is a monthly networking event for Global Nepali Professionals. Every event will have a speaker who will talk about an issue that is relevant to Nepali Professionals. The purpose of this networking event is to educate, inspire and foster working relationships within the Nepali community. Find more about GNPN & join us in FB, LinkedIn and MeetUp.
GNPN (CAN-USA) is an American organization dedicated to the professional development of its members and technological progress of Nepal. It is a tax-exempt 501(c)(3) non-profit organization with members throughout the United States. The organization continues to utilize the creativity and talent of its members and the broader American community to develop technology-rich solutions that address some of Nepal's challenges. Please visit http://www.gnpn.org/ for more information.
name: GNPN Kurakani Series: " Rupiya (Money) on the Go"  - Biswas Dhakal

description:
New meetup, new place! This time in the Outer Richmond!

The book is a how-to guide for using exponential technologies, moonshot thinking, and crowd-powered tools to create extraordinary wealth while also positively impacting the lives of billions –– which passes my pragmatism filter. It's a quick read and it made me aware of the sheer amount of opportunity that is and will emerge over the next years.

It gives insight into the power of 3-D printing, artificial intelligence, robotics, networks and sensors, and synthetic biology.

It gives also best mental framework practices from entrepreneurs Larry Page, Elon Musk, Richard Branson, and Jeff Bezos.

In the end it goes deeper into crowdfunding and crowdsourcing and how to go from IDEA to Billion dollar company with the help of those now disruptive technologies.


Listen: http://www.audible.com/pd/Business/Bold-Audiobook/B00RYASDEE/ref=a_search_c4_1_1_srTtl?qid=1429736348&sr=1-1#publisher-summary

Read:http://www.amazon.com/Bold-Create-Wealth-Impact-World/dp/1476709564/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1429737000&sr=8-1&keywords=bold

description:
This group is for anyone interested in living life on their own terms. Inspired by James Altucher's book "Choose Yourself".


You should come if

• You want to improve your life 1% every day

• You want to join a community of like-minded people

• You want to brainstorm breakthrough ideas to grow yourself or your business

Moderator: Tam Pham @MrTamPham

Guest Speaker: Jeremy Thomas

Jeremy is currently working as founder of his own company: Carom - a network of Thinkers. Innovators. Facilitators. Carom works with a range of companies from startups to the Fortune 500 on innovation topics. Jeremy also works with some business schools, leading and teaching future business leaders of all kinds, as well as supporting several innovation methodologies. These include design thinking, value proposition/business model design masterclasses and lean startup.


Previously, Jeremy spent 7 years working for SAP in a variety of positions including several years as an innovation and design thinking mentor, coach and facilitator. Developing new value propositions and business models while practicing design thinking for SAP and its customers eventually led him to understand his own personal value in such engagements, which ultimately supported the decision to leave the corporate world behind.


Jeremy has a JD from Rutgers School of Law. Prior to obtaining that degree, he studied undergraduate and graduate environmental and natural resource economics at the University of Georgia, Athens.


Agenda:

5:30pm - 6pm: Check In

6pm - 6:15pm: Welcome + Introductions

6:15pm - 6:45pm: Guest Speaker

6:45pm - 7:30pm: Group Exercises

7:30pm - 7:45pm: Sharing (GateKeepers, Permission Networking, & Idea Sex)

7:45pm - 8:15pm: Mingle

We will be focused on how we can empower ourselves, build relationships, and provide values to others (and our customers!)

Please RSVP to this meetup!

There will be plenty of snacks and refreshments. Fees are never required for meetups (unless it is a formal event) but donations are encouraged. $3 is the suggested amount but never more than $5.

Money will be used to reimburse for future costs in room rentals, food, drinks, and formal events / conferences. It will never be used for anything other than the Choose Yourself Bay Area Group or to support the Global Choose Yourself Community.
name: Empower Yourself

description:
This hike will be a fairly brisk six miler. We'll start at the trailhead in Oakland and hike up the Alex Zuckerman Bike-Ped path on the Bay Bridge. Along the way we'll look at details of the new and old bridges, and their designs that work and didn't work in earthquakes (we can still see the section of the old bridge that was replaced after Loma Prieta, but it won't be here too much longer).

Think of this hike as more an "earthquake engineering hike" than a geology hike :-)


I'll post more details soon, but hope to get back around 8:00/8:30. The trail is officially open until 9:00 PM.

I updated the map link, so it now (as of Sunday 5/24) directs you to the right location.

Kids: are welcome, if they are up to it.

Dogs: Are not welcome.

Parking: There is a big lot accessible once you turn onto Burma Road. Sign says "Five hour parking; dawn to dusk," so parking should not be a problem.


Carpools: West Oakland BART station is about two miles away, so if anyone needs a ride or can offer ride, please say so in your RSVP. I would plan on meeting at 5:15 at West Oakland BART, which should give plenty of time to drive down 7th then turn on right on Maritime.

Location: The map link from the webpage (this one) has been corrected, but if you get an automated email, it may give you a location on 18th. Please use the map/location show above.
name: Hike up the "new" Bay Bridge

description:
Want to join a growing online Pure Land Buddhist community and learn about the Dharma from your PC or Mac? Now you can!

Join us for our weekly online Dharma Talks via Skype! People from all over the world and the United States attend these meetings. Usually we have between 5-15 guests on each call. Skype is a free online teleconferencing application. Just download the software at www.skype.com, create a unique user ID, and login. Then search for Skype Contact: onebuddhism and send a contact request. Because of a high volume of requests, please right a short message saying you would like to join and that you are from the SF Bay Area Meetup. Space is limited, so five minutes before the call please send a message to onebuddhism to RSVP before the call. (You can always message me if you have trouble or need more help with these steps.)

Each talk we start off with introductions. Then we usually share a short inspirational story or have a discussion about a current event going on in the world. After that, we hear a new Buddhist lesson each week. At the end, there is usually time to answer any questions or give feedback. We have a wide array of topics like dealing with anger, discovering your true self, parables taught by the Buddha, and most importantly achieving your purpose of life!

Hope to see you online soon... Invite your friends from all over the world, and tell them we meet every Friday at 5:00 p.m. (Pacific Standard Time).
name: Weekly Online Dharma Talk

description:
Writers need other writers for perspective and insight into their own work. Just writing in proximity to other writers can be a powerful motivator. Drop by and join in this informal supportive critique group on any Wednesday and/or Friday from 3-5 in Library’s Conference Room. It’s open to all writers of any genre seeking constructive feedback from peers on their work.

There will be an informal structure to the session: first hour will be dedicated to writing and the second hour will be spent sharing constructive feedback.

Help yourself to coffee or tea, check out our Writers Reference Collection and Just Write.

General structure:

3 PM – 4 PM writing time

4 PM – 5 PM feedback time

Feedback Guidelines:

The goal is to help another writer improve. Keep it impersonal.

Give the type of feedback you would like to receive.

Give praise where praise is due.

Know that praise is not enough; feedback for improvement of the content is also required. Use the "sandwich" technique. (good, not-so-hot, good)

Be clear in your comments; provide specific examples and suggestions for improvements.

Do not be tempted to rewrite for the writer. Examples are appropriate.

Be sincere. Be kind.

--------------------------------------------------------------

Check out the Mill Valley Library’s Writers Salon page for more programs and services for writers. www.mvplwriterssalon.wordpress.com
how_to_find_us: The Mill Valley Library's Writers' Drop-In is held at the Mill Valley Public Library, nestled in the beautiful redwoods at the base of Mt. Tam.
name: Write, share feedback and connect with other writers

You can meet people, find a partner for pair programming, talk about technology, or just work on a project or tutorial. All levels are welcome.

If people want to use the first hour for short presentations with the projector, we could do that. If you have an idea for a short presentation, send an email to Josh at codeselfstudy (dot com).

description:
Lets eat!

Again, I apologize for being out of town and fairly quiet on the LunchOps front. Hope you've all been eating nice things, and not breaking production with untested Ansible playbooks!

This time I wanted something other than Osha Thai - even though those folks are super accommodating of big groups.

'Round the corner from there is Stone Korean Kitchen - great bibimbap but they also do sushi, rice dishes/curries etc.

I've provisionally reserved for 20 people so please get your RSVP's in asap. If you drop out - no problem - someone else will snap up the place.

I will ask however that if you're a 'Yes' on the day at 9am, then you do the decent thing and show up. The nice people there have waved the deposit for me provided the numbers at 9am match the numbers at 12.30pm. Make sense?

Looking forward to seeing you all - I've been working at a big old bank on the east coast and have war stories a-plenty.

Cheers,

Max

Advance Registration closes May 25th at Midnight

Self Empowerment through a Shamanic Way of Life

Walking the Spiral Path is a blend of ancient and ancestral wisdom with modern contemporary shamanism. Walking the Spiral Path offers experiential practices of the Shaman for direct engagement with spirit.


BIRTHING NEW BEGINNINGS ~ SPRING is a weekend intimate retreat in the Bay Area for all levels with Kent Dorsey and Girvani Leerer.

Kent Dorsey, Center for Shamanic Healing and Girvani Leerer, PhD, The Shamanic Psychologist, formed Earth Spirit Way to offer heart-centered teaching on Self Empowerment Through a Shamanic Way of Life. They bring a unique blend and balance of the Divine Feminine and Masculine, and of Core (Cross-Cultural) Shamanism and Andean Indigenous Wisdom to their teaching.

DO YOU WANT TO:

♦ Shed old habits and worn-out ways of being and release what no longer serves you?

♦ Access your own inner wisdom and answers?

♦ Add spiritual and shamanic practices and ceremony into your daily life?

♦ Use your empathic sensitivity without feeling overwhelmed?

♦ Find your authentic voice?

♦ Feel more whole, fully in your body, radiantly alive, and positively engaged in l


ADVANCE REGISTRATION ENDS MAY 25th click here


</a>

Whether your goal is personal growth, healing and self empowerment; understanding your own divinity; learning the wisdom of the shamanic world view; joyful attainment of your dreams; greater understanding your Life’s Direction; or being a healing presence in the world; those who choose to walk this path with us will experience profound transformation and a renewed sense of purpose.

• Class Size is Very Limited in this Intimate Retreat Setting.

• Don't Wait ~ Register early to save your space!

• Early Registration: $50 off before May 25.

<a href="http://earthspiritway.com">ADVANCE REGISTRATION ENDS MAY 25th click here


You walk the spiral path from wherever you begin

– whether

a beginner

, an

experienced practitioner of shamanism

or a

spiritual practitioner

– always deepening your path and growth in order to reach

Transcendence.

<a href="https://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/eventReg?oeidk=a07eapq0drof08a545f&oseq=&c=&ch="></a>

Walking the Spiral Path continues throughout life. In each weekend, we will use the lens of the Cycles of Life and Nature as a guide to the Journey on our Personal Medicine Path. As we grow and deepen our learning we experience Birthing New Beginnings ~ Spring, Growing and Blossoming ~ Summer, Harvesting the Fruits ~ Fall, Remembering our Soul Journey ~ Winter, and Creating a New Dream ~ Transcendence. With each spiral we let go of old ways and roles as we walk the Path to transcend, evolve and become more self empowered.

Each weekend intimate residential retreat may be taken separately.

Together the Series offers a path of Awakening, Initiation & Empowerment within a safe sacred community of like-minded people.

Universal shamanic practices of direct engagement with Spirit will provide access to our personal wisdom and knowledge. Receiving ancient Shamanic rites will upgrade our DNA and energy body, connect us to a lineage of teachers and wisdom keepers and deepen and accelerate our Journey of transformation. We will create a personal altar, a Medicine Bundle, to hold our healing and empowerment.

5% of the Proceeds of Earth Spirit Way: Walking the Spiral Path will be donated to Greenpeace Fund to halt environmental destruction and promote international environmental change.

Click Here to Register


Classes will be held at Spirit House, a magical private hilltop retreat overlooking a beautiful valley in Woodacre, CA, close to San Francisco yet a world away.

Arriving at Spirit House the heart opens to the majestic connectedness with the sacred land. It is truly a paradise in nature. Spirit House offers a sense of ‘embracing our souls’, as we surrender into journeys of introspection and exploration. There is a deep sense of spaciousness and abundance that invites people to surrender into the magic of this beautiful setting.

The retreat house is cozy and welcoming, with natural wood, indoor sauna, outdoor hot tub, and gorgeous outdoor space including nature trails and a stone labyrinth on a gorgeous knoll with 360 degree views.


We meet for our Retreat in a free-standing roomy yurt or space under the trees.

Residential (large shared rooms) and Commuting Options are available.

Delicious meals are included in both.

Come Join Us!


Walking the Spiral Path

CHOOSE FROM five intimate retreat weekends for Personal Growth, Healing and Spiritual Evolution


Plus: Four Conference calls for Group Journey work & Ceremony (Each call 4-6 weeks after each Gathering)


Plus: Spiral Path Yahoo Group for community building and staying connected to the circle. Each weekend retreat may be taken individually.

Together Kent and Girvani formed Earth Spirit Way to offer heart-centered teaching on Self Empowerment Through a Shamanic Way of Life. They bring a unique blend and balance of the Divine Feminine and Masculine, and of Core (Cross-Cultural) Shamanism and Andean Indigenous Wisdom to their teaching.


Kent Dorsey has developed a deep connection to spirit based on his own direct experiences. He has studied and practiced Shamanism for 16 years, training in Core Shamanism with the Foundation for Shamanic Studies under Dr. Michael Harner, with Sandra Ingerman, Tuvan Shamanic Societies and others. He is co-founder of the Center For Shamanic Healing in Oakland. Kent has taught shamanic classes and trained practitioners for 10 years.


Girvani Leerer, PhD, The Shamanic Psychologist bridges Shamanism and psychology for 21st century healing of body, mind, and spirit/energy body. She trained for several years with The Four Winds Society under Dr. Alberto Villoldo and Linda Fitch, where she was part of the Faculty from 2010-2012. She also trained with Sandra Ingerman, indigenous teachers from Peru, and others. Girvani has taught shamanic classes for 5 years.

PREREQUISITE:


Experience with shamanic journeying, self-directed and accompanied with drumming without verbal guidance, is required, but there are no specific prerequisite workshops.

You will receive more information about how to learn the practice of shamanic journeying after registration.

</a> The Classes

1. Birthing New Beginnings – Spring May 29 - 31, 2015

We begin to Walk the Spiral Path in the East within a Safe and Sacred Community. Honoring the Cycles of Nature, we enter the Labyrinth of Transformation in the Spring, the Time of new beginnings and the dawning of a new way to Be in the world.

Our journey starts with our Intention and Imagination to vision our path and our highest possibility. We discover and connect with our helping spirits and guides in a process that continues throughout our journey. Spending time with Nature and the land, we begin to reconnect and remember our place in Nature and with All our Relations.

We find our personal Creation story and experience the deep love from which we were created, and in ceremony we experience our Birth to this Earth Walk. We begin the Foundation initiation Rites of the Munay-Ki, energetic transmissions distilled from ancient shamanic rites from the Q’ero nation of Peru, to create new energetic architecture to grow into our new Selves. We walk the path to our personal transformation and to awaken our healing power and presence.

Follow-up Conference Call TBA July 2015

2. Growing and Blossoming – Summer August 21 - 23, 2015

We continue our Journey with a turn of the wheel along The Spiral Path, Growing and Blossoming into Summer, Honoring the South. We come together to deepen Community and Grow our Potential.

With Concentration and Focus we find and clear the old stories that keep us bound to the past, identifying with our history and trapped in unhealthy patterns. Honoring what has been and finding the gifts in these experiences we unleash fuel for our journey of growth and blossoming.

Re-inventing ourselves, we shed the old worn out ways of walking in the world. We find our new power through our Spirit Animal Ally and our Power Song. We complete the Foundation initiation Rites of the Munay-Ki, energetic transmissions distilled from ancient shamanic rites from the Q’ero nation of Peru, to create new energetic architecture to grow into our new Selves.

Follow-up Conference Call TBA October 2015

3. Harvesting the Fruits – Fall December 11 - 13, 2015

We continue our Journey with another turn of the wheel along the Spiral Path, Maturing into Fall, Honoring the West. We return to rekindle and harvest the gifts of Community. We honor and integrate what is in Shadow.

We come into Harmony by owning our Shadow aspects: from our lives, our ancestral lineages, our karmic legacy. We honor the shadow as a healing energy embodied in the dark of the Moon cycle. Releasing the fear of the shadow and bindings from the past, we can receive and claim the gifts from our ancestral lineage. We open to healing and reclaim and restore our power. We harmonize and connect with the power of the healed masculine and feminine, and receive the Munay-Ki energetic transmissions to bring us into harmony and Balance with both aspects.

Follow-up Conference Call TBA January 2016

4. Remembering our Soul Journey – Winter March 11 - 13, 2016

We turn the wheel once more on The Spiral Path, moving into Winter, Honoring the North. This is the time of death, of Union with Source. In shamanic cultures, death is not an end but a transition. Our Community supports us in this transition.

We remember our Soul Journey beyond roles and personality. We travel beyond time and space to that which is beyond Death. We honor our ancestors who have helped us come into Being for our Soul Journey, and We remember and claim our soul’s purpose.

We take our place as stewards of the Earth, holding her from the vantage point of space as we receive the rites of the Munay-Ki to become an Earthkeeper. We enter the darkness of Earth and the Void, seeds waiting to germinate, as we release what needs to die to gather energy from the transcendent Realms.

Follow-up Conference Call TBA April 2016

5. Creating a New Dream – Transcendence May 13 - 15, 2016

In the final turn of the wheel on The Spiral Path, we return to Center, coming back to things we thought we understood with Increased Knowledge, Seeing Deeper Truths. We merge with Creator energy, supported by ancient rites of the time to come, the Starkeeper and Creator initiations. Our Community becomes One Heart Radiating Light to heal ourselves and the World.

With Love, we Create a New Dream of Transcendence, a new vision for our life and for the World. We travel outside of time to meet our Descendants who help us form the new vision for the times to come leaving behind the collective nightmare. We experience and embody Light, our template of divine perfection. We learn to use this light to take our place in service to the World.

Walking the Spiral Path

© Copyright 2015 All Rights Reserved Earth Spirit Way and Walking the SpiraL Path

description:
Cover letters are often one of the most challenging parts of the job search process, but it's necessary to have a brief, professional and effective one in your job search portfolio. During this online job club, I'll share ideas, formats, and resources for both cover letters and resumes.

Job Club Online is a forum to polish your job search techniques, and find out the latest employment trends in the SF Bay Area tech community.

Email [masked] for more information.

TO Register/join the webinar, click here: https://rivierapartners.webex.com/rivierapartners/onstage/g.php?MTID=e32cacf5af547548f838caa552e9cacb6

PASSWORD: tech2015

This event is open to all genders.

**Because of the confidential nature of job search discussion, this event is not a forum for recruiters or hiring managers to attend for recruiting purposes.**

Riviera Partners is the Bay Area’s leading engineering & product development recruiting firm that uses data-driven findings to match engineers with the best startup opportunities. Wendy Saccuzzo is a Career Development Specialist and Community Manager, and helps build engineering teams. Wendy has more than 15 years of experience in tech and recruiting, along with a graduate degree in Counseling focusing on Career Development. At Riviera, Wendy works with rapidly growing startups within the Consumer Internet space, including E-commerce, Digital Media, Online Advertising, and SaaS.
name: Job Club Online:  Cover Letters and Resumes for Tech Professionals

description:
What: A Gathering of Big Impact Speakers


Theme: Monetize Your Message & Fulfill Your Calling

Appetizers Served: Healthy Snacks & Purified Water. Please feel free to bring your own lunch.

Activities: Speed Networking | Business Training & Inner Game Strategies with Mark and Shannon

Cost: We never charge for our gatherings. We believe in giving back to the community. We do a "Big Impact Give Back" and proceeds are donated to The Center For Spiritual Living... suggested $10

-------------------------

Bay Area Speakers is for Speakers, Coaches, Healers & Experts who want to attract more clients and make a bigger difference through speaking. Our efforts are to create a more peaceful world by bringing Big Impact Speakers together to change the world. Through collaboration & co-creation we are establishing and teaching a new model of business.

This isn't your typical boring networking event...we show you a step by step process for generating revenue now, how to step into your calling and how to (finally) stop spinning your wheels and get out of overwhelm.

Master Speaking... Expand Your Tribe... Deepen Your Relationships


Because we have so much in store for you, we ask that you arrive on time and avoid "trickling in". We will get started right at 11:30am and end promptly at 2:00pm, so please arrive early to get registered.

You will...

* Connect & Collaborate with other Speakers & Conscious Business Owners


* Learn How To Get More Speaking Gigs & Fill Your Events

* Inner Game Strategies To Get Out Of Overwhelm and Self Doubt


* Monetize Your Message & Make The Impact You're Called To Make

* Participate in Authentic Networking... (No More Introducing Yourself With A Business Card!)

We look forward to meeting you and learning how we can support you in having a BIG Impact.

In your corner and on your side,

Mark & Shannon
Founders

PS -- Make the decision to join us each and every month. RSVP right now!

description:
Would you care to come to this meeting, at no cost, as our guest, to see if there’s business-value for you?

YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden Ticket by registering for a specific meeting. YOU MUST REQUEST YOUR GOLDEN TICKET AT LEAST ONE HOUR PRIOR TO A MEETING'S START TIME. YOUR PERSONAL VALID GORAMPUP! GOLDEN TICKET MUST BE PRESENTED AT YOUR FREE MEETING for you to gain admittance. Our preference is that you present your Golden Ticket email from us on your smart phone or similar device. If that is not possible, you may present a printed copy of your ticket.

Just RSVP Now! - Click here

What is this meeting - Click here

What happens in the meeting? - Click here

If you are NOT a member... - Click here

If you ARE a member - Click here

This is a "business-networking" meeting.

We love to have visitors at our business-networking meetings.

A business-networking meeting is where business people make connections with other professionals, and agree to share clients, leads, prospects, and to help introduce one another to such contacts.

The objective is that we can all find and attract clients faster and more easily by leveraging the power of "networking" relationships and connections.

So, a business-networking meeting is about starting and advancing enduring business-referral relationships. It is not about pitching to, or recruiting, one another.

We do business-networking really differently.

Just RSVP Now! - Click here
how_to_find_us: YOU MUST obtain a free-access GoRampUp! Golden ticket by registering for a specific meeting at http://GoRampUp.com/calendar/. This ticket must be presented at your complimentary meeting for you to gain admittance.

description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 11.00am and finishes at 11.30am.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

description:
Join us for Mindful Movement Qigong to experience the effects and benefits of Qigong! Class are great for beginners and experienced Qigongers alike. All levels of fitness, ability and experience are welcome to join.

Suzannah is an acupuncturist and long time teacher of qigong, certified in both medical qigong therapy and as a qigong teacher by Suzanne Friedman, L.Ac., DMQ (China). Her mission is to support you in your health goals by sharing simple, easy to learn and powerful techniques for self-healing. Her goal is to create a qigong community in San Francisco that fosters vitality, health and tranquility in our everyday lives. Each class will consist of qigong movements and exercises for self-healing and a guided meditation. www.SuzannahStason.com

Details about this class:

Drop-in available for $20 or a 6 class frequent qigonger pass is available for purchase for $100 at any class. Please bring cash or check (or use SQUARE cash app for direct transfer). If you are limited income or a student, please contact me for sliding scale options. No one turned away for lack of funds. Payment is due before each class begins.

Wear comfortable, flowing clothing with layers as it might start off chilly and warm up as we get moving. Also, no shoes are allowed in the meditation room. If you have sensitive feet and need to wear shoes, please bring non street shoes to wear inside. Meditation mats and chairs are provided. Bring a yoga mat if you prefer to have one to stand on, though this is not necessary.

Schedule:

10:15-10:30am: Registration and quiet meditation, tea is available in the lounge area

10:30-11:30am: Qigong warm-ups, Mindful Movement Qigong exercises with discussion of health effects, Daoist meditation to close

Looking forward to seeing & practicing with you soon!
how_to_find_us: San Francisco Buddhist Center, 37 Barlett Street (btw 21st & 22nd, east of Valencia St)
name: Mindful Movement Qigong 10:15am Drop-In Class

description:
2015 is witnessing many enterprises wanting to speed up initiatives for turning Big Data into Business Insights. Having to learn and code native Apache Storm or Spark-streaming would make things slow. There is a strong market need for platforms that abstract the powerful streaming engines to quickly create streaming applications without involving cumbersome coding. Join this upcoming session that will discuss a Modern Enterprise Data Architecture and will also cover-
• What distinguishes a Modern Agile Enterprise
• Lambda Architecture overview
• An overview of a powerful real-time streaming analytics platform
• A demo of a practical implementation of Lambda architecture in Social Media Analytics involving batch and real-time analysis

Date: May 29 (10 am PT)

You can register at- http://bit.ly/1Sb3mvc
name: Building Real-time Streaming Apps in Minutes

description:
Please come inside the Marketplace through the bay side of the building. We'll meet in the eating area next to Peet's Coffee where there's room to lean our bikes against the walls while we wait for everyone to arrive. We'll have lunch in Sausalito and ride back to the Ferry Building / BART.

We are departing the Ferry Building Marketplace at 10:10.

For those coming from Marin County there's a ferry from Larkspur at 9:15 arriving at the Ferry Building Marketplace at 9:50.

For those that decide not to ride back to the city, there are ferries from Sausalito at 12:15 and 13:55, arriving at the Ferry Building Marketplace at 12:45 and 14:25 respectively. Another option is riding to the San Rafael bridge, and catching the bus to Del Norte, (about 11.5 miles . . not as scenic as going back to SF, but you'll miss the bridge pedestrians and the BART clog.)

Here's the Golden Gate Ferry Schedule.

We're having lunch at Taste of Rome at 1000 Bridgeway in Sausalito.
name: San Francisco Ferry Building to Sausalito- roundtrip or optional return on Ferry

description:
NICOLE MOUDABER ( UK)
Presales https://nicolemoudaber-harlot.eventbrite.com/

Dance music changed Nicole Moudaber’s life – now she’s returning the favour. “The drums reached me,” she says of her initiation at New York’s infamous Tunnel Club. Ever since then, the Nigerian-born Lebanese star has dedicated her immense energy to finding ways to share that vibe. After years as a promoter – first in her native Lebanon, then in London – and a long self-apprenticeship in her studio, Nicole burst onto the scene like record-wielding Athena. Carl Cox, a close friend and mentor, tipped off DJ Mag in 2009, calling her “the most underrated DJ.” Four years later, Ms Moudaber is no longer waiting in the wings.

description:
What if your conversations were like hot sex, words volleying to-and-fro, thick with tension, generating electricity. Creating more and more intimacy, heat and tension, approving of yourself; non-judgement, just real and honest truth?


Do you believe that this life is possible, or do you think that you would certainly get fired, or you’d be far too unkind, or your husband would leave you? Are you scared of being out of control? Do you ever let go?

Here at OneTaste we do a practice called Orgasmic Meditation, and that practice has given us so much richness and vitality, we want to give it back to you. Practitioners have learnt so much about the nature of relating and male-female dynamics we are brimming over, and want to spread the word on our wonderful lives and the depths of what is possible.

Can you hear the whisper of your intuition? Do you speak from your sex, and do you let the voice of your desire speak openly? Here at Turn On, this is exactly what we do and we make a practice of it. We make a practice of being real with ourselves. We have found that having your sexuality fully ramped up and living a life Powered by Orgasm is the fastest way to have everything you want.

Come to play three communication games over the course of one hour and become part of a blossoming movement promoting authenticity in the bedroom. Experience the potential Orgasmic Meditation has as a means of igniting every area in your life.

We start on time so please arrive fifteen minutes early.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions feel free to contact Rachael Hemsi[masked]

Event goes from 8-9:30pm see you soon!
name: Turn On The Marina!

description:
How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other?

It can feel unsafe, inappropriate, or unwelcome by those around you.

Instead, imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we've created!

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or sports bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

We play three communication games that will challenge you to consider questions like 'What are your relationships like?' 'What does Orgasm mean to you?' and 'What's one secret desire you have?'

Questions like these encourage vulnerability. And, what happens when you get vulnerable? It creates intimacy... which is what we're all searching for!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real.

The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasmic Meditation (OM) in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!) - sort of like having the feeling of an incredible dessert without having consumed any of the calories. You can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you. You don't have to do anything you don't want to, or answer any questions you don't want to answer.

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

We start on time so please arrive fifteen minutes early.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10 (CASH ONLY).

For questions contact Erin Beate, [masked],[masked]
name: TurnON Marin- San Rafael Venue!

description:
We'll get started with a walk over to the Zen Center Temple and take a short tour there, before the Dharma Talk.

Day's Itinerary

9:15am to 10am, walk over to and take a tour of the Zen Center.

10am to 11am Dharma Talk ($5.)

11am to 12:05pm Tea & Socializing, option of a short group hike or have personal time.

12:10pm - 12:50pm Lunch in the Zen Center Dining Rm. ($15.)

12:50pm - 3:00pm *Hike from Muir Beach Overlook to Slide Ranch

*This will be a different route. A change from going up the long stair steps through the village of Muir Beach and onto the Overlook. It will allow us to hike the beautiful Headlands in the area onto Slide Ranch. see below.

We'll attend, as you like, either all, or a portion of the Dharma Talk. Tea will be served outdoors at eleven. Excellent muffins and fabulous freshly baked bread, still warm, is sold. (But have the muffin after lunch.)

After tea we'll take a short hike up and around the Center area and/or find your own spot for meditation in this beautiful and peaceful place.

If you have never practiced meditation, try it before our visit. In this way you will find your visit here more satisfying. Click for a guide to Meditation.

At 12:10, an organic lunch($15) is served in the Center dining room. For info Dharma Talk at Green Gulch. Wikipedia-Dharma


After lunch we'll resume hiking. The hike will be at a moderate pace. Total mileage for the day is 5.5 miles.

If the weather is decent, the whole day will be quite a nice experience. If the weather is foggy or rainy we will shorten the hike but still enjoy the experience of the Zen Center and activities there. Weather will not deter this event.

For those new to mindful meditation practice the morning will be a step in learning.

For more information, click here. (General info about the Zen Center.)

If you've never been to this Trailhead, it is very easy to find.

From 101 Freeway, take the Stinson Beach/Hwy 1 exit.


Morning of the hike, if any problems,[masked]-9782. Also click above to see the Google map.


For useful Hiking Details, click the pages Tab above.

Photo: Above Muir Beach, Spring 2014

Muir Beach Overlook
name: Hiking Near the Ocean & Special Visit to the Green Gulch Zen Center

description:
Join us at our NEW LOCATION! right next to Hastings, 1 block from Market St and Civic Center BART [get out on UN Plaza]


***As a courtesy to other writers who want to attend, PLEASE un-RSVP as soon as you decide you're not coming!


*** Because so many people fail to change their RSVPs -- if you signed up and you're still on the waiting list, just show up.

Hosted by Robin (Guest Host Extraordinaire).

Join other writers for a daylong marathon of focused writing!

9:00am - Check-in, Introductions

9:15am - Write for one-and-a-half hours

10:45am - Check-in, beverage/snack, chat

11:15am - Write for one-and-a-half hours

12:45pm- Check-in, Lunch, chat

01:30pm - Write for one-and-a-half hours


03:00pm - Session is ended and coffee shop is closed.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for some marathon sessions, up to 4.5 hours of focused writing! You're welcome to come for all three or even just one of the writing sessions in the marathon. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

To keep all of us and the Celtic Coffee Company staff happy, here
are a few guidelines for the Marathon meetup:

1) Please try to arrive a bit early to get a seat with the
group, or at least on time.

Check in! When you arrive, locate the host (with the MEET-UP SIGN) and make sure to write down your name on the signup sheet (as you RSVP'd on meetup).

2) IF YOU ARRIVE LATE PLEASE try not to disrupt the writing flow!
Find a seat somewhere, start writing, and WAIT FOR THE BREAK to sign in and introduce yourself.
At Celtic Coffee Company cafe, we mostly take over the back area, but you can sit where you want.


3) If you arrive for the MORNING SESSION, please also write down on the LUNCH ORDER sheet your name and lunch order chosen from the menu board at the cafe. We give the lunch order list to the staff by 12 noon so they can
have all of our lunches ready to go at 12:45pm. You pay for your orders individually at lunch time.


To avoid having the staff interrupt during the writing session to ask for clarification of lunch orders, please remember to SPECIFY items like (a) BEVERAGE, (b) type of BREAD for sandwich, (c) type of CHEESE for sandwich (or, "no cheese").

4) When the cafe is crowded, please occupy all the seats at the tables where meetup participants are located, i.e. don't go one person per table, or we will anger the rest of the cafe customers.

5) If you have a power strip or a few, please bring it/them! It will help us to make sure that everyone has a place to plug in.

6) This should be obvious, but as a reminder -- the cafe is a business, not the public library. We don't want to wear out our welcome! During breaks, make sure to purchase something from the cafe That will cause them to want us to come back again and again.

7) If you can't make it, please un-RSVP at least a few days in advance if at all possible. Late RSVP changers and No-Shows have prevented eager writers from attending past overly subscribed Marathons!
name: Shut Up and Write! - SF Marathon SUNDAY May 31st *Extra May Session*

group.name: Shut Up & Write! SF Bay Area

description:
Want to learn the Dipsea Race course or just get a heck of a workout? Join us for this course preview of the oldest trail race in America.


This is the faster paced version of this workout. Participants should be able to run a 1:50 road half marathon or faster. If this doesn't sound like you, see the schedule for the easier paced version.

This is a very difficult run - about 14 miles round trip beginning with the 688 Dipsea steps and including 4200 ft of cumulative elevation gain. We will stop at water fountains at Muir Woods, the top of Cardiac Hill, and at Stinson beach. The longest stretch without water will be about 35 minutes - bring more if you need it. Plan on being out about 3.5 hours (including water and re-group stops).

We'll run fairly fast on the way to Stinson Beach to simulate race conditions and then take it a little easier for the return trip. We'll take the 3 legal shortcuts on the way out (Suicide, The Swoop, and the Panoramic Shortcuts) and the "consensus" course for the return trip.

Click Here to See the Route. If you'd like to familiarize yourself with the course beforehand there are also good photo and video course previews.


Those not wanting to run round trip can take a bus back. See the bus schedule here. The bus doesn't go all the way back to the start, so I recommend getting off at the Panoramic Hwy & Bayview Dr stop, which is the top of the Dipsea stairs - then it's just a downhill walk back to the start.

(Google Street View of meeting spot)
how_to_find_us: Meet at the trailhead across from Olive St. I'll be in a white Dipsea shirt and black shorts.
name: Dipsea Course Preview & Training Run

description:
Basic Self Rescue practice – belay escapes, ascending the rope, rappelling

Do you have a solid grasp of basic self rescue skills (ie. escaping the belay, ascending the rope, rappelling?


Do you practice self-rescue on a regular basis?

How many of your partners are competent at rappelling, escaping the belay or ascending the rope?

If your partner took a lead fall and was injured or unconscious do you have the technical skills to get to them quickly and safely and render help?

If you or your partner’s hair or clothing got caught up in the belay device do you have the technical skills to be able to extract them?

Do you know how to belay if you drop your belay device?


If you said no to any of the above questions then this self-rescue practice is for you.

Note: this meetup is primarily for those interested in practicing technical skills needed for multi-pitch climbing, especially trad followers and those working toward becoming trad leaders or improving/adding to their trad climbing technical skills. Solid belaying skills are required and excellent knot tying skills are highly desired.

Let's see if we can get in some good practice and start developing some good self rescue skills.

For those who have taken my Gear Knots and Anchors class (or equivalent) this is the next logical step towards becoming a Multi-pitch Trad leader. These skills are essential for all multi-pitch followers.

These skills should be practiced often in a single pitch setting until they are second nature BEFORE venturing into multi-pitch climbing.

I prefer to keep these self-rescue meetups fairly small, but that depends on the technical skills/experience of the group. Please answer the questions asked when you RSVP and I will open up the meetup to as many people as seems appropriate. Priority will be given to those who have taken my Gear Knots and Anchors class or equivalent though all are welcome to join.

Knots and hitches we will use:
Knots – overhand, double overhand, double fisherman’s, figure eight on a bight, figure eight follow with Yosemite finish, mule knot
Hitches – clove, munter, prusik, klemheist, autoblock

Note: this class requires even numbers so everyone has a partner. Please make sure you can go before you sign up.


Minimum recommended Personal gear:


helmet (mandatory)

harness,

belay device with HMS (pear shaped) locking carabiner,

4 extra locking carabiners (large HMS recommended),

closed toe shoes

optional:

Purcell prusik, daisy chain or PAS

Group gear:

Anchoring gear

Ropes

Waist prusiks

Foot prusiks

I will be bringing anchoring gear and ropes and will arrive earlier to setup. All are welcome to join me and help out.


Waist and foot prusiks will be yours to keep.

Gear fee: $30. All group gear will be provided.

Note: only $10 fee for those who have previously attended this practice meetup.



Location: Cragmont Park in Berkeley.

Disclaimer: climbing is an inherently dangerous activity! You are solely responsible for your own safety. By RSVPing for this Meetup, you acknowledge and voluntarily agree that climbing entails significant risks which could result in physical or emotional injury, paralysis, death, or damage to yourself, to property, or to third parties; you expressly promise to accept and assume all of the risks existing in this activity, both whether caused or alleged to be caused by the ordinary negligent acts or omissions of Bay Area Outdoor Rock Climbing and/or any of its Organizers; and you voluntarily release, forever discharge, and agree to indemnify and hold harmless Bay Area Outdoor Rock Climbing and/or any of its Organizers from any and all claims, demands, or causes of action, which are in any way connected to your participation in this Meetup. You must accept these terms to be able to participate in this Meetup. Please be safe and have fun!

description:
How much does this Meetup cost?

*Non-Subscription members $12
*Subscription members- Free (message, or email me and I will add you)
*C4 Class Members- Free (message, or email me and I will add you)
*Keith B Dixon Crew Members- Free (LOL)

What are we doing?

We will make Social Landscape photographs (Street Photography) based on the past work of photographer Fred Lyons using Creative Zone concepts. Requirements:

• You must use a 50mm lens or equivalent the entire time

• Participate in 1 quick photo exercise

• Attend rain or shine

• Be able to walk at least 2 miles or less

About Embarcadero:

"The Embarcadero (Spanish: Wharf), is the eastern waterfront and roadway of the Port of San Francisco, San Francisco, California, along San Francisco Bay, constructed atop an engineered seawall on reclaimed land. It derives its name from the Spanish verb embarcar, meaning "to embark"; embarcadero itself means "the place to embark". The Central Embarcadero Piers Historic District was added to the National Register of Historic Places on November 20, 2002.[1]

The Embarcadero right-of-way begins at the intersection of Second and King Streets near AT&T Park, and travels north, passing under the San Francisco – Oakland Bay Bridge. The Embarcadero continues north past the Ferry Building at Market Street, Fisherman's Wharf, and Pier 39, before ending at Pier 45. A section of The Embarcadero which ran between Folsom Street and Drumm Street was formerly known as East Street. The sidewalk along the waterfront between Harrison Street and Broadway was named "Herb Caen Way..." after the death of celebrated local columnist Herb Caen in 1997. The three dots, or ellipsis, deliberately are included in honor of columnist Herb Caen's Pulitzer Prize winning writing style."

What is Social Landscape Photography?


Social Landscape Photography, or street photography is focused on how people in a community associate to their environment, area, or scene. Great street photography not only tells you a story but also connects you to the scene. Social Landscape photography is one of most important genre of photography because it documents change and progress. Join me as we explore and deconstruct the work of famed San Francisco Photographer Fred Lyons. “Photographer Fred Lyon has been called "San Francisco's Brassai". He's also been compared to Cartier Bresson, Atget and Andre Kertez, but all with a San Francisco twist.”

We will meet at One Market in San Francisco
name: 50mm of the Embarcadero

description:
Today we will be meeting at the Crab Cove Visitor Center to run on the actual race course. Anyone entered in the race is welcome to join us! This applies to 5K and Half Marathon Trainees.

In the days leading up to the race, you will want to take some time to visualize in your mind everything you'll be doing. What better way to get a heads up on your race than by experiencing the course first-hand? We will practice on the actual course today. The race follows a "lollipop" style route, with an out-and-back segment and a loop.

One aid station will be available on the course (approx mile 3 and also mile 10 near the bridge) and we will have aid at the start and finish point. But now is also a great time to test your back-up system (in case things go different than planned on race day). Wear the clothes you will wear on race day and practice with the fluids/fuel you plan to carry.

Time: 8:00 AM

Start: Crab Cove Visitor Center, Alameda

How far? Approx 13.1 or 3.1 (for the 5K) miles along the course. We will mark each mile with chalk and a Garmin. Our mile marks are not certified but are pretty accurate

Why? A practice run on the course can give you a real confidence boost! And, you should be prepared to cover the distance at this point in your training.

What to bring: We will provide water and electrolyte aid along the way but encourage you to "be independent" and have back-up. There are many reasons why, in a race situation, you may want to have some of your own stuff with you.

More questions: Contact us at [masked] or call[masked]

Go WOW Team!

Note: Today's practice run does not qualify for a free workout. All participants must be members or pay as a drop-in. Thanks!

Another Note: If we have more than 20 runners we will start people in waves. Runners must honor traffic lights and all pedestrian rules. We do not have permission to run on the street for this practice.
how_to_find_us: Meet at Crab Cove and we will walk to the official starting point of the race. Crab Cove is the finish point.
