description:
It's 'FLASH!! AA-AAHHH!!' Night at the Drive-In!

The NORTH BAY DRIVE IN PRESENTS:


FLASH GORDON
 (1980) - Rated PG - 111min. MAY 30, 2015 at **9:00PM**

GO FLASH! A film referred to by one critic as 'barking mad', nothing says 80's culture shock quite like FLASH GORDON with its mega-glam style, Max Von Sydow (Ming the Merciless) in the role he was born for, blasting soundtrack by Queen, delightfully imperfect psychedelic effects and a script that transcends 'camp' by several galactic quadrants.

Join us for a movie that was 'light years' ahead of its time, and don't forget your rocket sled!

LATER START TIME --- 9:00PM!


THIS IS A DRIVE-UP MOVIE NIGHT PROJECTED ONTO A WALL IN A PAVED LOT -- IF YOU WANT TO SIT OUTSIDE YOUR CAR, BRING BLANKETS AND LAWN CHAIRS -- START TIMES VARY THROUGHOUT THE SPRING/SUMMER/FALL SO PLEASE TAKE NOTE EACH SHOW! 'R' and 'PG' rated films may contain some content unsuitable for young children.


The movie will start after a short pre-show and trailers, just like a real theater! There is a 15 minute Intermission halfway through the show. Concessions and raffle tickets are available during pre-show and intermission only! Please arrive prior to start time to get a good parking spot. No cars after the show begins, please - but walk-ins are welcome!

...Do you love us? Donate and help us keep the movies coming!
http://bit.ly/IK6k6B


------EVENT INFO------

take time to read if this is your first time attending!

Introduction:
We're a mobile DRIVE-IN, keeping the authentic experience alive as best we can! We project a big 30 foot wide image on the side of the Old Hamilton Theater building (closed for many years now) and transmit the audio over the FM band (88.3FM) just like modern drive-ins. We operate totally via donations and even have a small concession snack bar at each performance, in addition to raffle prizes and special presentations during the intro and intermission segments!! COME JOIN US and KEEP THE DRIVE-IN ALIVE!

Drive-In Tips:
Arrive Early if you plan to park and watch from your car! There's lots of space for chairs and blankets in front, and we encourage everyone to try it if you haven't, yet. The Pre-Show runs 15-20 minutes (the movie does not start exactly at the time listed but please don't arrive late or you may not get a parking spot in the main lot). There will be a 20 minute intermission and raffle. NOTE: THERE ARE NO REGULAR RESTROOMS AT THIS LOCATION - there's the restaurant across the road, a park on Hamilton Pkwy around the corner with facilities through twilight and sometimes the church across the street has an event and we can use theirs (located in the courtyard) but otherwise we have to improvise!

Drive-In Etiquette:
CAR HEADLIGHTS AND PARKING LIGHTS OFF during the show. LARGER VEHICLES PLEASE PARK IN THE BACK ROW (Minivans, SUVs, Crossovers, Pickups). We can't always be 100% on top of this so, if you have a smaller car, do try to come early to get a FRONT row spot! And during the movie, please keep talking low volume so as not to disturb your neighbors. We also ask folks to refrain from smoking near other attendees. We encourage everyone to enjoy the summer evening and sit outside so we have some boom boxes for audio but we can't guarantee you will have the best listening experience by sitting out of your car unless you bring your own radio and/or portable with headphones. ALL CARS MUST DRIVE SLOWLY when in the parking area. Children are welcome, but need to be supervised at all times. Dogs are welcome but need to be leashed at all times. Access to parking lot usually closes after the movie starts, at which point we ask folks park in the adjacent lot and walk in with lawn chair/blanket so as not to disturb those watching the movie. Please do not drive in to the lot after the movie has started.

Snack Bar & Raffles:
DONATE for SNACKS at our Concession Stand equipped with popcorn, hot dogs, candy and refreshments! There's usually themed cupcakes and/or other treats plus A RAFFLE with awesome prizes!! Raffles are held during intermission and usually feature a movie-themed prize-pack!... Small bills greatly appreciated!

PLEASE DON'T LITTER -- TAKE ALL TRASH WITH YOU OR DEPOSIT IT WITH US AT THE CONCESSION STAND!

Advertising:
ADVERTISING is available during our pre-show. The drive-in prides itself on being a community-based event. Promote your local business or service with us and reach Marin customers. Please email Bill at [masked] for details. It's an inexpensive and effective way to promote your business to an enthusiastic audience of anywhere from 50 to 100+ per event!!

Donations:
DONATIONS are what makes this happen! You can donate at the show or via this helpful PAYPAL link with your major credit card: http://bit.ly/IK6k6B
name: Aa-aah! FLASH GORDON (1980) Rated PG

description:
sf|noir and theREGISTRYBayArea.com invite you to the second installment (in three) of GOLDEN for 2015. Join hundreds of Bay Area artists, professionals and creatives for the return of GOLDEN on Saturday, May 30, 2015 as we salute the Soul and R&B Supergroups of the 70s and 80s, along with all of the music that makes GOLDEN so special.

MUSIC :: GOLDEN brings you back to a memorable period in music. A journey back to the GOLDEN Age of Soul and R&B in one room with a special tribute on Saturday, May 30 to the Soul and R&B Supergroups you know so well and love so much, including the likes of Earth, Wind and Fire, The Commodores, The Whispers, The Gap Band and so many others. In another room, enjoy the love affair you've developed with the GOLDEN Era of Hip Hop. It's a social/cultural fusion and music mixology featuring the Bay Area's top R&B/Soul and Hip Hop DJs.

ART :: The space. 111 Minna Gallery. Visual and expressive. Expect finished works as well as works in progress. Think walls and projections.

CULTURE :: This is you interacting in the space. A collection of artists, professionals and creatives involved in social justice, food justice, volunteerism, activism, equality and economic and social advancement ... change agents for good.

PEOPLE :: If you were one of the more than 1,500 in attendance at the last three GOLDENs, you get it. If not, here's an opportunity to join the fun!

GOLDEN :: A New Intersection of Music, Art, Culture... and People returns to 111 Minna Street Gallery Saturday, May 30, 2015.

The music will move you. The art and culture will surround you. The people will engage you

Tickets: Current Individual ticket price is $20 but we have a discounted price of $15- just use the Promo access code = "goldeninsider" To purchase your tickets, click here- http://www.eventbrite.com/e/golden-an-intersection-of-music-art-cultureand-people-tickets-16689064441?aff=erelexporg
name: GOLDEN Returns! Kick Off Your Summer on May 30th

description:
This is the queer performance festival of the year. You do not want to miss it. We have an awesome lineup with three artists, each presenting a new piece about desire. It will be a super unique way to hang out with other Bay Area lesbians, and meet some new ones!

For tickets and to check out our sexy site, go here: www.thisiswhatiwantfestival.com

What do you want? Each year, the THIS IS WHAT I WANT performance festival asks its artists and audiences to explore their desires. This year, Tessa Wills and crystal am nelson present a triple bill of artists revealing hidden desires, unheard voices and invisible body parts.

Come to the festival and enter an unapologetically erotically embodied space. Cristina Victor’s “Ass Capital: Reflections of a Contemporary Culo” will be an auto-ethnographic, TED talk style lecture lead by the Victor’s ASS. In Jason Wyman's erotic poetry booth, audience members are invited to share their desires in semi-public private confessions which he will transform into poetry live. In Gigi Otálvaro-Hormillos’s new work “Psychic Gold,” she stages images of desire and converses with historical and contemporary figures like Freud, Sor Juana, and men of different backgrounds to reflect on female “masculinities.”

Share your desire with Jason. Watch Gigi work her psychic gold. Shake your ass with Cristina.

Be visible. Cruise smarter. Come to the festival.
name: THIS IS WHAT I WANT queer performance art festival

description:
San Francisco nonprofit Real Options for City Kids (R.O.C.K.) is hosting their 10th Annual Funk out with R.O.C.K. event on May 30th, 8pm at FAME Venue in San Francisco. This is a fun, over-the-top, funk music themed event featuring the live danceable sounds of Stymie & The Pimp Jones Luv Orchestra (check them out at http://onesheet.com/stymieluv/splash/) plus a funky dance competition (amateurs encouraged) with a chance to win a round trip ticket on United. Also features a silent auction, raffle, hundreds of fun San Franciscans and of course, plenty of dancing.

100% of proceeds benefit R.O.C.K. (to see what they do, visit www.rocksf.org). Tickets need to be purchased for this event by visiting http://www.eventbrite.com/e/10th-annual-funk-out-with-rock-tickets-16113027499?aff=SanFranciscoNewbies. Tickets are priced as follows so get yours before they run out:

$10 Early Bird Special
(Ends 4/30 at noon or until sold out)
$15 Advanced Ticket Sales
(Ends 5/15 at noon or until sold out)
$20 General Admission
(Ends 5/29 at noon or until sold out)
$25 Door

Come hang out and dance the night away all for a good cause!

description:
Single Women are invited to exchange bachelors at this fun party! Tonight we prove that all the men in the San Francisco Bay Area are NOT “married, gay, or dead.” Each woman is invited to bring the finest bachelor she knows, with whom she is NOT romantically involved (ex-husband, brother, father, son, friend, boss, co-worker) and introduce him to the women at the party. $10/door includes dancing to your favorite hits. 2 for 1 admission for every male/female pair who arrive together at the party. Men and women are also welcome to come alone. Adults of all ages welcome. Dressy nightclub attire requested. Saturday, May 30, 2015, 8pm-Midnight. LOCATION: Embassy Suites Hotel, 101 McInnis Pkwy, San Rafael CA 94903. From Hwy 101 take N San Pedro exit east towards the Bay; L on Civic Center Dr; R on McInnis. Free parking.

CO-SPONSORED by The Society of Single Professionals, the world’s largest non-profit singles organization; Singles2Couples; and by several singles Meetups.

MORE PARTIES at www.ThePartyHotline.com.

description:
Bassist Kurt Ribak, whose dynamic playing thrilled Meetup members at a recent bookstore performance by Jinx Jones' jazz-a-billy group, heads up a quartet for this performance, on the heels of his new CD release.

AUDIO/MORE INFO:

http://www.birdbeckett.com/kurt-ribak-quartet/

http://www.ribak.com/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QMJNeYsYSXA


COST: $10 cover charge, collected at the bookstore counter near the entrance. A small selection of wine and soft drinks is available at intermission for a donation.


SEATING is on folding chairs in the bookstore. (Seating is general-admission, natch.)


WHEN/WHERE TO MEET: Meet out front of the store by 7:45 p.m. so we can get seats. (The performance starts at 8:00 p.m.; there are 2 sets, lasting to 11:00 p.m., but people don't need to stay for the entire show.)

HOW TO FIND ME: See my photo with my Meetup profile. (I'm WF, 5 feet tall, in my 50s, with short auburn hair.) I'll send my cellphone number to RSVPers before the show.

OPTIONAL PRE-SHOW DINNER: If folks are interested, we can eat dinner before the show at a sushi restaurant across the street. Probable meeting time: shortly before 6:30 p.m. I can likely accommodate up to 6 people for that. (This restaurant also offers vegetarian options.)


TRANSIT/PARKING: The bookstore is located about a block and a half from the Glen Park BART station and Muni bus lines. Parking is on the street.

***When you RSVP, remember to let me know whether or not you're interested in the group dinner prior to the show.***
how_to_find_us: See details in the Event Description. I'll send my cellphone number to RSVPers before the event.
name: Kurt Ribak Quartet

description:
PLEASE JOIN US FOR OUR NEXT HOUSE CONCERT
IN BERKELEY! (and bring some friends!)

WHO: AIREENE ESPIRITU
along with Paul Olquin on Bass
and Brian Judd on Mandolin and Guitar

WHEN: SATURDAY, MAY 30, 2015
(Please arrive after 7;00 but before 7;30) PRICE: Sliding scale donation of $15.00 to $25.00++ per person

All proceeds go to the performers!

WHAT TO BRING: It's a potluck (and it is dinner time-ish!) so we would love for you to bring a dish to share.
HOW TO SIGN UP:
WE CAN ONLY TAKE THE FIRST 40 PEOPLE THAT SIGN-UP!
If you are interested in joining us please send an e-mail to: [masked]
Include the number of tickets you would like and names of the guests. Once we have confirmed your reservation,
we will send you the rest of the details!!

Aireene is a singer/songwriter based in Oakland, CA. Her songs are influenced by listening to Alan Lomax's field recordings from the South, and growing up listening to her uncles' Filipino folk guitar playing. She has played with a mixed genre of San Francisco bay area bands over the past years that have also influenced her music, from latin/african rhythms, folk, bluegrass pickings and inspirations from gospel music - a mix of stompin', swayin', and timeless Americana. Her music is reminiscent of front porch storytelling, of ghosts and the living, times of laughter and tears.

Her latest album, Put Back Charlie, was released in the Summer 2014, and tours solo and as well as with her band as Aireene & The Rarities. "This is our jaw dropping act of the season...she gathered some of the best musicians in town around her...She has taken off like a rocket ship and everyone is suddenly in love with the music and show of Aireene Espiritu...You might like to say, "Remember When" a short way up the musical road." - Bob Stane, The Coffee Gallery Backstage

“Espiritu’s penchant for songs that sound like they came off a 78 rpm record, listeners will be swept away.” - Good Times Weekly, Santa Cruz CA

"I love what I heard, It's perfect for my kinda folk show-- bright, melodic,rootsy and with excellent vocals and hot pickin' too. What else can a lifelong Folk DJ ask for. " - Gene Shay, aka The Grandfather of Philadelphia Folk Music, WXPN Radio, The Folk Show VIDEO: There's Something On Your Mind by Big Jay McNeely More information with videos and audio: http://www.aireeneespiritu.com. Hope to see you at the show!!
Audrey and Milton
name: House Concert In Berkeley with Aireene Espiritu

description:
We will be dining at All Spice in San Francisco.

The All Spice approach to cooking is local and seasonal whenever possible, but is also so much more. Chef Sachin Chopra stretches beyond his classical training to create elegantly composed dishes that subtly hint at Indian, Japanese, Norwegian, Mediterranean and other worldly influences. The result is a unique cuisine with its own distinctive point of view.

You can read more about the restaurant and view the menu on their web site: http://www.allspicerestaurant.com/index.html

description:
Hello Everyone,

Aswat is hosting a Tribute: Abdel Halim Hafez - Sing-Along Concert on May 30 @ 7pm. Abdel Halim Hafez is one of Egypt's most legendary artists and musician. The concert will cover Abdel Halim's most popular hits and will be projected on screen during the concert. It will be karaoke in mass - an experience that promises to be as moving and as memorable as the beloved Abdel Halim himself.

Aswat, the Bay Area's premier Arab music ensemble, features the music of the iconic Abdel Halim Hafez [masked]) in their first sing-along concert. Abdel Halim is known in the the Arab world as "Al Andaleeb Al Asmar"(The Great Dark-Skinned Nightingale), "The King of Arab Music", "The Voice of the People", "The Son of the Revolution", and "The King of Emotions and Feelings". Such titles are but a testament to the Arab world's affection and regard for Abdel Halim's contributions to Arab culture and music, and for the man himself. One might liken 'Abdel Halim's stature in the Arab world to Elvis Presley in America. Abdel Halim passed away some 38 years ago, but his legacy endures. Anybody even just slightly acquainted with Arab music is familiar with Abdel Halim Hafez.

Tickets: General $25.00 ($26.87 w/service fee)
http://halim.brownpapertickets.com/
name: Aswat: Sing-Along Abdel Halim Hafez

FYI: It's BYOB, and the alcohol needs to be concealed and we need to make sure we clean up after ourselves and not get stupid sloppy drunk. Otherwise the staff will kick us out, but they do not care if we drink there. Think about back in High School when you didn't want to get caught drinking.

This is a private room Karaoke place and depending on how many people show up we may need to get more than one, so I'm advising to please only RSVP yes if you are in fact going to come out. It just helps with planning especially if we need to reserve.

Yes this is in Oakland. However, there's a parking lot there and it's next to BART in case you want to BART in.
name: METAL KARAOKE!!!!!!!?

description:
Amor Eterno is featuring an exhibit called "Mexica Visions. " Artwork by Chamuco Cortez and Drew Flores. Please come and support this stunning exhibition. Chamuco Cortez and Drew Flores reinterpret Mexico’s ancient imagery. Each use Aztec and Chicano iconic elements daily in their work as tattoo artists. Drew blends Japanese bold composition and folklore with cholos and their Aztec ancestors. Japanese heroes are adorned with hynas, Pendleton’s and creased khakis. Chamuco heavily influenced by prison tattoos, brings life to stoic carved statues of Ehecatl, God of the wind, Coatlicue, the Earth goddess with soft shading. Chamuco and Drew venerate the art and culture that inspires them so deeply.
http://www.amoreternoarte.com/home.html

** We can meet beforehand for yummy margaritas at Penca Azul (in Alameda) at 7pm, followed by the Art Exhbit at 8:30 pm or meet at the event. Post your preference in the message board.
name: Amor Eterno - Mexican Art Exhibit: food, DJ and good times

description:
Once upon a time, two sisters named Kelly and Kamille
designed a musical style that entwined their classical
training and lush pop sensibilities. They called themselves
KARMINA "song" in Latin and wrote melodies inspired
by soulful creators from Brahms to Bjork to The Beatles.


Since then, KARMINA's imaginative arrangements and rich
vocal harmonies have appeared on major television shows
including Pretty Little Liars, Shameless, Ravenswood,
CSI: NY, Switched At Birth, and How I Met Your Mother
among others. They've written, sung, produced and performed a vast catalogue of original music; toured the US, UK and Europe; and opened for Sheryl Crow, Sara Bareilles, Carol King, Train and, most recently, John Legend at the Los
Angeles Nokia Theater.


After back to back summer tours of France and Israel, Karmina is full-speed-ahead back in the studio breaking ground with a new record that features the orchestral arranging of storied, award-winning composer John Powell (How to Train Your Dragon, The Bourne Identity).


Critics have described their new cinematic indie-pop sound
as "a cross between Florence Welch and Mumford and Sons"
replete with vivid imagery and enthralling storytelling.
Their new release, Queens of Heart, pays homage to powerful women who have made an impact, much like KARMINA strives to do in 2015.


Opening this show will be McHugh & Devine
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KCebXEGpQgY


Doors open at 7PM Music at 8PM Cheers! PS. If you're able, please bring a little nibble to share and BYOB! We appreciate your support of independent artists! Minimum suggested donation to the artist is $20 per person collected at the door! All proceeds go to the artists, so give generously so we can continue to bring performers of this caliber.


If you like what you hear (and you will) buy a CD or two.
name: Karmina at Joe's Garage!

description:
Hello awesome meetuppers!

We know you love great intimate house concerts, and folk/pop singer songwriter music, great musicianship, lyrics and melodies - we hope you'll join us!

We're playing again, at our favorite intimate music venue, the Monkey House in Berkeley. You have been amazing turning out for our shows, selling us out the last TWO times! Please join us again, it's going to be a magical evening. We'll bring the wine and gluten free beer!


We're going to preview our new EP "Graceful Mistakes" - our record is done, off to be pressed and soon available on iTunes etc. One lucky winner will get a hand pressed super pre-release from us! Please join us to hear the songs from the EP as well as a bunch of new new songs, and old favorites.

We are honored to be playing with the amazing Austin Willacy (of a capella giants the House Jacks), so it will be a great night of music.

The Monkey HouseTheater
1638 University Ave. Berkeley
(Walking distance from N. & Downtown Berkeley BART stops)

$15-$25 Sliding Scale Donation
All ages, BYOB (we'll bring some wine to share!)

Doors open at 7PM

7:30 Austin Willacy (www.austinwillacy.com)

8:45 MacClain & Cole (www.macclainandcole.com)

Our last show here was SOLD OUT, so please reserve your seats now: [masked]

The Monkey House is a comfortable, intimate art space in Ira Marlowe's "front room" offering high-quality concerts with an old Vaudeville vibe and unusually fine acoustics.

Thank you for supporting local, original music! Can't wait to see you there! Please join the facebook event and tell friends, but keep in mind that rsvp'ing on FB is NOT making a reservation - only way to do that is by e-mailing Ira. Thanks!
name: Award-Winning Folk-Pop - come again - you make it fun!

description:
Scenic landscapes are in abundance in the East Bay Regional Parks. Here we’ll find wide angle views of rolling hills, trails, a pond, farm equipment and a big red barn. Last year this time, we saw the most incredible sunset (no promises). Also bring your telephoto lens for wildlife, cows, trees, the Bay and its bridges. Be aware that there will be some hiking this time to get to the Bay view. But we will have plenty of time to go at our own pace. We will stay for sunset, so bring tripod, sturdy shoes, a warm jacket, and a flashlight.

We will meet at the park at 6:30, or at the studio at 6:00 to carpool. You can signup online (it's $25) at www.cvphotoclub.com.
name: Landscape Photography - Wide angle and Telephoto - in the Hayward Hills

Setting up roles Setting up run-list
Hands-on: Enhance already created cookbooks for a web-server role. Create additional cookbook for database server role (MySQL)

Week 3:
Chef plugins & Extensions
Berkshelf
Knife Essentials
Using public cookbooks Chef Environments
Setting up Environments
Version controlling cookbooks for different environments
Hands-on: Update cookbook’s metadata for different production/staging environment. Setup Environments on Chef-Server

Week 4:
Advanced Topics
Cookbook Notifications
Cookbook backups
Chef Security
Deployments using Chef
Knife EC2 & Search
Demo
name: DevOps: Chef Training + Project :4 weeks (Online/Class-room)

description:
Facciamo un bella serata da "potluck" e cinema sotto le stelle...

Per favore, portate un piatto/un bottiglia da condividere con tutti, e rispondete qui con cosa pensate di portare...

Film: "Benvenuti al Sud" (in italiano con sottotitoli in italiano; Commedia, 2010; regia Luca Miniero; con Claudio Bisio, Alessandro Siani, Angela Finocchiaro, Valentina Lodovini)


***Forse farà freschino quella sera, quindi sapete come vestirsi a SF e portate anche una coperta per stare caldi :) ..e anche una sedia pieghevole se possibile.

MUNI: J, 14, 22, ecc.

group.name: The San Francisco Italian Language Meetup Group

description:
Amsterdam Cafe has invited us to watch the Giant's game and Enjoy beer from San Francisco's oldest and biggest craft brewery


The event will feature an assortment of beers from Anchor and during the game your first pint of Anchor brewing beer comes with a commemorative Anchor/Giants pint glass

A brewery representative will be on hand to answer any questions you have.

We will be getting $1 off all full pours but you have to have a group name tag to get the deal so get one BEFORE you order!

Amsterdam Cafe is cash only! They have an ATM in the back but it's best to bring what you are going to need.
how_to_find_us: We'll be in there with name tags, if it isn't obvious ask the staff
name: Anchor/Giants event with a commemorative glass giveaway

description:
Free talk! Lesbians and queer women: are you tired of being single - but scared to keep getting your heart broken in relationships that don't work out?

Do you worry that you may not have all the communication and conflict-resolution skills you need for a happy, healthy relationship?

Have you ever thought maybe you should just give up on relationships altogether - perhaps your "picker" is broken, or you're asking for too much?


There IS a way to prepare your heart and mind for love, date with clarity and confidence (and have fun doing it!), stop falling for Ms. Wrong, find Ms. Right - and to go "from heartbreak to happily-ever-after." It just takes learning how.

Join us for a free two-hour talk, and learn:

• How to identify the blocks that are keeping you unhappily single – or getting hurt again and again in the wrong relationships.

• Exactly what you need to do to release these blocks, get ready for the love you want, and then find it.

Attendance is limited by the size of our meeting space... so, sign up soon. This talk is totally free, and we're also offering a full-day paid workshop the next day, for women who want to go deeper. Hope to see you there!
how_to_find_us: Second floor of the historic pink victorian building that houses Hooper's Chocolates
name: Un-Block Yourself From Love! Find "The One" And Create A Great Relationship

group.name: Conscious Girlfriend: For Happy, Healthy Lesbian/Queer Love

description:
Let's eat at Nabe in SF! [masked] ave San Francisco).

Nabe is a modern shabu shabu restaurant located in Sunset, San Francisco. Many students from SFSU and UCSF love eating here as it is a convenient location. Ingredients are all natural and organic and the ambiance is very relaxing. Let's eat.

After, we will go to a dessert place (to be decided) somewhere close by.

Timeline of events ––

6pm - dinner at Nabe

8pm - dessert

May join at any time.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Not an event organizer yet? Check out this page.

Have feedback for our meetup group? Find our top secret feedback form here!
name: Shabu Shabu Dinner

description: Our friend Antonio is launching his catering business and is a real, authentic Italian chef. His pizza is better than Delfina (for real!). Join us for a night of pizza, wine (BYOB) and good friends. $20/person for all you can eat authentic Italian thin crust pizza baked to perfection right in front of you. Guaranteed good times.
name: EAT: Italian Chef Antonio bakes Pizza to Perfection

description:
Leap Motion is happy to attend San Francisco's number one VR meetup. We'll demoing on the expo floor. Come see our new Image Hand assets!

From the SFVR meetup page:

CLICK HERE TO GET A TICKET (only $10)

********************************************

SFVR is proud to announce our next event is a Project Tango Hackathon & VR Expo. During the day, Bay Area developers willcompete to win free Google Project Tango devices in a fun and fast-paced VR hackathon. In the evening, a massive VR Expo will open to the public. Attendees will get to try the latest virtual reality technology and also judge the hackathon winners. You’ll be able to try Project Tango combined with Durovis DIVE, an exciting new VR hardware platform. SFVR #9’s location will be at Adobe’s headquarters in downtown San Francisco. Google will be providing free catering for the event. Join us for a day of cutting-edge software development and a night of unforgettable VR demos and celebration. See you there!

Want to join the hackathon? Sorry, the hackathon application period has ended.

Want to try the latest VR devices and software? PURCHASE A TICKET (only $10)

EXPO ATTRACTIONS

• Over 250 VR industry insiders and enthusiasts

• VR Technology Demos

• Free catering provided by Google

• Try Google's Project Tango device combined with Durovis DIVE.

• Judge the winners of the Project Tango hackathon


EXHIBITORS

FOVE - The world's first eye tracking virtual reality headset. Available for pre-order now on Kickstarter.

Tilt Brush - Tilt Brush is a Virtual Reality Tool that paints the Space all around you. Paint thick, three-dimensional brush strokes, smoke, stars. Even light. Tilt Brush will be presented on an HTC Vive developer kit. There will be a very limited number of demos. Realistically, we're looking at about 20-30 demos total during the 4 hour expo. We'll have a sign up sheet for Tilt Brush and it will be first-come-first-serve.

Leap Motion - Tiny device. Huge possibilities. Reach into new worlds and control your computer in a whole new way. The Leap Motion Controller tracks both hands and all 10 fingers with incredible speed – so you can play, create, and explore without touching anything.

Innerspace - Innerspace is a VR software studio that focuses on artistic and cultural experiences. We aim to become a leading provider of high quality content for the emerging VR market.

Greenlight VR - Greeenlight VR contains more than 1,000,000 fully verified data points on Virtual Reality professionals, projects and companies. Our customers use our data and insights to discover developer talent, keep an eye on industry trends, do competitive research and find potential clients.

Lily Pad - Oculus Mobile VR Jam finalist. Lily Pad introduces players to Willie and Dee, two friends that set out to save their town from a drought that is preventing crops and food growing on the land. Lily Pad was created by a team of 10 developers. As part of the videogame track of the competition the developer hopes to secure a grand prize of $200,000 USD.

EVENT SPONSORS

• Google

• Adobe

• Boost.VC

• Leap Motion
name: Leap Motion @ SFVR #9

description:

YOU MUST SIGN UP USING EVENTBRITE!

CLICK HERE TO GET A TICKET (only $10)

********************************************

• VR Technology Demos

• Free catering provided by Google

• Try Google's Project Tango device combined with Durovis DIVE.

• Judge the winners of the Project Tango hackathon

We'll have a sign up sheet for Tilt Brush and it will be first-come-first-serve.

Ricoh Theta - This is not just an ordinary camera. It is a spherical camera that captures the space around you. And with just one touch.


Leap Motion - Tiny device. Huge possibilities. Reach into new worlds and control your computer in a whole new way. The Leap Motion Controller tracks both hands and all 10 fingers with incredible speed – so you can play, create, and explore without touching anything.

Innerspace - Innerspace is a VR software studio that focuses on artistic and cultural experiences. We aim to become a leading provider of high quality content for the emerging VR market.

Lily Pad - Oculus Mobile VR Jam finalist. Lily Pad introduces players to Willie and Dee, two friends that set out to save their town from a drought that is preventing crops and food growing on the land. Lily Pad was created by a team of 10 developers. As part of the videogame track of the competition the developer hopes to secure a grand prize of $200,000 USD.

EVENT SPONSORS

• Google

• Adobe

• Boost.VC

• Leap Motion


HACKATHON FORMAT


• Doors open at 9 AM. Breakfast and coffee will be served. Please arrive on time!

• Planning is encouraged. Bring an idea and port it to the Project Tango platform.

• Every team wins free swag.

• Every member of the top 3 winning teams receives a free Project Tango tablet.

• Entries will be judged by the audience according to the following criteria:

• Attractiveness

• Usefulness

• Immersiveness

• Fun

• Audience Reaction

• Bonus Points: Uploading app to the Play Store

• There will be frequent check-ins from Project Tango team members and community members during the hackathon

• Food and drink will be served to each team

SCHEDULE


9:00 AM - Doors open to hackathon competitors only

9:00 AM - Breakfast served

10:00 AM - Introduction

10:10 AM - Presentation: Getting Started with Google’s Project Tango

10:30 AM - Hackathon Rules and Agenda

10:40 AM - Hackathon Kick-off

12:00 PM - Lunch served

6:00 PM - Doors open to public / VR expo begins

7:30 PM - Show start. SFVR introduction. Expo breaks.

7:35 PM - Talk: Project Tango

7:40 PM - Announcements from the audience

7:50 PM - Hack Presentations begin. 2 minutes each.

8:35 PM - Hack Presentations finish

8:35 PM - Judging begins

8:40 PM - Judging finishes

8:45 PM - Winners announced. Prizes awarded.

8:50 PM - Thanks and conclusion. Expo opens.

10:00 PM - Expo closes. Event over.


FAQ

Are there ID requirements or an age limit to enter the event?

This is a 21+ event.

What are my transport/parking options getting to the event?

Public transit is highly recommended! We’re one block from 4th and King Caltrain. Or, we’re a 15 minute walk from Civic Center BART. Multiple bus lines will take you here. There is also Bay Area Bike Share station right in front of the office. Very limited bicycle and car parking will be provided by Adobe on a first-come-first-serve basis. Otherwise, there is nearby street parking.

Are there any event restrictions?

You’ll need to sign a standard Adobe NDA (non-disclosure agreement) to enter their office. Also, it is Adobe’s policy to disallow photography in the event space.

Where can I contact the organizer with any questions?

Email us at [masked]

Is my registration/ticket transferrable?

No.

What is the refund policy?

We don't offer refunds, sorry.

COMMUNITY SPONSOR


Silicon Valley VR - Thanks Karl & Nana! You guys rock :)
name: SFVR #9: Hackathon & Expo

Bring guests if you wish. This will be a good time to have some fun. Bring something tasty to eat (love home cooking or the deli section) or drink for four people. Will also be inviting my Facebook friends.
how_to_find_us: Find the condo, find us, pretty easy!
name: Yummy Potluck & Games too!

group.name: San Francisco Catholic Alumni Club Singles

description:
Let's head back and checkout the Marina which has acquired a reputation for it's 'college-fratboy' environment. Everyone in the group is encouraged to wear Golden State Warrior gear. We'll parade around the Marina in support of this awesome season they've had. We're going to start out at Lightning Tavern around 5:30pm which is usually before the evening rush comes crashing in which should make it easy for us to group up. Per usual, we'll be checking out some of the best places to visit in the Marina. Please note that the crawl isn't so much about drinking as it is about seeing and learning about new places and meeting new people!

The Early Bird tickets will be priced at $7. There is a limited amount and once they're sold out General Admission tickets will be sold at $10. I will accept purchases at the door but cash only.


PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS HERE

See our first crawl - Downtown SF. 11 bars & 2.6mi walking (14 attendees)


See our second crawl - Mission Dist. 12 bars & 2.4mi walking (48 attendees)

See our first SOMA crawl - SOMA Dist. 13 bars & 1mi walking (92 attendees)

Check out another SOMA crawl - 120 attendees

Keep in mind we don't grab a drink @ every location and how long we stay ranges from a quick walk-through to drinks and dinner depending on the bar's capacity and comfort.

As always, each of these locations are known for something different and each provide a fun atmosphere to meet new people or bring a friend.

PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE

The walk is approximately 1mi of walking which will convert to about 20 minutes of total walking. We're going to be visiting a total of 12 different bars. I'm planning on spending anywhere from 5-30 minutes in each location depending on if we're just checking it out or grabbing a drink.


Parking: Parking may be a pain since the Marina doesn't have much street availability. If you're able to find a metered spot it's FREE after 6pm, but always check. If you park on an incline don't forget to turn your tires! The area is also accessible by bus. Please respect the signs and use ParkMe.com if you want to find more parking options.

Balboa Cafe - Balboa Cafe is one of my favorite spots in Mill Valley. The Balboa Cafe in SF is relatively similar. It attracts an older and unique crowd that is known for their strong personalities and creative pickup lines. Balboa Cafe is also a local favorite serving up the classics, including the famous Balboa Burger that sits on many lists as one of the best burgers in San Francisco.

Eastside West - Eastside West is a very 'Marina' gastro-pub located on one of the most popular corners in the Marina. With Balboa Cafe, Matrix, KT's and City Tavern within a block you always get an interested crowd here. They also have a DJ and do fun events on a regular basis. During the day it's a fun bar that "serves simple but bold dishes that are local and organic wherever possible, in a lively, social setting."

KT's - KT's has a reputation for being 'blackout central' but can be a really fun spot to dance and hangout. It's your typical bar-turned-club on the weekends. There biggest problem is the ongoing issue of stolen phones. Ladies, keep your bags closed! I've had a friend get her phone snatched right out of her bag. It happens often here. Overall you'll find a very 'Marina' based demographic here trying to get over a long week.

Matrix - Martix is a pretty fun lounge located alongside Eastside West and right across from Balboa Cafe, City Tavern, and Pizza Orgasmica. I've seen this lounge slammed as well as empty on just about any given night. They have a long bar, fun dancing, a lounge atmosphere, and some aggressive bartenders. If the DJ is on it's a fun spot to stop and dance for awhile.

Stock In Trade - Stock In Trade is a fun bar that features a fun attractive crowd. The Marina community is strong here and they feature an indoor bocce ball court. Located right on Lombard st there is always people wandering around and typically a bacon-hotdog stand within sight.

Tacko - Tacko isn't really much of a bar but rather a taqueria worth mention. They have a few beers for purchase but are know for their 'Nick Style' tacos and awesome Taco Tuesday specials. I highly recommend checking it out sometime with friends.

HiFi - HiFi is a fun hip bar that really gets your senses going. With different colors and good lighting you're always bound to leave in a good mood. The crowd here is slightly different from your typical Marina crowd and somehow they've managed to stay off most radars.

Lightning Tavern - Lightning Tavern is your basic bar with an awesome twist. While this isn't where you're going to stop to watch the big game, Lightning has two different times in the day when they randomly declare 'lightning round' and the bartender rings a bell. This means that for the next 10 minutes your drinks are $1. Last time I was there we were able to stock up on three drinks a piece before the end of the round.

The Brick Yard - The Brick Yard is possibly one of my favorite spots to watch a warriors game. Let alone the fact that it is right next to Rome (one of my favorite burger joints), it also has a long bar, some comfortable booth seating, and plenty of TVs to catch the game on.

Bus Stop - The Bus Stop is yet another divey and fun bar in the Marina. There is a pool table in the back, some seating near the bar, and they have trivia night a few nights out of the week. It's the type of bar where everyone knows the bartender and visits regularly.

The Blue Light - Blue Light has one of the longest bars in the Marina and is a fun after work spot to grab a drink

Sabrosa - What used to be City Tavern has now turned into Sabrosa which is a fun and fancy tequila bar located right on the corner by Eastside West and Babloa Cafe. The restaurant bar is an ideal date spot and has a well lit dining room and a trendy feel to it.

The Bear Republic - The Republic as it's called in SF is actually a branch of The Bear Republic Brewery. This is a relatively new bar but has caught on fast as a local favorite. Featuring a variety of CA and other micro brews for a mere $5 a beer this bar is a hot destination for beer consumers.

Silver Cloud - This is actually where I watch the superbowl two years ago. It's a fun bar that hosts some pretty entertaining karaoke nights. They also have an occasional live band and one huuuge TV near the bar for sports.

Tipsy Pig - Tipsy Pig is my #1 stop on a Sunday morning after a long weekend. It's a fun little bar that provides good sports and amazing bloody marys. They also have a good food selection to recover from any kind of damage you caused yourself the night before.

Bar None - Known for it's distinct 'stuck in college' crowd, Bar None has a very divey feel to it and features beer pong tables, sticky floors, and plenty of random games to keep anyone occupied for hours.

The Cellar Door - "An intimate Wine bar and lounge, offering a variety of global wine and specialty beer, as well as delicious small plates of food. Formerly Pe Yale, Cellar Door was constructed using reclaimed materials to give it a unique vibe that appeals to all crowds. whether you’re looking to cozy up to a date or meet friends out for a good night, Cellar Door is the place for you."

If you have any questions or concerns please contact me on Facebook HERE.

I'm looking forward to seeing everyone again soon!

Arthur G. Bahr

Please drink responsibly and don't drive under the influence!

I've seen this lounge slammed as well as empty on just about any given night. They have a long bar, fun dancing, a lounge atmosphere, and some aggressive bartenders. If the DJ is on it's a fun spot to stop and dance for awhile.

Stock In Trade - Stock In Trade is a fun bar that features a fun attractive crowd. The Marina community is strong here and they feature an indoor bocce ball court. Located right on Lombard st there is always people wandering around and typically a bacon-hotdog stand within sight.

Tacko - Tacko isn't really much of a bar but rather a taqueria worth mention. They have a few beers for purchase but are know for their 'Nick Style' tacos and awesome Taco Tuesday specials. I highly recommend checking it out sometime with friends.

HiFi - HiFi is a fun hip bar that really gets your senses going. With different colors and good lighting you're always bound to leave in a good mood. The crowd here is slightly different from your typical Marina crowd and somehow they've managed to stay off most radars.

Lightning Tavern - Lightning Tavern is your basic bar with an awesome twist. While this isn't where you're going to stop to watch the big game, Lightning has two different times in the day when they randomly declare 'lightning round' and the bartender rings a bell. This means that for the next 10 minutes your drinks are $1. Last time I was there we were able to stock up on three drinks a piece before the end of the round.

The Brick Yard - The Brick Yard is possibly one of my favorite spots to watch a warriors game. Let alone the fact that it is right next to Rome (one of my favorite burger joints), it also has a long bar, some comfortable booth seating, and plenty of TVs to catch the game on.

Bus Stop - The Bus Stop is yet another divey and fun bar in the Marina. There is a pool table in the back, some seating near the bar, and they have trivia night a few nights out of the week. It's the type of bar where everyone knows the bartender and visits regularly.

The Blue Light - Blue Light has one of the longest bars in the Marina and is a fun after work spot to grab a drink

Sabrosa - What used to be City Tavern has now turned into Sabrosa which is a fun and fancy tequila bar located right on the corner by Eastside West and Babloa Cafe. The restaurant bar is an ideal date spot and has a well lit dining room and a trendy feel to it.

The Bear Republic - The Republic as it's called in SF is actually a branch of The Bear Republic Brewery. This is a relatively new bar but has caught on fast as a local favorite. Featuring a variety of CA and other micro brews for a mere $5 a beer this bar is a hot destination for beer consumers.

Silver Cloud - This is actually where I watch the superbowl two years ago. It's a fun bar that hosts some pretty entertaining karaoke nights. They also have an occasional live band and one huuuge TV near the bar for sports.

Tipsy Pig - Tipsy Pig is my #1 stop on a Sunday morning after a long weekend. It's a fun little bar that provides good sports and amazing bloody marys. They also have a good food selection to recover from any kind of damage you caused yourself the night before.

Bar None - Known for it's distinct 'stuck in college' crowd, Bar None has a very divey feel to it and features beer pong tables, sticky floors, and plenty of random games to keep anyone occupied for hours.

The Cellar Door - "An intimate Wine bar and lounge, offering a variety of global wine and specialty beer, as well as delicious small plates of food. Formerly Pe Yale, Cellar Door was constructed using reclaimed materials to give it a unique vibe that appeals to all crowds. whether you’re looking to cozy up to a date or meet friends out for a good night, Cellar Door is the place for you."

If you have any questions or concerns please contact me on Facebook HERE.

I'm looking forward to seeing everyone again soon!

Arthur G. Bahr

Please drink responsibly and don't drive under the influence!
name: Ultimate Pub Crawl - Tour de Marina

group.name: Drinks, Dancing, & Fun for SF Professionals

description:
Artemis Gaitanou and her friend Vic Artiga will perform live music during Happy Hour from 5 - 8 PM at Kawika’s. This will be the last chance to enjoy Artemis live before she moves back to Greece in a few weeks.

Artemis is from Greece and is the lead vocalist, violin player and keyboardist, while Vic, who grew up in the Richmond District, is on strings. They play Jazz, Smooth Soul, GREEK and Ruckus Classic Rock! Happy Hour starts at 5 pm and Live Music begins at 5:30 pm. This should be a FUN musical happy hour, so come enjoy the diverse sound with your friends or meet new friends! OPA! If you missed their last performance, make sure you plan on catching this one - they're terrific!

Kawika's offers Delicious Greek Lamb Gyros with homemade Tzatziki, Greek Salad, Greek Coffee, Baklava and Yummy affordable Wine and Beer along with Fresh Baked Sourdough Rolls and Traditional Deli Delights so come hungry and thirsty!

Kawika's is located at 734 La Playa St @ Balboa in San Francisco.

There is street parking or a large free lot 1 block away at Balboa and the Great Highway.

About the Musicians:


Artemis started violin at the age of five at the National Conservatory of Athens where she later received her degree, diploma and masters on classical violin and a degree in contemporary vocal technique. Then she received her B.A. in Music, Dance and Theater Arts at the American College of Greece. She has played with the Athens State Orchestra and the National Opera House Orchestra in Athens, Greece. She has sung and performed with various musicians such as pianists Dimitri Toufexis and Tatiana Papageorgiou as well as great opera singers Effie Minakoulis and Maria Kokka.

Victor has been studying, performing and teaching guitar for close to thirty years and played with worship, rock blues, soul and country artists. Likewise, he has played extensively in Hawaii with The Casual Lifters and Jay Elliot and here in California with Madison Blues Band, Dave Crim men Group, Erica Sunshine Lee, Danielle Brand and his own bands The Weekend Tsunami and the V.I.P.'s.
name: Live Music and Happy Hour at Kawika's

description:
Photograph unique views of the city and it's architecture that not many people take the time to experience! We will visit at least three rooftop terraces and take advantage of the late afternoon light. There will be many sights to see, unusual perspectives and maybe even an indoor waterfall... and either sun or fog will create interesting atmospheres.

We will be on a walking tour with an expert on San Francisco rooftops, Marilyn Straka. In addition to guiding us to through the rooftops terraces, she is very knowledgeable about the city and will point out areas of particular interest.

The tour starts at 5PM, but we will meet 15 minutes early at the Rincon Center. Enter on the Mission St. side.

Gear: tripods will be allowed. Other recommendations would be wide angle lenses, telephoto lenses, ND filters.

For those of you who might like to meet for a bite to eat prior to the walk, please let me know under Comments.
how_to_find_us: Rincon Center, enter on the Mission St. side
name: Rooftop Gardens of San Francisco

description:
Creativity, Meditation and Consciousness

Find out how to breaking through artists block and finding creative freedom. Samantha Keen will use a model of consciousness developed by the Clairvision School of meditation to show you how to find your own pathway to creative inspiration. Using tools of "mapping consciousness" to connect to the Creative Power of Life, the Creative Power of Love and the Creative Power of Opening, she will talk about her own process as a meditator, a writer and practitioner of Inner Space Techniques.


Samantha says:
"When I first began to use these techniques I was a journalist, and my editor was completely blown away by how fast and frictionless I became, not to mention stunned that I was no longer stressed in the same way everyone at the office was all the time."

You will learn
* How life force or Qi is a real experience that holds infinite creative potential
* How high states of inspiration can be clearly identified and then available at any time
* How you can hold a project from pre-seed through to the blossoming of its full potential and beyond, with meditation-based dynamic awareness


Samantha Keen has a Masters of Arts (writing) which included writing an exegesis about the creative process itself. She was a financial journalist for over 12 years, before she dried up with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome and found a cure through the Clairvision School's meditation techniques. This style of meditation both cured her health issues and totally changed her approach to creativity, and continues to feed her life and her work with clients and on the page in new ways every single day.
Samantha lives in El Cerrito, CA, sees clients in Berkeley and San Francisco. Learn more about her at www.vitalswitch.com
name: Free Talk: Tapping into Your Creative Inspiration at Will

description:
SF Atheists May meeting

For our May meeting, we welcome Chris Highland to discuss Nature is (Super) Enough. "Biologist E.O. Wilson has said that the earth is a little-known planet. We hardly know anything about our own home. With this in mind, we need to plug in and charge up our sense of wonder. Wondering and wandering naturalists like John Muir and John Burroughs liked to mingle the words Beauty, Nature, and God. Almost Pantheists, these naturalistic writers could best be described as Pan-Naturists. For them, life itself is a living web—a vibrant wilderness classroom open for exploration. They had little time for the distractions of an imagined super-Nature.

Former Presbyterian Minister, Interfaith Chaplain, author, and educator Chris Highland will take us on a “hike of ideas and images” based on his writings and his College of Marin course, 'A Wild Spirituality of Nature.' Theists and non-theists are finding literal common ground through a close investigation of their common world. Belief-systems fade in the face of the real issues we all need to address collaboratively. Chris will draw from his experience as a Secular Chaplain and his long involvement with inclusive non-profits."

Saturday May 30
4:30 pm, doors open at 4 pm

Club Quarters Hotel
424 Clay St. at Battery
Niantic meeting room, lower level (take the lobby elevator down to LL)

Free, cash donations always welcome
Near the Embarcadero Muni/BART station
Parking at street meters or at the nearby Embarcadero lot.

Join us for dinner and drinks in the 'hood after the meeting.
name: SF Atheists May meeting

description:
RSVP@ http://bit.ly/LFNvegetarian

Unlike the northern regions of India, where wheat flourishes and is milled into an array of Naans, Rotis and ghee-soaked Parathas, southern India is tropical, shaded by coconut and banana trees and filled with forests of black pepper as juicy as berries on the vine.

South Indian cuisine is rice based. Rice is combined with lentils to make wonderful Dosas, Idlis, Vadas and Uttapams. These items are glorious and delicious besides being nourishing and digestible (due to the fermenting process). They are combined with Sambhar (lentils cooked with veggies and spices), Chutneys (lentil, coconut or veggie based sauce like accompaniment) or Idli podi (spiced powder mixed with oil).

In this three-hour hands on class, you will get to learn how to make:

- Dosa: Gluten free crisp savory crepes made with fermented batter of rice and lentil mix
- Vegetable Uthappam: South Indian thick pancake made like a skillet pizza with Dosa batter and choice of veggies topping
- Potato Masala: Mashed potatoes mixed with spices as a filling for Dosa
- Coconut milk Chutney: Savory sauce that pairs well with Dosa and Uthappam
- Milagai Podi : Also known as "Idli Podi". A coarse powder mixture of ground spices made with dry red chilies, lentils and sesame seeds. This is traditionally used as a condiment for many south Indian dishes but mainly for Idlis and Dosas
- Mile High Chai: Special Chai (tea with milk)
name: Dosa and Uthappam, a South Indian Vegetarian Classic

description:
Cooking Class Info: We will be learning the following in this class: Duration: 3 hours:

1) Dosa :- Gluten free crisp savory crepes made with fermented batter of rice and lentil mix.

2) Vegetable Uthappam:- South Indian thick pancake made like a skillet pizza with dosa batter and choice of veggies topping.

3) Potato Masala:- Tasty mashed potatoes mixed with spices that is used as a filling for the dosa.

3) Coconut milk Chutney:- savoury sauce like accompaniment that pairs well with dosa and uthappam

4) Milagai Podi :- Also known as "idli podi" is a coarse powder mixture of ground spices that is made with dry red chillies, lentils and sesame seeds. This is traditionally used as a condiment for many south Indian dishes but mainly for Idlis and dosas.

5) Mile High Chai:- Special chai (tea with milk)

We give intro of all ingredients used and go over the items that we are planning to teach you. This will be hands on class where you will get opportunity to make your own dosa and uthappam. We provide you with all the recipes which we are teaching in our recipe booklet. After the class, everybody can eat together.We also provide online support. Anytime you need help regarding the recipes or if you have any doubts regarding food, you can email us and we will get back to you."
name: South Indian Vegetarian cooking class

description:
Saturday, May 30th, 4:00pm – 5:30pm: Join the San Francisco Green Film Festival, May 28 – June 3 at the Roxie Theater,[masked]th St., San Francisco, for a week of films and events that spotlight the world’s most urgent environmental issues and most innovative solutions. Check out their fantastic line-up of new & inspiring environmental films. Wild Equity will be there on May 30th at 4:00pm in support of Bay Area filmmaker Gail Mallimson, and her latest documentary, The Edge of the Wild.

The Edge of the Wild
(Gail Mallimson, USA, 2015, 60 min)

World Premiere. A life-long resident of Brisbane, CA, is determined to save the last population of rare butterflies (including our friend the Mission Blue!) from the luxury housing planned for San Bruno mountain. Bay Area filmmaker Gail Mallimson brings us this epic battle between private property rights and the survival of a species, with implications for national environmental policy.

Followed by discussion with: Gail Mallimson, director

For more info and tickets: www.greenfilmfest.org or (415)[masked] or [masked].

Website: www.theedgeofthewild.com

Facebook: The Edge of the Wild SF Green FilmFest

Twitter: @greenfilmfest @GMallimson
name: The Edge of the Wild at SF Green FilmFest!

description:
For over 30 years, residents of the small town of Brisbane, CA, just south of San Francisco, have fought to save rare butterflies on private land planned for luxury housing on San Bruno mountain. This epic battle between private property rights and the survival of a species has resulted in a major shift in national environmental policy. Bay Area filmmaker Gail Mallimson tells the story of this struggle both past and present, through the eyes of a life-long resident of Brisbane who is determined to save the last population of these butterflies before they are gone forever.


More info and tickets can be found here: http://bit.ly/1ERINAa­
name: THE EDGE OF THE WILD with Director Gail Mallimson

description:
We are going to do a few exercise to get to know each other quickly and authentically on the green of Yerba Buena Gardens. Let me know if you have any questions!

Exercise One: Peer introduction.

Instead of having you introduce yourself to the group. We will have you introduce yourself to a randomly assigned buddy. Then this buddy will be responsible for introducing you to the group as a new friend. You will be responsible for introducing your buddy to the group as well. I think this exercise will give us a bit different perspective in hearing about our life told through a third person. I think the problem with self-introduction is that you will be stressed or pre-occupied to introduce yourself and you may have forgotten to listen to other people and that might defeat the purpose of self-introduction.

Exercise Two: Something to Bring

For this exercise, bring something you enjoy or that is important to you. It could be a photo, a book, a song, an app, a poem, a little story or an encounter. Be creative. Something that says something about you. Something that is interesting to you, or that you enjoy or that is important to you. If you are a guitarist or knows a portal instrument, you are welcome to bring a piece!

Exercise Three: Personal Goals

We will have every member to write down a specific personal goal they have for themselves on a piece of paper without identifying yourself. You will fold it up and put it in a box. I will then read these goals to the group and let the group share their thoughts and related experience on these goals. The goal of this exercise is to find what is in common among us despite all the differences we have with one another. I think at the end of the day, friendships is about understanding what is important to our friends and help one another reach our goals and be mutually supportive.

Afterwards, I will encourage members to maybe make dinner plans with one another if there is a connection.
name: Authentic Speed Friending

description:
Note that this book was originally going to be discussed in March but that discussion had to be rescheduled -- if you read it for the March discussion, we would still love to hear what you think!


In the near future, a meningitis-like disease has swept through the world population, leaving 1% of its victims "locked in" in their own bodies, unable to speak or interact with the outside world. In the aftermath of the epidemic, it's discovered that another small population has the capacity to be "ridden," letting the locked-in use their bodies and minds like they were their own. Nothing could go wrong with this, right? A sci-fi thriller that Andrew Liptak from io9 calls "one of John Scalzi's most accessible (and relevant) novels." Come talk it over with us!
name: Book Discussion: Lock In, by John Scalzi

description:
Time for Healing – Creative Meditation

Sit back, relax and be guided through a mind and body relaxation and visualization.
Leave with an increased sense of well-being, with a positive and peaceful state of mind.

Suitable for both beginners and those who are more experienced in meditation.

Meditation helps to reduce stress, and develops a sense of inner peace, joy, and strength. Join the team from the San Francisco Brahma Kumaris Center for weekly free meditation classes at Satori. The SF Brahma Kumaris Center offers a variety of programs for self development, instruction in meditation, and open their doors to all faith traditions and denominations to come and learn how to be peaceful together. They are an important member of the interfaith community of San Francisco Bay Area and promote the values of the city. Take time out of your busy day to relax and refresh with guided meditation. No reservation required. No previous meditation experience required.
name: Creative Meditation - Time for Healing

description:
Last month's bonfire beach party was a huge success with over 50 adventurers in attendance. This month we are doing it again!

Check out more pics from the last party here.


This time we are having the party on the beach, and then the bonfire after party at Chaz's beach house. We will play Spikeball, volleyball, and various games on the beach while we eat and drink and enjoy the summer weather. We'll end the beach part with watching the sunset and launching some sky lanterns.

http://www.scouting.org/filestore/HealthSafety/skylantern.jpg?w=300&as=1

Then we will move the party to Chaz's house where we'll have a big bonfire and make s'mores. After that we'll party the night away with friends, music, and plenty of wine.


This is one summer beach party you don't want to miss!


Cost:

$15 per person to cover food, snacks, and drinks

The Plan:

03:00 PM: Meet on the beach and set up
03:30 PM: Spikeball, Volleyball, card games, party games, snacks, and drinks!
05:00 PM: Fire up the grill and cook up some hot dogs and sausages
07:00 PM: Watch the sunset together
07:30 PM: Clean up and head to Chaz's house for the bonfire
08:00 PM: Bonfire after party!

Getting there:

The 7 and 18 bus lines get you very close to the meeting spot.

The N train is a 6 block walk from the meeting spot.

I recommend carpooling because parking around the after party may be limited.

Lyft: Use this link to get $20 towards your first ride

What to bring:

Bring anything that will make your time at the beach enjoyable.

• Sunglasses/sunblock/hat

• Jacket/sweatshirt/warm socks

• Blanket

• Headlamp/flashlight (for after the sun sets)

• Flip flops

• Games


A note about food and drinks:

The $15 will cover the necessities such as beer, liquor, mixers, ice, hot dogs, sausages, s'mores, condiments, chips, cookies, utensils, plates, cups, etc.

If you enjoy other types of snacks and beverages, please bring some to share. We can always use more beer, liquor, and ready to eat foods like salads.

If you have dietary restrictions and need special items, please let me know.
name: [Ocean beach] Beach BBQ, games, and bonfire at Chaz's house [$15]

description:

For this first gathering I suggest we meet at Ocean Beach as there usually isn't a shortage of parking and space shouldn't be a concern either. We can throw a football around or hike around the trails near Land's End. We'll play it by ear! If anyone has chairs, umbrellas, or towels feel free to bring them. I plan on bringing mine as well. Also, if you want to bring some food we can turn this thing into a potluck. I'll probably bring some chips and drink depending on how many RSVPs we get. Totally up to you and in no way a requirement. I'll put out a bright blue beach umbrella so you can locate the meeting area. It'll most likely be close to the intersection between Fulton and Great Highway.

If anyone else has any suggestions, feel free to express yourself in the comments section below. Thanks and hope to see you there!

Aquest mes ens trobem a Berkeley prop del Lake Anza. Com sempre, es un "potluck", aixi que si us plau, porteu menjar per rostir/compartir i/o begudes per compartir. Tambe podeu portar el banyador per si us ve de gust fer un banyet al llac. L'aigua es freda pero molt recomfortant!

Un cop entreu al Tilden Park, seguiu Lake Anza Road i aparqueu a l'aparcament de gravilla que hi ha abans de l'aparcament d'esfalt just abans del llac. Al final d'aquest aparcament de GRAVILLA es pot veure el senyal, "Spillway Picnic Site", baixeu les escales i ja hi sou. Us hi esperem! Susan

Hi everyone!!

This month we're meeting in Berkeley close to Lake Anza. As always, it's a potluck so please bring food to grill and share, and/or drinks to share. You can also bring a swimsuit if you'd like to take a dip in the lake. The water is cold but refreshing!


Once you enter Tilden Park, follow Lake Anza Road and park on the gravel parking lot that comes before the asphalt parking lot that's closes to the lake. At the end of the GRAVEL parking lot you'll see the sign "Spillway Picnic Site", go down the stairs and we're right there. Hope to see you there! Susan

description:
Fire-up your imagination Instructions!
Who as a kid has not found animals, faces or people in clouds? Get into the habit of using random shapes to get your imagination started. Abstract shapes are seeds to grow your creativity from. The key is to keep an open mind and “question” the shape you discover. Find objects, animals and people in clouds, peeled bark on trees, moss, lichen, negative shapes in foliage, stains on old walls and geometric patterns on carpets or wallpapers.

Drop-ins are welcome!

2:15-2:45 Photographing Textures
We will be starting outside photographing textures!

2:45-3:15 Printing The Images
We will be printing one of your images at Redux.

3:15-4:15 Creating the Artwork
Once printed use your image to create your artwork. Please respect others by keeping discussion to a minimum during the actual work time.

4:15-4:30 Discussion (Depending how many attend)
Each person will have 2-3 minutes to discuss their work.

4:30ish Photograph work for meetup.com (optional) & clean up.

What To Bring:

1. Camera
Phone cameras will work best, if you bring a regular camera make sure it has an SD card or a way to get your image off your camera at Redux.

Note: If you do not own a phone camera do some pre-homework! Start taking pictures now to bring with you. If you don't own a camera, try looking through magazines.

2. Art supplies
Paint, pencils and/or ink, whatever you are in the mood for. Canvas, paper, etc. We will have limited supplies for those who need them.

- - -

Every last Saturday of the month we meet at Redux, they give us lots of work space, kitchen for rinsing, bathrooms, tables and chairs in the back studio area.

$3-$5 Redux Meetup's suggested donation.

To see what is going on lately visit us on facebook!
https://www.facebook.com/groups/alamedaartists/


Check out our meeting location:
https://www.facebook.com/ReduxStudiosandGallery

description:
Nafsi Ya Jamii is an urban retreat center led by people of color to provide spaces for individuals, organizations and communities to re-imagine themselves in the heart of East Oakland.


Nafsi ya Jamii provides a space where spirit and body and action and healing can co-exist.


The center is built by long-time progressive community leaders Patricia St. Onge and Wilson Riles and their family in the Laurel District. They have built a community farm, multiple healing spaces including a sweat lodge and meditation room, space for organizational retreats, and yurts on a few plots of land in this diverse urban residential district.

Pat & Wilson and their children live in two houses as part of the center, one of which they acquired later in order to expand the land.

We will be going to help on one of their community work days to clean-up and help plant in their garden or farm, and then circle up with Pat to learn about how they've built the center, what's come of the process, and how they've overcome challenges.

So please come with work clothes & questions for learning & dialogue!

ABOUT Nafsi Ya Jamii:


We are an urban farm, retreat and renewal center. Nafsi ya Jamii is the Swahili phrase that translates to The Soul Community. We seek individual justice through social change.


The core values that we seek to embody through our work and lives include authenticity, reciprocity, fun, wholeness, health and wellness, discernment/wisdom and love of learning.

We honor the words of Howard Thurman, "Don’t ask what the world needs. Ask what makes you come alive, and then go do that. Because what the world needs is people who have come alive.”

We maintain a seven generations perspective in all that we do, honoring the generations who have come before and mindful that our actions will have an impact on the generations who come after.


Our mission is to create a sustainable community by shifting perspectives and changing how things are done, through restoring and practicing traditional indigenous ways in a 21st Century context.


www.facebook.com/Nafsiyajamii


www.facebook.com/Fullharvesturbanfarm


http://nafsiyajamii.weebly.com


Patricia St. Onge is the founder of Seven Generations Consulting and brings over twenty years of experience leading and working with nonprofit and public sector agencies. She provides training, consulting and technical assistance in the areas of community organizing, social justice advocacy, organizational development, cross-cultural effectiveness, consensus building, spiritual & personal coaching. Patricia serves on the board of directors for Common Counsel Foundation in Oakland, and was Executive Director of several nonprofit organizations, including Habitat for Humanity, where she also served as Western Regional Director. She also served as Director of Education and Training at National Community Development Institute (NCDI). She holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Human Services from Southern NH University and Master of Divinity from Pacific School of Religion. Between them, she and her life partner have six daughters and seven grandchildren. Patricia is of Six Nations (Mohawk) and Quebecois descent.
how_to_find_us: Come to the backyard. :)
name: Visit & Build with Nafsi Ya Jamii Urban Retreat Center

description:
Back by popular demand, this 90-minute walk offers a wide array of scenic pleasures-- restored wetlands; sweeping views of SF Bay islands, bridges and The City; local pocket parks; and historical waypoints embedded in the Rosie the Riveter National Park.

This stroll is tailor-made for those who like to sleep in on weekends and still would enjoy a refreshing walk without it taking up too much of the day. It's the exact same outing I led latest on Sept. 6, 2014.

Bring comfortable shoes, any sun protection you need, and drinking water. We could have foggy, windy weather so it might be good to stash a light layer or two in your car, just in case.

The distance is about 3 miles and, since we're at sea level the whole way, no ups and downs. Still, please be aware of your fitness level and don't plan to attend unless you are confident you can manage the distance. A Sierra Club rating for this hike would be 1A, the easiest kind.

This is a shuttle walk. The purpose of a shuttle walk is to prevent having to walk back to our cars along the exact same path we came. It's useful in a situation where walking a loop isn't feasible. At the meeting point at Craneway we'll pile into as few cars as are needed to carry us all and we'll drive to the Pt. Isabel Regional Shoreline parking lot a few miles away. From there we will leave the cars and walk to the Craneway Pavilion (a.k.a. Ford Assembly Plant) along the paved shoreline path. Then we'll huddle at Botto Bistro after the walk (optional but encouraged, see below). Lastly, we'll need to shuttle folks back to Pt. Isabel to get their cars. It's simpler than it sounds, and the drive time from Craneway to Pt. Isabel is only 5-10 minutes. To do the shuttle will of course require some volunteers to shuttle folks a short distance in their cars. If we don't have enough volunteer drivers we'll simply drop the shuttle idea and walk half as far as we had planned, then retrace our steps to the Craneway parking lot.

DIRECTIONS: We'll meet at the Craneway Pavilion's free west parking lot (i.e. NOT the one you have to enter via a security guard checkpoint). From Hwy. 580 westbound take the Harbour Way South exit. Stay right after exiting, then at the stoplight turn right onto Cutting Blvd. Go a half block then turn right at the first stoplight onto Harbour Way. Go straight for 1.0 miles until the street dead ends at the Craneway Pavilion parking lot west of the building.

(In the marsh section of our walk keep an eye out for the California clapper rail, an endangered species.)

Common-sense dog rules should suffice, but look out for signs along the trail: Dogs should be well behaved and under voice control at all times. Dog walkers are required to clean up after their dogs and remove dog waste bags from the trails. And I'd strongly prefer that any pit bulls be on a leash.

Optional but encouraged: We'll huddle afterward for chat and refreshments at Botto Bistro, a short drive from Craneway. Here's a map to the bistro from Craneway:

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Botto+Bistro/@37.920501,-122.347939,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x80857870f816fff7:0xb831af188135b327?hl=en


NO SHOWS and LATE CANCELS: They make planning difficult for the organizer, as well as for folks who are forced to spend time on a wait list that would have been a lot shorter, or non-existent, were it not for the no-shows. So I'll be keeping an eye on them (have been already, actually) and in the near future will announce a policy on no-shows for these hikes.

I have posted this event with the following two Meetup groups: Richmond Local, Bay Area 40+ Social Singles.

description:
Join us and develop your intuition for growth and empowerment! Some of the things developing this capacity has brought me are - confidence in my own inner guidance, greater trust in life (especially when it comes to curve balls!), certainty in following my heart, and making decisions with much greater ease.

In this intro session, we'll talk about how intuition works, what gets in the way, ways it can serve us. And then we will jump into various ways to access it using our 4 different psychic channels (clairvoyance, clairaudience, claircognizance and clairsentience.) I believe everyone already has these capacities -it's just a matter of recognizing it and learning how to use it effectively. We each have some inherent preferences, which is why I cover all of them, in all classes.

I wish I could tell you we can develop the capacity to hear /see/ feel clearly in a day! Perhaps some of us can and do -- but most of us need practice! This is the reason for ongoing classes (every two weeks.) So come and see if this class feels right for you.

A little more about the ongoing classes:

They are completely experiential and will give you a broad range of tools to experiment with. You will have lots of time to practice both accessing your intuition and discovering what might be in the way of you hearing your inner voice more clearly.

Generally, each meetup is 2 hours:

• We start with a meditation to arrive, ground, center and get quiet.

• We do introductions and check in as to how things are going

• After meditation and intros, we spend the rest of the first time reviewing and playing with various tools, using real life questions, and gaining more ease in hearing our own wisdom.

• Although there can be painful moments of hearing something we would rather not have heard, mostly these tools are very validating.

• We have fun! Look forward to meeting some new people. Please feel free to contact me directly with questions.
name: Intro Session: Develop your intuition for growth and self-empowerment
