description:
Free LGBTQ Zen workshop and group meditation on the lake

The weather has been beautiful lately and I was thinking this is a perfect time to do a zen workshop and group meditation on the lake. Im going to be doing a workshop on enhancing relationships with friends family and lovers as well as a guided group meditation for empowering your mind body and spirit. This workshop is specially oriented towards spirituality and being Lgbtq. The workshop is a free event but I do ask for a optional 5 to 10 dollars donation to help out victims in Nepal since this is a cause that is very dear to my heart no one will be turned away for lack of funds. As a special incentive poly carbon games will be sponsoring free board and zen games during workshop breaks.

Things to bring:

Please bring a towel or yoga mat to sit on since we will be on a grassy area as well as drinks and snacks of your choice since we will be socializing afterward.

Location:

We will be on the lake on Lake merit blvd across the street from the henry j Kaiser convention center in the grassy area

Directions from bart:

Go down oak street from the bart station and make a right on 12 st towards the lake and across from the henry j Kaiser convention center building.
how_to_find_us: Follow directions below
name: Zen workshop and group meditation on the lake

description:
WE HAVE ADDED A SECOND VERY CREATIVE FASHION AND GLAMOUR PORTRAIT PHOTO SHOOT WITH AMAZING ASIAN MODEL MINH-LY AND HER MAKE UP ARTIST ON SATURDAY, MAY 30 AT 1:30 PM.

We will work with studio owner Selit as well as Minh-Ly and her make up artist to produce several really unique backgrounds for you to use in your images.

Date: Saturday, May 30

Time: 1:30 pm to 4:30 pm

Location: Photo Studio in South San Francisco

Photo Shoot Organization: Prior to the start of the shoot, studio owner Selit will work with the model and her make up artist to create a really unique background for us to shoot in. There will also be an orientation in which we will cover the camera settings you will need to use to photograph the model using studio strobes.

Each attending photographer will have some exclusive shooting time with the model. You will be able to direct the model but will not be able to change the background.

There will be 3 different backgrounds for you to shoot in.

Minh's make up artist will create some dramatic makeup effects for her.

Price: $98.00 including a commercial model release at no additional cost.

Please Note: The images on this Meetup page are copyrighted by the photographers who took them. Do not download or use without permission.

Don't miss this outstanding portrait photo shoot.

Edward Woods

Organizer
name: SECOND CREATIVE FASHION & GLAMOUR PORTRAIT PHOTO SHOOT WITH AMAZING MODEL MINH

description:
THIS CLASS IS NOW FULL.

Pachakuti Mesa Despacho Class
An introduction to the ceremony & creation of Peruvian despachos:

Peruvian shamanism is based in ancient earth honoring wisdom. In the Andes it is recognized that all life first starts in the spirit realm and then manifests into our physical world. In order to give “ayni” or payment of gratitude back to the spirit realm for gifts we have received, “despachos” or “haywas” are made. This is the ceremony to give back to Spirit in gratitude through the Pachakuti Mesa Tradition.

Date: Saturday May 30, 2015
1:00 – 5:00 PM

Cost: $30 - $80, sliding scale

Location: Is in Santa Rosa. It will be given out to those who are registered for this class.

RSVP directly to Judy to reserve your space (limited to 12 participants) at [masked]. Do not merely RSVP to this Meetup site, or you will not be counted in.


Judy is a senior teacher of the Pachakuti Mesa Tradition: Shamanic Arts for Personal and Planetary Transformation. For more on the Pachakuti Mesa see www.heartofthehealer.org and www.ShamanicAlchemy.net
name: Pachakuti Mesa Despacho Class

venue.name: Jingletown Jazz Room at Ale Industries

description:
The King is coming...

We'll be tapping a 5 gallon pin of This is the Shit that Killed Elvis at our Jingletown Jazz Room at Ale Industries on Saturday, May 30th at 1pm! Our cellarman Dylan is hunting down the perfect combination of ingredients and spices to take this already glamorous beer to the next level.

We'll have our "First Pitch" pre-game jam from Addison Street Jazz from 4-6pm, followed by Shoulderblades (featuring our stellar bartender Annelyse Gelman on vocals and guitar!)

Our very own Beertriot Chef Chris of Licensed 2 Grill will be on site with his jammin truck from 5:30 - 9:30pm serving up Elvis-inspired Peanut Butter, Bacon and Banana sandwiches, along with their their usual menu of deliciousness!

Official description
This is the Shit that ...Killed Elvis (10%ABV):

"Excess and Glam is what this beer is all about, and its loud enough to take down the King. 100% of the base malt is Gambrinus Vienna, with honey malt specialty grains. The combination gives an amazing red color, bursting with fruit and berry notes. This beer is so big, we ran an extended secondary ferment which allowed it to mellow and mature. This beer will make you want to dance, and when you do, remember how it’s done:

'Some people tap their feet, some people snap their fingers, and some people sway back and forth. I just sorta do ‘em all together I guess.' Elvis, 1956"

Be there, or be NO where! It's your beertriotic duty!!!

Cheers!

California Beer Society
name: The Shit that Killed Elvis!!!

description:
I am not earning enough to cover meetup.com's organizer dues, so this weekend (Sunday at Strawberry Canyon) will be the LAST FORAGING CLASS EVER I will teach through this website.

If I continue to teach classes, I will announce them on my personal website; AncestralArts.net.

Thanks to everyone who have come to meetups so far to help support the group!

This group will be deleted when I do not pay the dues next month.

LOCATION: Elder picnic area, which is off South Park Dr. (It's next to Laurel, Willow, & Possum picnic areas.) There is no sign for "Elder" off the main road, but if you're going uphill, its the right after the Padre picnic area, and if you're going downhill, it's in the same parking lot of the Willow picnic area.

MAP: http://www.ebparks.org/Assets/_Nav_Categories/Parks/Maps/Tilden+map+south.pdf

$20 cash per person.

We will meet Sunday at 1 PM for about 2.5 hours. You will learn every edible and useful plant in the area found along trails.

You will learn how to ID and use over 50 different species of wild, native or introduced plants, such as edible greens, seasonal nuts and fruits, edible roots, medicinal herbs, plants for cordage and soap, etc.

Depending on our luck we will also find some insects, other animals, and fungi for which you will learn traditional uses.

Much of the information you will learn is not found in any field guides or edible wild plants books. Almost everything I teach is based on my graduate research at UC Berkeley of historical California Indians; first-hand accounts of their cultures that are mostly not available to the general public.

The main focus is edible species, but you'll also learn about medicinal and technological uses.

You are welcomed to point out any plant, animal, or fungus to learn to identify it and its uses.

I suggest bringing a notebook, pencil, and camera to record species info.

NOTE: This is a "hands-off" park, so I will be simply showing you plants and talking about them; no actual foraging will occur. I do not endorse the removal or disturbance of any plant, fungal, or animal life from public lands.
name: 2nd to LAST FORAGING CLASS EVER

description:
Join us for a fun afternoon of calligraphy at one of our favorite places. Learn to mix gouache like a pro. Add flourishes and doodles to finished pieces. We'll quickly go over basics as a refresher and then spend time playing with color and drawing with your pen. It's preferred that you've tried calligraphy before but no need to be skilled!

Kits available for purchase include:


(1) Nikko g nib (1) speedball oblique pen holder (1) Higgins calligraphy black ink (1) Borden and Riley bleed proof paper

Color ink sold separately so that you can choose your favorite!
how_to_find_us: Arch Pop-up has only street parking and parking is definitely gold here, so we suggest to come about 15-20 minutes early to find parking and have enough time to settle in.
name: Doodles and Color!

description:
Join us for a fun bike ride! Together, we will explore one of the best bike/walking paths Contra Costa has to offer & meet some new biking buddies as we explore & have some great fun. It's a great way to see & enjoy the gorgeous Iron Horse Trail & Heather Farms on a fun Saturday afternoon. Have a great time socializing while meeting new friends & enjoy lots of fun & laughter. Members in the group are always nice & friendly. We always have a lot of fun whenever we all get together with a couple of other meetup groups also invited (Bay Area Cycling, Bay Area Adventure..., SF Random Adventurers, etc. So join in on the fun! We look forward to seeing you there!

• LEVEL: Beginning to Intermediate (Advanced welcome but might be a little slower group.) We will go at a moderate pace & regroup a few times on the way to Heather Farms.

We will meet for coffee & a meet & greet. Please be no later than 1:15 pm for brief intros & announcements. Then, we head off to Heather Farms/Walnut Creek. At approximately 2:30 pm, we will have a late lunch in the park. Please bring your lunch or buy something at Peet's to take with you. After, we ride back to Concord or feel free to head to Walnut Creek Bart from this point.


***************************************************

• GROUP DUES & ORGANIZER FEE: $2 -- you may pay in person at the meetup location. Thank you!

• IMPORTANT -- Space is limited. Please text me to confirm your spot. Thank you!

Contact: Cela -[masked]


----------------------------------------------------------


• HOW TO FIND US: Meet outside the cafe by the bikes.

• IMPORTANT NOTE: Before meeting up, be sure to grab a healthy snack & a bottle of water in case of dehydration & low blood sugar due to exercising several hours. (Lunch won't be til approx 2:30 pm).


• AFTER BIKE RIDE: If 3 or more members are interested in going for drinks after -- we can decide to go to a local place nearby.

(PLEASE NO UNNAMED GUESTS - Participants please sign up & read the description to know what to expect for the event.)


-----------------------------------------------------------------

description:
Sold out.

-------------------------------------------------------------------

In Partnership with the Oceanic Society

Affectionately known as San Francisco’s "Galapagos Islands" the Farallon Islands serve as one of the most biologically rich and important habitats along the western coast of the United States. Come do what 99% of San Francisco residents never do… hop aboard a boat and ride out under the Golden Gate Bridge to visit one of the richest marine ecosystems in the world. The Farallon Islands, just 27 miles off the coast of San Francisco, lie amid the Gulf of the Farallones National Marine Sanctuary, a food-rich marine ecosystem that attracts whales, dolphins, seals and seabirds each summer and fall, to feed and to breed. Researchers have catalogued hundreds of individual humpbacks and blue whales as seasonal feeding residents. Twenty three species of marine mammals, including eighteen species of whales and dolphins, can be found here. The Farallon Islands National Wildlife Refuge is the largest seabird rookery in the contiguous United States with nesting Tufted Puffins, Pigeon Guillemots, Rhinoceros Auklets, Common Murres and other species. Migratory seabirds such as Shearwaters, Jaegers, and Phalaropes are also attracted by these nutrient-rich waters. Island beaches are covered with sea lions, including massive Steller's sea lions, now on the Endangered Species List.

We will start out on Saturday with a presentation about the National Marine Sanctuary and then follow it up with a photography how to presentation giving you an introduction to your DSLR. You will learn some useful tips that will allow you to keep your head up with your eyes on the horizon and in search of whales.
name: Whales, Birds & Life of the Farallon Islands

description:
We're back at the Bunny Meadow! Spend a spring afternoon enjoying good food and making friends. This is a monthly potluck picnic dedicated to language and culture exchange. Everyone's welcome, so bring all your friends!

If everyone brings a little something, we'll have a great potluck! Last name beginning with:

A-G (Bring a salad/side dish)

H-T (Bring an entree/main dish)

U-Z (Bring dessert)

Can't bring food? You can still help with essentials such as plates, utensils, etc. Just put your name next to what you can bring on this spreadsheet: https://goo.gl/OlTxKj


Lastly, this is STRICTLY VOLUNTARY, but if you like this picnic and want to help keep it going, please donate something at either:

PayPal: https://goo.gl/8kjxu0


P2P transfer: [masked]

We teach the tips and techniques to unlocking the aesthetics of male physiques. No Shoes during the workout. Water is provided. Towels are provided. Lots of laughs and inspiration. Come Join!

description:
Sorry for the delay, guys. Been a super busy month, plus I got sick as a dog last weekend. This month's hike is unusual in that we are limited in the number of people a group can have hiking through Muir woods. That limit is 20 people. After that, there will be a waiting list. So only RSVP if you think you really are going to show up, please.

We will meet at the small parking lot here:

https://www.google.com/maps/@37.9081859,-122.5759341,76m/data=!3m1!1e3


DON'T USE THE MEETUP MAP. USE THE LINK ABOVE.

This is a small parking lot, but there is a large one further west on the Panorama Highway. There is also parking along the side of the road on Panorama.

Once we are ready, we will walk to the trail head with is a short distance from the parking lot. We'll take the Panorama Trail to the Ocean View Trail to the Lost Trail to the Fern Creek Trail, taking our break at the Alice Eastwood group campsite. Then after break, we'll go back the Fern Creek Trail, past the Lost Trail, taking Fern Creek all the way back to the Main Muir Woods Trail. We'll take that back toward the entrance and then take the Ocean View Trail back up the Panorama Trail to the trailhead at the Panorama Hwy. The whole loop is approximately 5 miles. There aren't too many steep places going up, though the steps down on the Lost trail are a bit steep.

We will cancel for rain the morning of if necessary.

We'll likely take the full time allotted, but we may get back by 4 p.m., depending on the hike goes. If it is imperative that you be back at your car before 4:30, please plan to depart from the group early or consider another hike.

Look forward to seeing you guys there!

**PLEASE NOTE*** We/I have no idea if cells or GPS will work here, so please take the time to get directions (both what I wrote above and using "get directions" from google) and milage markers BEFORE you leave so that you can meet us at the designated place and time. Using google maps or GPS while on route results in some wonky, incorrect directions due to the sketchy reception for such devices in these remote areas. So again, it is best to get directions BEFORE you leave, at a place that has good internet access (such as a computer). We'll wait 10 to 15 minutes for everyone and then will begin the hike. Let me know if you have any questions.

See you then!
how_to_find_us: Group of guys in the parking lot
name: Muir Woods Hiking Meditation

Lets meet at Castro MUNI and walk to the Yerba Buena Gardens near Third Street where they have free music, Zydeco and Soul, until 3 pm: http://sf.funcheap.com/andr-thierry-chelle-friends-soulrb-concert-sf/

Concert ends at 3 pm and we can then hike to North Beach for a Happy Hour and food.

Safety Disclaimer: The organizers of this meet-up are unpaid volunteers and not expert hiking guides. All participants agree to assume 100% responsibility for their own safety, conduct, and well-being and recognize that possible hazards exist while participating in outdoor (or any other) activities, and agree to participate solely at their own risk. If you RSVP “Yes” and/or attend any of our events, it shall be conclusively presumed that you understand and agree to this policy.

venue.name: Yerba Buena Gardens

description:
André Thierry + Chelle! & Friends* will be playing a free concert in Yerba Buena Gardens. You can stretch out on the grass to sketch musicians and concert-goers or wander over to sketch the dramatic expansion of SFMOMA across the street.


12:30 Meet by the fountain, at the eastern edge of the Gardens on 3rd Street, to look at the construction site. If you don't see us, phone/text Laurie at (415) 5323-9983.

1:00 Music starts. You can sit down to listen or wander over to Natoma Street to sketch the back side of the museum.

3:15 Meet back at the fountain to share sketches and chat after the concert ends. If you need coffee, there are 5 (count 'em, five) Starbucks' plus 5 - 6 other establishments selling caffeinated beverages within a one-block radius.

LINKS

See photos of the construction on flickr or watch this time-lapse cam of the site.

GETTING THERE

Transit: The Powell Street BART / MUNI station is two short blocks away. The #14 runs along Mission, and the 8, 30, 45, and 91 buses run up 3rd Street (and down 4th Street). Half the buses in the city run along Market Street near here. From the Caltrain station, catch the T-Third or the 30, 45 or 91.

Car: Parking in the city-run Fifth and Mission garage is $3.50 an hour, but it's convenient and easy. If you're planning on driving from some other part of the bay and want to find passengers to share the cost, post a request in the Discussion section at the bottom of this page. Members can email you through the Meetup site.

Bicycle: Market and Howard Streets have good bicycle lanes.

BRING

A folding chair or mat if you're not comfortable sitting on the grass. Plus hat, sunscreen, layered clothing.


* Heres what the YBGF site says about the musicians: "Richmond-raised accordion virtuoso André Thierry lays down dance-inducing zydeco laced with soul and R&B. And New Orleans native Michelle Jacques, a soul-steeped vocalist, leads the talent-packed Bay Area band Chelle! and Friends. Join the party and laissez les bon temps rouler!"
how_to_find_us: Meet by the fountain at the eastern edge of the Gardens on 3rd St., near the construction site. If you don't see us, phone\/text Laurie at (415) 5323-9983.
name: The Changing City: SFMOMA expansion & Zydeco concert

description:
Bring joy, expression, and creativity to each other and inspire our world to have this in THEIR lives as well!

How?

Who and How we are being in the world Matters.

The more a society and culture has people openly and freely expressing their joy, passion, movement, and sharing, the more joy, passion, movement and sharing is possible for more people!...because they are INSPIRED, because we live BY EXAMPLE!

This Picnic, Play, and Dance in the park is an opportunity not just to have an awesome time, it is also an opportunity to bring more of this to our world.

Sooooo!

Join us at Lake Merritt for food, community, music and, of course, DANCING! Bring your friends (furry and not furry), some food, a blanket, hula hoops, jump ropes, your dancing feet, and a pocket full smiles.

I'll bring a grill, a few nibbles, blanket, and music. We'll sit, eat, play and then,

around 1:30 or 2p.m. we'll dance and move!

We'll start off by presencing that in our very being outside and moving, dancing, playing, our moving, we are creating a world where by giving ourselves permission to be open and dance, we give others permission, we inspire others to be open and dance as well!

We'll play with feeling our feet on the ground, dynamics of moving (speed, levels), we'll play with balance by ourselves, with a partner (yes, you'll be holding hands with someone and spinning in circles, etc!)

But, most importantly, let's just have fun!

Hope to see you there!

Go to www.DanceYourLife.net and join the newsletter for a free class and updates on more fun events!

http://www.danceyourlife.net

Sincerely,

Shawnrey
how_to_find_us: Please RSVP to receive the location of where we're going to be!
name: Picnic, Barbecue, & Dance in the park!

group.name: Dance your Life: Passion, Creativity, Expression

description:
So here's the idea:

We bring a ton of food and accoutrements, and games,

along w/ firewood, the liquid refreshments you fancy, for a day of fun and socializing on the beach.

We'll hit the beach - Limantour on Pt Reyes (Marin County) for fun and gamess so plan on a full day of sea, sand, salt, smiles, games, possibly a hike, and lots of fun.

Anyone have a volleyball setup? How about bocce? Bring Frisbees, footballs, anything we can play on the beach.

This will be a fun day of playing, romping, <a>gaming</a>, socialising, and growing closer as a grp. We'll have a HUGE POTLUCK LUNCH when we get there, followed by activities/games, followed by a POTLUCK DINNER and a bonfire.

Agenda will be totally open - play Frisbee, play bocce, play volleyball, play football, go take a walk, go take a swim. We'll probably have an organised game or two, and possibly an organised hike, we'll see.

As always, the goal is to build relationships while having fun.

What To Bring:

Vino and cups

Layered clothing including long pants and a jacket for later as the sun sets and the campfire rises.

Sunscreen and hat

Beach chairs and spreads (to put food on)

Food, Food, Food! And coolers w/ ice. Enough for lunch and dinner. Both meals are potluck.

Drinks - vino, port, beer, <a>bottled water</a>, iced tea, juice, anything you like.

Firewood, kindling, and newspaper

Marshmallows and graham crackers :-)

Games, toys (frisbee, bocce, football, etc)

$5 activity fee

Of course your sense of humour is always required!

Directions:

GPS [masked],[masked]

From Sir Francis Drake Blvd go 20.4 mi

Turn right onto CA-1 N/​Sir Francis Drake Blvd go 0.1 mi

Take the 1st left onto Bear Valley Rd go 1.8 mi

Turn left onto Limantour Rd go 7.5 mi (You'll turn left 500 ft after crossing Limantour Dr. and BEFORE the lot at the end of the road on the right).

Sharp left go 0.4 mi to Limantour Beach Parking Lot at the end of the road The GPS marker (above) is for this parking lot.

PLEASE NOTE:

If you get to the end of Limantour Rd at the parking lot on the right, you've gone too far. The LEFT TURN is 150 ft BEFORE the lot on the right.

See you there!

Be sure to bring your favourite chalice.
name: Beach Party: Potluck, Games, Craziness, and Bonfire!

description:
Another event happening in Walnut Creek. This time it's for wine & beer lovers, gourmet food lovers, music lovers, arts and craft lovers, swim lovers, sun lovers, and I guess any kind of lover! There will be a wide variety of the aforementioned items for you to choose from. Below is a link to the foods and entertainment schedule. I've checked my crystal ball and it says that the barometer, thermometer, and Farmers Almanac are indicating a dry, warm, and sunny day with music!

Anyone wanting to meetup on Saturday, 30th May at 12:pm can meet on the lawn to the left of the front door of the swim pool. Sleep late and have lunch at the festival.

If you are a biathloner you can access the bike trails, Iron Horse and Canal Trails, from many directions to gain access to Heather Farms. If you want to get a workout bring your swim suit and flip flops for a pre-meeting swim. WC said they had 100,000 visitors last year! There is car parking on N. San Carlos Drive and bicycle parking in front of the Clark swim pool This event is Bart accessible and the city is supplying FREE shuttle service from the Walnut Creek Bart station and also from the Shadelands Business Park. If you are biking it the Iron Horse and Canal Trails can lead you right to the the festival. There is bike parking in front of the Clark swimming pool, just bring a lock.

Music Listing:
http://www.artwinefestivalwc.com/
Festival Wines & Beers:
http://www.artwinefestivalwc.com/
Festival Food:
http://www.artwinefestivalwc.com/
Free Shuttle:
http://www.artwinefestivalwc.com/
Map to Location:
http://www.chamberorganizer.com/members/googlemaps/google_maps_ind.php?orgcode=WCCC&mid=348455423

Hasta pronto!

JC
name: Walnut Creek's 34th Annual Art & Wine Festival, 30-31, May 15

description:
Have a product idea for a Kickstarter or IndieGoGo campaign or perhaps an IoT Internet of Things Device that you would like to prototype? Have a new product line idea you want to design out and prototype for your small business or startup? Or perhaps you are just curious about 3d printing and would like to meet with like minded inventors/tinkerers?

Come visit Berkeley's newest 3D Print / 3D Scan / 3D Design service shop and benefit from our services and resources to get your idea designed, scanned and prototyped! We offer professional CAD modeling, 3D scanning, FDM, Objet and ZPrinting. We also have relationships to statewide metalworkers, potters, machinists and manufacturers for vetted ideas already prototyped and market tested for which you are just looking to line up the supply chain! We also know contract manufacturers in China but no need to go that route!


Stop by at Noon or come early and grab a Chai or Golden Latte at Berkeley's only 5 Star Yelp rated Coffee Shop - Rasa Caffe - one of the reasons we stay so productive at SyncFab. Be a part of the Bay Area Maker Movement! We hope to see you Saturday!

Contact on Site: Edgar and Brett

Duties: We need a volunteers to accompany each of the following 3 groups: walkers, slower runners, and fast runners.

Your help is appreciated! Let’s get them moving.

description:
Hey guys, who's down to play some capture the flag round 2!? Overview of how to play:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ll0lAy9YX8g

Last time we played everyone got tired really quick. Going to try to have substitute players this time or more than 2 teams so people can rest.

We will most likely be playing on grass, you can gear up accordingly. Also I'm not sure if the field we'll be playing has a lot of trees but it should be fine if we play on open field also.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

LetsHang Disclaimer: Changing your RSVP within 24 hours of the event will warrant a strike. Users with two strikes will be removed from the group. This is to ensure fairness and quality of events.

Not an event organizer yet? Check out this page.

Have feedback for our meetup group? Find our top secret feedback form here!
name: Capture the Flag!!!

description:
Hi all,
Here's one of our favorite hikes [especially the awesome lunch/nap spot] :)

This is about a 7+ mile easy to moderate hike around 3 beautiful lakes [lagunitas, bon tempe and alphine] with lunch at a spot with great views.

Hike Highlights: lakes, views, nap, fun people, possibly turtles...and of course the snacks and chocolates ;)

We may go to Pancho Villas [Mexican] at fairfax after the hike :)


Meet at the Alpine/Bon Tempe lake parking at 11:30AM.

Directions:
- From San Francisco, cross the golden gate bridge and keep on 101 North.
- Near San Rafael, you'll see exits to 'Richmond bridge' and 'San Anselmo'.
- Take the San Anselmo exit which curves left and takes u to Sir Francis Drake blvd.
- Drive about 5 miles west on Sir Francis Drake to Fairfax. - You will go over a small hill and as you head down look for a street to the left [the sign may be hidden, but it is Pacheco Street]
- Make a left there on Pacheco.
- At the stop sign, make a right onto Broadway.
- At the next stop sign make a left onto Bolinas Rd.
- Go up Bolinas road approximately 1.5 miles (you will pass the Deer Park Villa restaurant).
- At 700 Bolinas Road there is a wooden sign on your left saying “Lake Lagunitas”.
- Make that left turn onto Sky Oaks Road; go up approximately 1/4 mile and Sky Oaks Watershed Headquarters is on the left at the crest of the hill.
- You are also at the entrance to Lagunitas and Bon Tempe Lakes. (If you miss the Sky Oaks Road turn-off and you get to the Meadow Club golf course you have gone too far).
- A $7.00 [or may be $8.00] Vehicle Entrance Fee is required daily.
- Once past the entrance kiosk, drive about 0.4 mile, and turn right (to Bon Tempe) at a signed junction onto a gravel road.
- Drive about 0.3 mile, then bear left (unsigned) to the trailhead (if you get to a second parking lot at the end of the road you've gone too far).

Approximate GPS coordinates for the parking lot: N[masked] W[masked]
GOOGLE MAP


From east bay, take 580 bridge and take 'Sir Francis Drake blvd' exit and follow the above directions.

Bring enough water and some food for lunch and something to share if u like. Tastier snacks gets you more friends ;)

We may take a long lunch/nap break if the sun is out and is warm since its a great lunch spot. So if you have to get back early, please bring a map with you so you can find your way back :)

TRAIL MAP

one IMPORTANT note: Please wait for others at intersections if you are not sure which trail to take as some intersections may be tricky, especially the lunch spot turn off.

It says dogs are allowed only if they are leashed :)

See u there :)

Disclaimer: Its your own responsibility to look after yourself on the hike if u decide to join us. You assume all the risks..including sharing my lunch ;)
name: Hike at Mt. Tam [Bon Tempe Lake]

description:
Come join a laid back group of soccer players for some fun pick-up soccer.

While not a requirement, it's always a good idea to wear shin guards to prevent injury.

Cleats however are a must and are required for anyone looking to play. We can't have players slipping and sliding across the field as it leads to needless injury.


We generally play dark shirts vs whites, so preferably bring both to help balance teams.

Remember, this is just for fun. Play hard, but err on the side of safety and don't get on anyones' case. This is generally not an issue but I will not hesitate to ban anyone who does not play in the spirit of FUN Soccer Saturdays.
name: 11:30 AM Coed Pick-up Soccer game

description:
Let's Kick ASS Stronger is about promoting FUN and FUNction with a low impact fitness and mobility aimed for individuals of all performance levels, whether you have neuropathy, arthritis or are just itching to move around and feel better in your body!—Raad Shabib is our amazing instructor is trained in issues of those aging with HIV.

This is a user led group now that Raad is away at his internship.

Let’s Kick ASS Stronger: a gentle, group movement class for long-term survivors.

I am doing some test runs to find the flatest paths, the path of least resistance, so those of us who ride for scenery rather than speed will be happy! I will make a lunch reservation for the week before, so RSVP early enough so we have enough room at the table. There is a parking lot if you are throwing your bike in the car like me. It is at the breakers/beach, so it will likely be cold!

description:
We're back with another hike! So soon, I know, but the weather's been just right for it. Let's head out to Dublin Hills Regional Park this time and enjoy a moderate 4.1-mile hike at one of the East Bay's newest regional parks.

The hike is a mix of out-and-back and loop trails with some moderately steep sections. We will meet at the Donlon Point Staging Area. Check out this website for a preview of what's in store for us. Yes, the trailhead is next to soul-crushing suburban sprawl, but the views are good just a short distance in.

Total hike time will be +/- 2 hours. Be sure to pack water and sun protection. Hiking boots are recommended. Dogs are welcome but must be leashed in the parking lot, and they should be well behaved around cows.

Please feel free to arrange carpools using this Google Sheets file, not the comments section below. Thanks!

Important: Be sure to use directions to Dublin Blvd & Marshall Canyon Dr. Google Maps will route you through town if you ask for directions using the park or trailhead name.
how_to_find_us: Contact info will be posted prior to the event.
name: Dublin Hills Regional Park Hike

When you ask a Indian how much they like dosa? They will spare a huge smile with a sparkle in their eyes. Dosa is crispy crepe made from fermented rice-lentil batter. It is gluten free. In this cooking class, you will learn to make beautiful homemade dosa along with potato filling, sambhar and chutney. I will also teach you to whip up two more new dishes with the same batter - Paniyaram and Uthappam. We will begin the class with a brief introduction to my pantry. You will touch, smell and taste the spices.

Details here: https://eatfeastly.com/meals/d/19250328/?rf=fwebprofacti
name: Dosa Party - Indian Cooking Class

description:
Now open for RSVPs. The only cost is $3 cash per adult. The opening of the new "Hidden Garden Steps" improves this walk by giving us 2 Mosaic Stairways instead of one! This is one of our most popular walks and it is our most inspirational walk.

We meet in front of a Starbucks, that has 2 restrooms, about 1 block West of the West Portal Muni Station, cross street is Vicente. Please buy something if you use their restroom. One can take the K, L, or M lines to reach the station. Remember to either bring a sack lunch or buy one at or near our starting point. At 11:10 AM or later we will walk.

We will walk through the wonderful Forest Hill neighborhood over many stairways including the giant Pacheco Grand Staircase. For years we ate our sack lunches inside the Botanical Garden in Golden Gate Park. On August 7th, 2010, the SF Board of Supervisors started charging $7 for non-residents to enter. So we are forced to eat our lunches in another part of the G. G. Park. I will work to end the fees in the coming months.

More about the new Botanical Garden fees in the links below:

http://www.meetup.com/Free-Parks-for-Everyone-Rollback-Park-Privatization/


http://www.meetup.com/walking-in-SF/pages/Mosaic_Stairway_Walk/


http://keeparboretumfree.org/

Then we walk South to and up the "Hidden Gardens Steps" and the "Mosaic Stairway," the only 2 in the City and both decorated by hundreds of neighbors. They are the most inspirational things I ever saw. An ordinary neighborhood got together and did something world spectacular! Maybe every community can working together do something so spectacular. Then up to the top of Grand View Park, elevation 666', to see incredible views. Then we walk South taking a different route back through Forest Hill to our starting point. Hopefully arriving at 4:00 PM.

For all questions about public transportation in the Bay Area click on below (trip planner) link:

http://transit.511.or...

I try to discourage people from driving to SF, but if you need to drive there is plenty of available free street parking in nearby St. Francis Wood neighborhood during the weekends.

Some legal disclaimers: By joining us for any event you hereby RELEASE and DISCHARGE it's organizers, hosts and participants from any and all liability, claims, demands or causes of action that you now have, or may have in the future, for injuries, damages, death and/or economic loss of any kind or nature, arising in whole or in part out of the activities, advice or information contained herein. You further agree that if you or someone under your supervision uses the information on this website you assume all risks of injury, damage, and economic loss, without limitation, and release providers from all liability therefore. It is advisable to consult a doctor before you begin any strenuous physical activity. The organizer is not trained for emergency medical procedures and no doctors, nurses or ambulances are provided on the walks.

Below is a view of the Mosaic Stairway.


Photo below of part of Botanical Garden near main entrance, where now our group cannot go thanks to the $7 fee.


Photo of our usual lunch break spot near the garden's main entrance, where now our group cannot go thanks to the $7 fee.


Another photo taken inside the Botanical Garden, where now our group cannot go thanks to the $7 fee.


Photos below were taken on this walk's route.


Photos below are of gardens we will see in Forest Hill.
how_to_find_us: I am tall, look like my photo, wear a big hat, and will be carrying a clipboard.
name: A Walk Around the 2 Mosaic Stairways (North of West Portal)

description:
If you missed the La Russa Faire this sounds as awesome! Learn pet care, behavior and training. Activities include Training Demos, Kp Unit Demos and Agility Demos. And then there is shopping! Carli scored a new dress at the last event!

Maddie’s Pet Adoption is the largest free pet adoption event. Its purpose is to find homeless dogs and cats forever homes while increasing awareness of shelter animals and the efforts of shelter/rescue organizations.

This event will showcase a variety of vendors from many rescue organizations and animal services, K-9 demonstrations, information regarding pet related services & resources and family fun. Last year over 50 pets were adopted. Great raffle prizes will be available with proceeds benefiting the Concord Senior Center and CCHS.

Event is free to attend and family-friendly.

The time of the event is 10 to 4. I plan to be there at 11:00. We can meet up or you can go on your own if you have to go at a later time.

Lazy Dog afterwards? We weren't able to eat at the restaurant last time due to the lights being out. So I'm going to try again. Anyone want to join me??

description:
Free Dragon Boat Lessons - Every Saturday at 10:30am. Rain or Shine We provide life jackets, experienced coaches, excellent steerspeople, and flat water. In 15 yrs, we have not had a single flipping.

How long will it be? We usually end around noon.

What to Wear - Comfortable clothing that you do not mind getting wet. This is in case you splash yourself.

Things we recommend you to bring:

1) Sunscreen as UV is higher on the water

2) Water to keep yourself hydrated

3) A Towel - to dry off after in case you splash yourself while on the boat

I've attached a map of the boat dock area. Please come join us at the picnic tables in the rear of the boat dock! We'll have a Meet-up Sign out so you can come find us! There are lots of attendees that are not on this meetup. Do not worry about a low turnout. See you there.

If you are interested in carpooling, please use the comments below to organize. We are within an easy bike ride of Hillsdale Caltrain station. A group of 30 regularly comes up from San Jose via transit.

New 2014 Waiver

description:
This Saturday morning, watch the morning light sparkling on the bay as we explore the peaceful marshlands of San Leandro! Hear the birds sing and the breezes blow as we enjoy a lovely trail that's surrounded by trees, tall grasses, and the water of the San Francisco bay...

(Photo by Anna Lynn/Liday)

Hear the waves! Smell the salty air! See an exotic sculpture titled "Rising Wave"! Share a bright summer morning with your fellow adventure walkers, gabbing excitedly on a new walking trail that's mostly paved, but with a special twist at the end. There's a turn onto a wide dirt road that leads through wild grasses to the top of a high hill. See a breath-taking panorama with interesting views down in every direction. (The trees of San Leandro! The Oakland Hills...)

There's wildlife everywhere in this close-to-home habitat, and a landscape that's occasionally surreal. (Lizards! Rabbits...!) Birds soar over its vast sunny fields, and there's even a quiet cove shimmering near the end of the trail. Dogs are okay -- even off-leash -- and there's a nice park (with a public restroom). We'll walk up a couple hills, but I'm really excited about this trail, which probably comes out to around four miles, so we'll be finished in an hour.

Which will bring us to lunchtime, and a chance to share a wonderful new Bay Area dining experience! Just down the road are two fine restaurants -- Horatio's and El Torito. Horatio's promises "the romance and brilliance of the Royal Navy of some 200 years ago," with hand-crafted beams and authentic nautical trinkets (along with a classy menu that offers wild mushroom ravioli or steak and crab sliders...) Closer to the bay is San Leandro's own El Torito, which has some fantastic views of the bay and a menu which claims they were among the first to popularize the Margarita within the United States).

I've scoped out this trail, and it's one I've been waiting for just the right weekend weather. So I hope you'll come and share our special Saturday morning adventure. Just remember:

Exercise! Socialize! Scenery! Sun!

Walking's more fun when there's more than one!

Hope to see you on our Saturday morning trail...
how_to_find_us: Meet by the entrance gate at the end of Neptune Court!
name: Let's Walk the Oyster Bay Shoreline!

description:
This is our weekly team meeting for the 2015 iGEM synthetic biology competition. Last year, we won a Gold Medal and the prize for Best Community Labs Project with our Real Vegan Cheese project.

iGEM is the International Genetically Engineered Machine competition, which is in its 11th year. iGEM runs the premiere student competition in Synthetic Biology. Teams are given a kit of biological parts and work to build biological systems and operate them in living cells.

You can request to join the mailing list here: https://groups.google.com/group/bay-area-2015-igem-team


This project is a collaboration between Counter Culture Labs (Oakland), BioCurious (Sunnyvale), and Berkeley Bio Labs (Berkeley). Open to all ages, high school and up.

To join us remotely, please click this URL to start or join:


https://zoom.us/j/820128495


Or, go to https://zoom.us/join and enter meeting ID:[masked]

Join from dial-in phone line, dial:<a> +1 (415)[masked]</a> or<a> +1 (646)[masked]</a>


Meeting ID:[masked]
name: iGEM 2015 Bay Area Biohackers team meeting

description: Join the Alameda DragonFlyers Novice Racing Crew and meet up with hundreds of other paddlers at a dragon boat race in Foster City on June 14. Three to seven practices (5/21, 5/23, 5/28, 5/30, 6/4, 6/6 and 6/11) will prepare you and 19 other members for this Novice race. Your crew will be coached, steered and cheered on by members of the Alameda Dragon Flyers, based at the Bridgeside Shopping Center in Alameda. Practices are free. description:
We will visit the world’s largest rescue, rehabilitation, release and research facility for seals and sea lions at Marine Mammal Center for a 45-minute docent-led tour and then hike up to Townsley Bunker to see the great view and have our lunch.

We will meet at 10:30 to take the 11:00 docent. After your arrival, please check in with the counter and get your tour badge. Docents will guide us around the Center's exhibits and viewing areas. Tour guides also provide insights into the work of the Center and share stories about seal and sea lion patients. (The number of animals onsite and visible varies daily depending on the animal's conditions).


After the tour, we will have 30 minutes free time to walk around, shop at the souvenir store, or talk to ranger and learn more about the facility. We will regroup at 12:15 or so to hike up to the Townsley Bunker, the WWII cannon turret, to see the fantastic view and have a short lunch break. After lunch, we will continue our walk to the Rodeo Beach and then return back to the parking lot. We have option to walk a bit more at Marin Headlands or stop by a place in Sausalito or city for some food or drink.

ADMISSION FOR DOCENT-LED TOUR: $9 or enter the promo code WDEB to save $2. (Your contribution to the center is highly appreciated.)

ORDER TICKET ONLINE: http://tmmc.doubleknot.com/event/calendar/3026. Please select May 30th 11:00 AM

HIKING ROUTE: http://goo.gl/jgMC2P

LENGTH: 3 miles

ELEVATION GAIN: 500 feet

WHAT TO BRING: Layered clothing, hat, windbreaker, lunch, water, and camera.

CARPOOL LINK: http://www.groupcarpool.com/t/7nkwbo

HOW TO TAKE THE SCENIC ROUTE TO THE CENTER: Just after you cross the Golden Gate Bridge, take the second exit off Highway 101 at Alexander Avenue (after the Vista Point). At the bottom of the exit ramp, turn left to go under the freeway. On the other side of the freeway, turn right onto Conzelman Road (up the hill). Continue winding up and around the Marin Headlands, passing a number of historic military batteries along the way. After one mile you will come to a traffic roundabout, where you will take the first turn-off to the right. This is McCullough Road, which you will take down the hill to Bunker Road. Turn left onto Bunker Road and drive for about 2.5 miles. Follow the lagoon and then turn right to the hill. Direction Map: http://www.marinemammalcenter.org/visiting-us/directions.html#map


PARKING: Multiple free parking areas near the center.

REFERENCES:

Marine Mammal Center: http://www.marinemammalcenter.org/

Battery Townsley: http://www.nps.gov/goga/learn/historyculture/battery-townsley.htm

Safety Disclaimer: The organizers of this meet-up are unpaid volunteers and not expert hiking guides. All participants agree to assume 100% responsibility for their own safety, conduct, and well-being and recognize that possible hazards exist while participating in outdoor (or any other) activities, and agree to participate solely at their own risk. If you RSVP “Yes” and/or attend any of our events, it shall be conclusively presumed that you understand and agree to this policy.
how_to_find_us: Marine Mammal Center Lobby
name: Marine Mammal Center Tour and Marin Headlands Easy Hike

We will meet at 1030 and sail before 1100, returning at around 1500 hours, stopping for lunch.

We will experience many different wind and sea conditions and try all the points of sail.

Please bring a sweater and a jacket for when it cools off. Bring foul weather gear and it is require for you to wear non-marking soled shoes.

You may participate in the sailing of the boat as much, or as little, as you desire.

I have ginger ale and bottled water on board. Please bring a snack to share and whatever beverage you prefer - No RED wine, blueberries, or other things that stain.

Willin' is a big, modern, safe, well-equipped, well-maintained yacht with full electronics and instrumentation. We will not be pushing her to her limits and we will enjoy a safe, comfortable sail. I will control the RSVP and waiting lists to ensure that we have a good mix of newbies and experienced sailors.

There will be a half-hour orientation to get you familiar with the boat and safety procedures prior to leaving.

Your forty dollar donation will help defray expenses.

If you do not answer the contact information questions, we will have to move you to the "Waiting List" until we have that information, as we cannot confirm your reservation without it.

OK. Let's go sailing and have some fun.
name: Sail for Newbies from Pier 40 in SF on Saturday, May 30th

description:

It is a moderate hike although may prove challenging for those new to hiking. Here's a great description of the entire hike: http://www.bahiker.com/northbayhikes/stinson.html.

This hike really does have it all: waterfalls, redwood, Douglas fir, and oak forests, grassland, canyons, and wonderful views. You will definitely want to bring your camera.

What to bring:

Shoes with good traction

Water

Snacks & Lunch

Sunscreen/Hat/Layers

Map (http://www.parks.ca.gov/pages/471/files/MtTamFinalWebLayout121214.pdf)

Getting There

The address should lead you to the head of the trail. Park on the side of the road. Do note that we will wait until exactly 10:45 and then hit the trail. Introductions will begin at 10:15.

I had some issues with Google Maps, so verify you're headed to the trail head and not somewhere else. The exact GPS Coordinates are:

Latitude 37°53'58.61"N
Longitude 122°38'14.42"W

description:

Check in at the shop and meet on the putting green by the 1st tee at 10:15AM. I will make group assignments on Friday, and we can adjust on Saturday morning if necessary. The first and third person in the assignment should check out the cart.

http://www.franklincanyongolf.com/course/


The 6,594-yard championship course designed by legendary golf course architect Robert Muir Graves features many fun and challenging holes highlighted by: two ponds, several tight doglegs, and large undulating greens that encourage precise tee shots to keep your score low and test your golf skills. Each hole at Franklin Canyon Golf Course is truly unique and refreshing. At Franklin Canyon Golf Course, we exceed our guests' expectations through our attention to detail, outstanding course and clubhouse conditions, and professional service


DIRECTIONS:


FROM SAN FRANCISCO:
Go east across the Bay Bridge, then take I-80 East. Go to Hwy. 4 East, towards Stockton. Go east about 4 miles on Hwy.4, and the entrance to the golf club will be on the right hand side.
FROM I-680:
Go west 8 miles on Hwy. 4 West. Take the Franklin Canyon exit, ,make a left at the end of the exit go under thr freeway. Make a left onto Hwy 4 going east we are on the right hand side. Make a right turn into our parking lot.

DRESS POLICY:
Collared shirts are not required. T-shirts are allowed.
Denim jeans allowed. Shorts must be Bermuda-length.
INAPPROPRIATE ATTIRE:
Tank tops or Cut-offs.
GOLF SPIKE RULE:
Soft spikes only. Changeovers are $12.95.
Tennis shoes also allowed.

description:
Join fellow writers for a marathon session of focused writing. With this location we ALWAYS advise prompt arrival if you need electrical outlet access.

Hosted by Ilah.

10:00am - Check-in, Introductions, PLACE LUNCH ORDER AND PAY FOR IT AND TELL MO'JOE WHAT TIME YOU'D LIKE IT READY. They have been very accommodating.

10:15am - Write for one hour and forty-five minutes

12:00pm - Lunch break, check-in, and socializing

12:30pm - Write for one-and-a-half hours

02:00pm - Check-in, beverage/snack, chat

02:30pm - Write for one-and-a-half hours

04:00pm - Session dismissed. Keep writing or start talking.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for some marathon sessions, 4.5 hour or more of focused writing!

1) Please try to arrive a bit early to get a seat with the group.

2) Order something from Mo's - we want to keep them happy and keep coming back! And be sure to have lunch here as well, then they'll really like us.

3) If you arrive late try not to disrupt the writing flow. Find a seat somewhere, start writing, and we'll check in with you at the next break.

4) During breaks, make sure to purchase something from the cafe if you can. That will cause them to want us to come back again and again.

5) If you can't make it, please un-RSVP at least a few days in
advance if at all possible. Late RSVP changers have prevented eager writers from attending past overly subscribed Marathons!
how_to_find_us: Look for Ilah with the sign.
name: Shut Up & Write! East Bay Marathon

description:

The purpose of this build day is to get all of the talented engineers, builders, developers, and hackers into our lab for experiments and projects with the leftover scrap from our production runs[masked]). Lots of this stuff has been taken apart and is in various states of dis-repair. However all kinds of things can be built from this leftover "junk". If you attend you are guaranteed the pick of our scrapyard! After a quick inventory of what is available it is certain that several "frankenstein" underwater robots can be created from this lot.

Also, please let your imagination run wild! Although building an underwater robot is the most viable option, any number of creative ideas could be used to re-purpose these raw materials. We plan to open our on-line store during the event in case anyone needs to purchase "new" items that we have on hand. If you have specific plans feel free to bring them and your own tools (We have some, but probably not enough for everyone). There will be some ROV "Master Builders" on hand to assist you with your project too!

We look forward to seeing you there! Please try to RSVP if you plan to attend. OpenROV HQ is located at 600 Addison..(follow the signs in the back to OpenROV HQ)

description:
Welcome to our Improv Class,

Classes are offered on a dana (generosity) basis and meet on Saturdays from 10am-1pm in the Parish Hall behind the Good Shepherd Episcopal Church on 9th Street at Hearst in Berkeley, CA.

Newcomers are welcome to attend any class.

Please contact Mike Dempsey with any questions or concerns.

In the meantime, I leave you with the following food for thought:
“Give up planning. Clear your mind instead of filling it. … To improvise, it is essential that we use the present moment efficiently. An instant of distraction — searching for a witty line, for example — robs us of our investment in what is actually happening. We need to know everything about *this* moment. Instead of preparing an outcome, ready yourself for whatever may come. Open your eyes, breathe fully, and attend to just this moment. Make it your world. Allow planning or thinking-ahead thoughts to pass through if they occur. If your mind gets absorbed in these thoughts … redirect your attention to a detail in the immediate environment. … Substitute attention for preparation.” — Patricia Madsen

“If you have the opportunity to play this game of life, you need to appreciate every moment. A lot of people don’t appreciate the moment until it’s passed.” — Kanye West ;)

-Michael Dempsey
name: Improv Theatre Class

description:
Join us May 31 when we watch a classic of silent cinema, Pan by Norwegian director Harold Schwenzen, presented with live musical accompaniment.

"This brilliant film adaptation of Nobel Prize-winning author Knut Hamsun's famous 1894 novel Pan was scripted and directed by Harald Schwenzen, a talented young actor. It was his directorial debut--a masterpiece--and although he never directed another, Pan is so exquisitely rendered and psychologically astute it has secured Schwenzen's reputation in cinema history. Schwenzen wrote in the film’s original program, 'The task we have given ourselves is to make a beautiful and artistic pictorialization of Hamsun’s strangest story. Outwardly, there is no strong plot in Pan which could possibly tempt us, but the book is, with its powerful beauty and lyricism, so rich in atmosphere, so characteristic and strong in its human descriptions, that it offers both the director and the actors a very special artistic task. If we have succeeded, through our images, together with excerpts of Hamsun's text, to give life to these people and this atmosphere, as in the book, then we have fulfilled the great task we set for ourselves.'"

Live musical accompaniment by Guenter Buchwald

Introduced by Bent Kvalvik of the National Library of Norway.

More information: www.thecastrotheatre.com and www.silentfilm.org

8:45 Meet at the Castro Theatre (429 Castro St. at Market) to purchase tickets, then walk around the corner to Starbucks [masked]th St.) for coffee and conversation.

9:15 Return to the Castro Theatre to take our seats. The film starts at 9:30.

11:30 After the film we will meet at Cafe Flor (2298 Market at 16th St.) for conversation and refreshments.

name: Norwegian silent film classic, "Pan," with live musical accompaniment

description:
This is a lovely little walk for a full moon. We'll travel along a fire road that has very little elevation gain (approx 300') and provides a reasonably level surface for night walking. We'll only be walking 3 - 4 miles, at a leisurely pace for enjoying the changing light, as the sun sets and the moon rises. If the weather is right, we may be treated to a beautiful twilight, with great photo ops.


Our destination will be at a place where we can see the moon reflecting on the water and take a snack break, before heading back. You may want to bring something to sit on and insect repellent. The road runs beside a marsh, which could mean skeeters!

Event duration: 2+ hours


Moonrise will be at 6:38 pm and sunset at 8:25 pm.


Here's a link to a pdf map of the preserve: http://www.marincounty.org/~/media/Images/Departments/PK/Open%20Space/Rush%20Creek/RushCreek062914.pdf


Directions to the trail head:

- From US 101 exit San Marin Drive/Atherton Avenue in Novato.

- Go east on Atherton Ave.

- (If coming from the north, you'll pass the freeway on-ramp on the left.) Make the next left, onto Binford Rd. (frontage road), and pass the Park and Ride lot.

- Park on either side of Binford Rd, near the Open Space gate on the right.


We try to combine enjoyment of the trail with respect for everyone’s time, walking at a steady pace. If you're in the lead, you may end up waiting at trail junctions. If you're in the back, we ask that you do your best to keep up with the group. At waiting points, the group may move on as soon as you're within sight. Our pace averages 2.5 - 3 mph, but for this event we'll aim for 2.5. We do get separated from time to time, as everyone walks at their own pace, but please bear in mind that you should be able to stay within a reasonable distance from the group. Please make sure this is something you're prepared for and will enjoy.

TO BRING: Water, snack, perhaps something to share with others, something to sit on (optional, of course), headlamp and/or flashlight (preferably with red filter), wine/beer if you wish, and even a well-behaved dog, if you happen to have one. :-)


Please check your email the night before, just in case there are any necessary adjustments to the hike details. Cancellations, or any changes, will be posted by 10pm the previous evening.

Give yourself plenty of time to find the trail head so that you arrive prior to the scheduled departure time.


Wear comfortable hiking shoes with good rugged soles.

Facilities: None, other than natural facilitrees. Be aware of poison oak!


Well behaved dogs on leash are welcome.

Dress in layers.
how_to_find_us: We will meet at the trail head.
name: Full Moonlight hike at Rush Creek Preserve, Novato

description:
We'll start walking at 7:00 pm since sunset is at 8:25 pm. We'll walk along El Camino Del Mar to pass by USS San Francisco Memorial. Then follow the fire trail to make our way towards the VA Medical Center and Legion of Honor. This trail can get a bit spooky due to the narrower trail, tall and over flowing foliage and low branch canopy. There's some wood stairs here we can climb also. We'll follow the trail all the way to the other end where Eagles Point is. Then loop back down towards the visitors center along the Coastal Trail and Lands End Trail to take us back to our meeting spot. This walk is marked as easy to moderate due to walking up/down hills & stairs and is about 2 miles round trip. For safety reasons, this will be an on-leash walk once it starts to get dark (perhaps about 15 mins after sunset, we don't want to trip over anyone's puppy). We'll be rewarded with an "almost" full moon on this walk! Orooooo!!... (the official full moon is coming up on Tuesday, June 2, - it's a little hard for me to schedule doggy social walks during the week due to work)


Mandatory: Flashlight(s), sturdy walking shoes and jacket/hoodie (it gets windy here!) Optional: You and/or your pup in safety/reflective/blinking light items or clothing. Remember water and snacks as needed for you and your bff and also cleanup bags. There's parking spots along El Camino Del Mar. Any questions send me an email or add a comment.

Sunset is 8:25 pm.

P.S. Meeting spot across from the corner of El Camino Del Mar and Seal Rock Dr street sign is located NORTH EAST of "main parking lot" where Lands End Visitor Center is.

P.P.S. You are responsible for your own and your pups' safety on this walk. See "About Us" on the left nav bar for more info.

See you at sunset at Lands End!
--Karen H and Molly

(street sign reference. meet across the street from this sign.)
how_to_find_us: Meet on the path across from the corner of El Camino Del Mar and Seal Rock Dr (see last pic below). There's parking spots here.
name: Lands End Fire Trail Sunset & "Almost" Full Moon Walk

description:
We all long for closeness and connection. How does that get broken in families? Modern neuro-scientists understand that closeness and connection is an inherent part of the human experience. In families where closeness has caused hurt, we can lose touch with the easy availability of intimacy. Constellation work re-establishes that intimacy, making it available for all of us.

We will have two family constellations. We meet from 6:30-9:30pm. Let me know if you are interested in being a client or a participant.

Please come a little early! It helps our process immensely when we can start on time, and not have interruptions in the constellations as people arrive.

Cost: Only $5.00 for participants.

Parking: There is ample parking around Rudramandir, particularly WEST of 6th Street. However, out of respect for the residential neighbors, they ask that guests follow these guidelines:

Park directly in front of the building or on 6th Street between Bancroft Way and Addison (the block north of our building, towards University).

Park on Bancroft Way, between 6th and 4th Streets (west of 6th).

Park on 5th and 4th Streets between Channing and Addison.

PLEASE DO NOT PARK EAST OF 6TH STREET. Those streets are in a residential area and parking is reserved for our neighbors.

Also, please be careful NOT to block driveways. For a parking map go to http://rudramandir.com/files/uploads/Parkin....

description:
Sanctuary Shelter is one of the emergency shelters run by Episcopal Community Services (ECS). This shelter is a bit smaller than Next Door Shelter but does just as much good! In addition to serving two meals a day to their clients, Sanctuary Shelter offers various in house activities including gardening and art groups. They have an awesome community garden located in the parking lot right out side the kitchen.

We will be serving one dinner shift that starts at 6:30pm. We will also help with set up and clean up. Please wear close toed shoes and PLEASE arrive at 6pm. We get the ball rolling fairly quickly and it helps if we are all there at the same time.

Thank you everyone for your continued support in supplying ECS with much needed helping hands!
name: Sunday - Help Serve Food at Sanctuary Shelter

description:
This new class gets our stamp of approval! Those of you crafts enthusiasts, look no further for a quality Sunday afternoon. Linh, the Art therapist from Arts & Imagery Program at Stanford Health Care, will guide you through the process of making your very own rubber stamp, which you will be taking home after the session. Sign up now: http://bit.ly/LFNStamp

15% off [with promotion code: LFNAFA] for any future classes you sign up from LFN!

This workshop is perfect for those who want to learn the essentials of rubber carving , beginning crafters or sophisticated stampers. You will learn to create your own stamp using your own design or a design you found elsewhere and find unlimited options for making quick and appealing gifts suitable for any occasion. You will learn easy techniques for creating unique and beautiful creative expressions. Create one-of-a-kind stamps as gifts.

* Control of the knife/cutter and techniques for more intricate designs using simple tools

* Transferring design onto rubber blocks

* Take-home: Finished rubber stamps, common paper penknife, U-cutter, handmade greeting card w/ envelope.
name: [LFN] Stamp of Approval! Rubber Stamp-Making

description:
Forgiveness and particularly self-forgiveness is a critical step in the path of healing.

Phase 1: Identification and/or Activation

During this phase, we will activate and bring to surface a situation, event, etc., that can heal through the process of forgiveness, either forgiveness for ourselves or for others.

Phase 2: Drawing

During this second phase, we will take time to draw out what was identified and/or activated using simple drawing materials. It is not about the quality of drawing but rather the translation of our emotions and intention onto paper.

Phase 3: Healing

During this phase, we will utilize healing techniques such as Emotional Freedom Technique tapping and/or Light Meditation to heal the issue or issues that can benefit from a healing transformation.

Phase 4: Transformation

Lastly, we will take time to revisit our drawing to make any potential shifts as a result of our intention and the follow up healing.

The meet up will involve conversation. The office is a beautiful space and I do my best to provide you with a non-judgmental environment to best facilitate a healing shift.


Thank you so much, I do hope to see you there. The meeting is at no cost to you, however, donations are most welcome.

Love and Light,

Tamara

Moonlit Soul Healing
A hypnotherapy, shamanic, and energy therapy practice
Tamara Nakhjavani, CCHT, Reiki Master
Tel:[masked]
www.moonlitsoulhealing.com

Yelp: http://bit.ly/1ACKdcW
Facebook: http://on.fb.me/1E6sVsR

description:
San Francisco Magic The Gathering Casual Players

HeyheyheyHEY!

We HAVE MOVED!


Yes that's right, we have moved BACK to Pizza Orgasmica for our weekly escapades. From now on, join us every Sunday evening WITHOUT FAIL at

Pizza Orgasmica
823 Clement Street
Richmond District
San Francisco
(415)[masked]
(9th and Clement)

WHY, you may ask, have we moved back?

They have a brand spankin' new General Manager Ken, (to whom you should all be nice) who has agreed to let us stay in the side room till 11-11:30 on Sunday evenings. They have lowered their beer prices. You can get a pint of craft beer for 4$, and a Beer AND a shot of Fireball for 6. Holy smokes! Their food is reasonably priced. No more 15$ Macaroni and Cheese, although it was incredibly delicious! They have Light! They have room! They have no loud music! There's an important caveat: WE MUST PURCHASE SOMETHING. Food, booze, you name it. But please don't come play with us if you are only going to buy a soda. They are totally cool with us moving back to play there (at this point the best place in the city, maybe even better than Kennedy's. Of course, you all knew that; please support the place that's gonna allow us to play cards for the foreseeable future.

We are also starting a little earlier, at 5pm to give us more time to play.

The Tee Off Bar & Grill has thanked us for our patronage...they understand...please visit them too and drop in and say hello when you get a chance. We had a good run with them.

******

Even though people often don't RSVP here, there are always many people who show up and bring fun decks to play. Lately we've been having quite a few folks show up.

We play many different variants of multiplayer magic. Please, no proxies, or very few if at all possible. 60 card minimum decks, and please make sure your deck is legal in some format. We don't generally play EDH (Commander) but that's only because not everyone has an EDH deck. But if you bring yours, I'm sure someone will be happy to play you with theirs!

We usually play

Duels Star (sometimes called Pentagonal) Anti-Star (New format!) Emperor 2-Headed Giant (or more!) Left-right Attack Assassin Team variants of each of the above! Crazy fun. And More!

Hear what others have to say about the Magic meetup!

"It sucks. These guys bring these crazy-ass decks that always beat my tournament-caliber builds."
--Bill

"Don't go. These morons think they know how to play magic, but my legacy goblin deck can kill em all. I just have to remember to bring it next time."
--Bob

"I brought a vintage deck filled with proxy moxes. I won even before my opponents got to take their first turn! How cool is that! Of course, the next game I waited around while everyone destroyed everything i had in quick succession. But that's ok, I had fun!"
--Amy

If you are looking for websites to help you with deck ideas for casual magic, here are a few that are highly recommended:

Magic Deck Vortex

Essential Magic
Especially check out the combos page...highly useful for breaking things not meant to be broken.

TappedOut

MTG Salvation
Especially check out their rumors forum here. This is where you will find out about upcoming cards and sets and other interesting tidbits.

See you at SF Casual Magic Sundays!
how_to_find_us: Look for the nerds with the cards.
name: Magic the Gathering Casual Players Meetup - Every Sunday!

group.name: San Francisco Magic The Gathering Casual Players

Directions and Parking:

860 Meridian Bay Lane, Unit 341
Foster City, CA, 94404

Callbox code '070'

This is what you are looking for: picture/map

Meridian Bay Lane is the driveway for the Meridian Bay Condo complex where I live. It's off Hillsdale Blvd, just West of the Hillsdale/Edgewater intersection. It's on the North side of Hillsdale, near a Bank of America and an Am/Pm.

If you are coming East on Hillsdale Blvd from 101 North or 101 South, make a U-turn at Edgewater. Meridian Bay Lane will be immediately on your right.

If you are coming South on Edgewater from the 92, make a right on Hillsdale Blvd. Meridian Bay will also be immediately on your right.

There is plenty of open visitor parking under the 860 building (the one on your left with the big white ‘860’ on it).

Once you park under the building, there is a silver callbox on the left-hand side. The code is 070, or if you forget the code you can look up EBERT in the callbox directory. Enter the code and it will ring me and I'll buzz you in.

Once I buzz you in, DO NOT take elevator #5 immediately on your left. Take elevator #7, which is further away on your right, to the third floor. Turn left out of the elevator and my door will be straight ahead, #341.

WARNING: Some map/GPS software seems to want to put people on Sea Spray Lane (behind the complex) instead of Meridian Bay Lane. If you find yourself on Sea Spray Lane, Don't Panic! Proceed East on Sea Spray Lane toward Edgewater, turn right on Edgewater, right again on Hillsdale, and Meridian Bay Lane will be immediately on your right.

In case you get lost or need to get hold of me for any reason, you can contact me at:

(650)[masked] (cell)
(650)[masked] (h)
[masked]

description:
Love Letters to the Dead by Ava Dellaira

Laurel chooses Kurt Cobain because her sister, May, loved him. And he died young, just like May. Soon, Laurel has a notebook full of letters to the dead—to people like Janis Joplin, Heath Ledger, Amelia Earhart, and Amy Winehouse—though she never gives a single one of them to her teacher. She writes about starting high school, navigating the choppy waters of new friendships, learning to live with her splintering family, falling in love for the first time, and, most important, trying to grieve for May. But how do you mourn for someone you haven't forgiven?


It's not until Laurel has written the truth about what happened to herself that she can finally accept what happened to May. And only when Laurel has begun to see her sister as the person she was—lovely and amazing and deeply flawed—can she truly start to discover her own path.


In a voice that's as lyrical and as true as a favorite song, Ava Dellaira writes about one girl's journey through life's challenges with a haunting and often heartbreaking beauty.
how_to_find_us: We'll be inside, holding down one of the booths.
name: May's Book: Love Letters to the Dead by Ava Dellaira

All welcome, All Levels & open to all ASL Performers: Deaf, hoh & hearing. Storytelling, Poetry, Slams, Comedy, Skits, Song Interpretations... Come try it out... (come early to sign-up if need to have music; Best if we test it to make sure it works)

facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/pages/SF-ASL-EPIC-Open-Mic-like-Signers-Open-Stage-by-ASLAP/315822408602347

Message from LA's ASL Cabaret

Mona Jean Cedar:

"This is super wonderful! You are awesome for doing this. I remember our lunch together after the ASL Showcase at the National Poetry Slams in Oakland... A million merci's to you mon amie!..."

To help; join FB group or come early....

ASL CABARET is a Los Angeles event that helped inspire us to recreate in SF;

We started a SF monthly:

-workshop

-open stage (open mic) show

and support cross-promotion of and growing artists for the

Zip Zap,

Deaf Dance Festival,

Santa Cruz ASL Poetry Festival-Eye Music

and Walnut Creek ASL Events!

ASLAP (ASL Artists & Performers)

Is an open SF Bay Area Group that wants to start a monthly cabaret (inspired by L.A. ASL cabaret) with performance on open stage (open mic like) storytelling, poetry, slams, comedy, skits, song interpretation (we will try not to bore you) all performances in American Sign Language with interpretation... all level. ASL thang for Deaf, hard of hearing and hearing... lets spread the love of ASL... please cross promote and post other events...

description:
Insulation products are being scrutinized more intensively by high performance builders, architects and designers. Ecological responsibility extends beyond energy and materials must be considered. Join our three panelists for a short introduction to their natural insulation products, followed by an open session for questions from the audience.

Schedule:
3.00pm - Intro to Passive House for new attendees
3.30pm - Regular PHCA Meeting Starts
4.15pm - Education Segment: New Products Panel
5.00pm - Networking & Beer

This meeting is free for PHCA Pro members, $5 for supporters and $10 for guests. Beer and networking included.

Presenters:
Andrew Legge - Andrew is founder and managing partner of Havelock Wool. He has a passion for all things New Zealand and seeks to leverage his experience in investment management, senior management and business development to enhance two-way trade and capital flows between the US and NZ. His interests in NZ were refined during six years living in SE Asia. Andrew is a high energy individual who is uncomfortable without entirely too much to do. Studies include University of Chicago Booth School of Business (MBA, Finance) and Hampden- Sydney College (BA, History).

Albert Rooks - Albert is the owner of The Small Planet Workshop, a product supplier based in Olympia, Washington. He believes "that 'social responsibility' and a 'profitable business' have never been mutually exclusive." Albert enjoys traveling and learning the different ways that people build all over the world. From traditional timber frames to ultra-modern Passivhaus & zero energy building, he is continually interested and inspired by various building methods. His favorite raw materials are grown or found in nature, and can be processed into building materials in a way that allows them to be recycled back into the environment without poisoning it.

Matthew K. Engelmann - is Director of Sales and Marketing at American Lime Technology. Building on entrepreneurial inclination, information science education and twelve years of manufacturing management experience, Matt spent the last four years “drinking from a firehose” directing business development and execution of product and service solutions at American Lime Technology and sister company US Heritage Group. During this time over 500 sustainable new construction, restoration, and historic preservation projects have been completed. Matt has eleven years of manufacturing management experience with focus on industrial solutions selling. He attended the University of Florida where he earned a degree in Decision and Information Science with a minor in Economics.
name: New & Natural Products Panel - Wool: Hemp: Cork

description:
The untamed and extraordinary FUTURE SHORTS short film festival edition in San Francisco presents its Spring Season. This time it's a matinee screening, for the first time giving the opportunity to have it all – attend the screening of the best shorts in town and catch up with other fun things in town afterwards.

This spring, the Future Shorts globe will bring you to UK, Canada, Bulgaria, Germany and Ireland. Seven inspiring and one-of-the-kind international short films will surely make your afternoon delightful. As always, you may be sure you will receive the top quality of the 'short cinema'.

Future Shorts Festival is the world's largest pop-up film festival involving 300 cities in 90 countries and is ever growing. It is powered by a global movie lover community. Remember that supporting this festival you become a part of something magnificent and universal. More about the festival: www.futureshorts.com

The door opens at 2.30 PM and the screening starts at 3PM. Please arrive earlier to grab a drink at the Firehouse 8 bar. The venue is located in the city center, so public transportation is highly recommended.
Tickets ($10): http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/1621557
Tickets at the door will cost $12. Sorry, no refunds.

Please support us by following and Likeing:
FB: Future-Shorts-San-Francisco; Firehouse 8
Twitter: @futureshortssf; @firehouse_8

PROGRAMME

1. MI NINA MI VIDA
Dir: Yan Giroux | Canada 2013 | 19min. | Drama
A man and his giant stuffed bear move through the bustling crowds and noisy rides at an amusement park. In the face of this strange world he can no longer relate to, Jack searches for a reason to smile… The camera follows him as he navigates this unwelcoming space, rendering a striking choreographed cinematic experience.

2. MYNARSKI DEATH PLUMMET
Dir: Matthew Rankin | Canada 2014 | 8min. | Animation / Visual
The story of Winnipeg WWII hero Andrew Mynarski is related stunningly in this explosive, expressionistic and psychedelic envisioning of his final moments, paying homage to our collective past while transforming fact into brilliant celluloid fantasia.

3. EXCHANGE AND MART
Dir: Cara Connolly & Martin Clark | UK 2013 | 15min. | Drama / Romance
A remote Scottish boarding school is home to Reg, a lonely and yearning teenage girl. The handsome chainsaw-wielding tree surgeon, and the sinister and unorthodox self-defence instructor, are the only men in this world. When Reg is required to fight in the woods, she knows what she must do.


4. TWO FILMS ABOUT LONELINESS
Dir: Christopher Eales | UK 2014 | 6min. | Animation / Comedy
Two Films About Loneliness is a split-screen stop-motion animated film. The split screen divides the worlds of Jonathan Smallman who is recording his dating profile, and Philip Button, the Internet chef. But will the irritating sound from the real world stand in the way of their search for companionship and acceptance?

5. PRIDE
Dir: Pavel G. Vesnakov | Bulgaria, Germany 2013 | 30min. | Drama
Manol, a retired grandfather, is a patriarch of firm morals and fixed beliefs which he has always upheld in his household. But on this day he learns that the boy he's raised is gay. The life choices of his loved ones challenge his values in a battle he has lost by default.

6. BRODINSKI FT SD 'CAN'T HELP MYSELF'
Dir: Megaforce | UK 2014 | 4min. | Music Video / Cinematic
Techno-rap group Brondinski present their video, directed by Megaforce, which juxtaposes the reckless abandon of a drug-fueled life with a man's journey back through time in a dystopian cinescape.

7. THE MISSING SCARF
Dir: Eoin Duffy | Ireland 2013 | 6min. | Animation / Comedy
A black comedy exploring some of life's common fears: fear of the unknown, of failure, rejection and finally the fear of death. Narrated by George Takei.
